title: United States Roving Ambassador Aboard Liner President Cleveland
Scopenote: United States Ambassador-at-large Philip C. Jessup (right) with unidentified woman aboard the cruise liner President Cleveland. The destination of the liner was the Far East.

title: Vernice Anderson Aboard the Liner President Cleveland
Scopenote: Vernice Anderson (right) aboard the liner President Cleveland with James B. Lindsey (left). Ms. Anderson was sailing with Ambassador-at-Large Philip Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: Aboard the Liner President Cleveland
Scopenote: A band playing aboard the S.S. President Cleveland upon its departure from Los Angeles, California, heading for Hawaii.  All individuals are unidentified.

title: Aboard the Liner S.S. President Cleveland
Scopenote: Vernice Anderson (left) with Louise (Mrs. Philip C.) Jessup, wife of the United States Ambassador-at-Large (center), and Charles Vines (right)  aboard the ship S.S. President Cleveland. They are heading to Hawaii.

title: S.S. President Cleveland Departing From San Francisco
Scopenote: The liner S.S. President Cleveland departing from San Francisco, California.  The liner's next destination was Los Angeles, California. Vernice Anderson was on board, sailing with Ambassador-at-Large Philip Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: S.S. President Cleveland Departing From San Francisco
Scopenote: S.S. President Cleveland setting sail to Los Angeles, California after departing from San Francisco, California.  The Golden Gate Bridge of San Francisco can be seen in the background. Vernice Anderson was on board, sailing with Ambassador-at-Large Philip Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: S.S. President Cleveland Departing From San Francisco
Scopenote: S.S. President Cleveland setting sail to Los Angeles, California, after departing from San Francisco, California. The Golden Gate Bridge of San Francisco can be seen in the background. Vernice Anderson was on board, sailing with Ambassador-at-Large Philip Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: S.S. President Cleveland Departing From San Francisco
Scopenote: Cruise Liner S.S. President Cleveland setting sail for Los Angeles, California, after departing from San Francisco, California. The Golden Gate Bridge of San Francisco can be seen in the background. Vernice Anderson was on board, sailing with Ambassador-at-Large Philip Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: Bon Voyage To the S.S. President Cleveland
Scopenote: The friends and families of those aboard the S. S. President Cleveland bid farewell as the ship departs from San Francisco, California. All individuals are unidentified. Vernice Anderson was on board, sailing with Ambassador-at-Large Philip Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: S.S. President Cleveland Departing From San Francisco
Scopenote: The cruise liner S.S. President Cleveland sets sail towards Los Angeles, California after departing from San Francisco, California.  The photographed individual is unidentified. Vernice Anderson was on board, sailing with Ambassador-at-Large Philip Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: Ambassador Jessup at Sanjusangendo Temple
Scopenote: Ambassador-at-large Philip C. Jessup and his party visiting Sanjusangendo Temple in Kyoto, Japan. From left to right: American Vice Consul James B. Lindsey, Ambassador Jessup (foreground), Lois (Mrs. Philip C.) Jessup (third from left), Dr. Charles N. Spinks, Mr. William M. Gibson, and unidentified Japanese attendant (right). Ambassador Jessup visited Kyoto as part of his larger mission to the Far East.

title: India Edwards With Congresswoman Kelly
Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Vice Chairman, Democratic National Committee (right), with Congresswoman Edna Kelly of New York (left) at an unidentified event.

title: Democratic National Committee Officials
Scopenote: Three prominent Democratic National Committee officials during an unidentified event. Left to right: Mr. William Boyle, Jr., former Chairman; Mrs. India Edwards, Vice Chairman; and Mr. Frank McKinney, Chairman.

title: India Edwards With Chairman Boyle
Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Executive Director of the Women's Division of the Democratic National Committee (left) shaking hands with Mr. William Boyle, Jr., Chairman of the Democratic National Committee (right). Original photo contains crop marks.

title: India Edwards with Governor McMath
Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Democratic National Committee official (right), with Governor Sid McMath of Arkansas (left).  McMath is presenting Edwards with the Arkansas Traveler Award.

title: Party Hosted by India Edwards
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman attends a party given by Mrs. India Edwards, Vice-Chairman, Democratic National Committee (DNC).  Left to Right: Wilson Wyatt, co-chairman of Americans for Democratic  Action; President Truman; Perle Mesta, Minister to Luxembourg; Eda (Mrs. Charles) Brannan; William Boyle Jr., Chairman, Democratic National Committee; and Edwards (far right).

title: India Edwards and New York Mayor Impellitteri
Scopenote: India Edwards, Vice Chairman of the Democratic National Committee (DNC) (center), with New York City Mayor Vincent Impellitteri (right) and Frank McKinney, Chairman, DNC (left).

title: India Edwards with Katie Louchheim
Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, former Vice Chairman of the Democratic National Committee (DNC) (right), with Katie Louchheim, Vice Chairman of the DNC.

title: Women's Luncheon in Geneva
Scopenote: Luncheon of women delegates and alternates and advisers to the World Health Organization in Geneva, Switzerland.  Mrs. India Edwards, Vice-Chairman, Democratic National Committee (left side, third back).  All other individuals are unidentified.

title: Delegates of the World Health Organization
Scopenote: World Health Organization delegates, Dr. Klaar (far left), Mrs. India Edwards (second left), and Surgeon General of the United States Dr. Leonard Scheele (second right), at a reception given by American delegation in Geneva Switzerland.  Also pictured is Assistant Secretary of State Edward Barrett (far right).

title: India Edwards with the First Lady and First Daughter

Truman at a party given by journalist Esther Van Wagoner Tufty in Washington, D.C. in honor of India Edwards, Executive Director of the Women's Division of the Democratic Party. From left to right: Margaret Truman, Esther Tufty, India Edwards, Eda (Mrs. Charles) Brannan, and Mrs. Truman.

Scopenote: American Ambassador-at-large Philip C. Jessup (center) with Dr. Charles N. Spinks (right) visiting a Yokoyama art shop in Kyoto, Japan. All other individuals are unidentified.

title: Reception for Newly Appointed Diplomats

title: India Edwards with 1968 Democratic Candidates

Miller, oldest Democratic delegate from Slippery Rock, Pennsylvania (far right).

title: Battery D 36th Anniversary Meeting
Scopenote: The 36th anniversary meeting of the Battery "D", which President Harry S. Truman (back row, second right) attended.  The meeting was held at the George Muehlebach Brewing Company in Kansas City, Missouri.  All other individuals are unidentified.

title: American Bicentennial Gathering of Veterans of World War One

Clark; and Mrs. Gladys Tillett.

Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Vice-Chairman, Democratic National Convention (left), greeting the United States Ambassador to Denmark, Eugenie Anderson (right).  All other individuals are unidentified.

title: First Official Duty of the New Secretary of Agriculture
Scopenote: One of the first official duties of the newly appointed Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan (first row, center) was to sign the second largest wheat crop in history. (back row, left to right) Robert C. Tetro, Secretary of Outlook and Situation Board; Edward Paxton, Statistician for the State of Utah; J.E. Palleson, Secretary of the Board; Charles E. Burkhead, Head of Field Crops Statistics; and unidentified member of the Board.

From left to right: Associate Justice Clark; Vice President Alben Barkley; Attorney General J. Howard McGrath; Speaker of the House Sam Rayburn; President Truman; and Chief Justice Fred Vinson. Also pictured: Secretary of State Dean Acheson (background, left, behind Barkley); and Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson (background, right, behind Vinson, mostly obscured).

title: Secretaries Greet Conference Members
Scopenote: Secretary of Agriculture Charles F. Brannan (right) and Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (second from right) greet unidentified members of the U.N. World Conservation Conference during a reception at the Department of the Interior.

title: Reception at the Department of Interior
Scopenote: From left to right: unidentified; Under Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Arthur Demaray, Associate Director, National Park Service; Arthur Goldschmidt, Special Assistant to the Secretary; and Robert Day, Assistant to the Secretary at a reception for the members of the U.N. World Conservation Conference.

title: Krug Receives Interior Staff
Scopenote: Former Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (left, facing camera) greets Interior staff as they enter the Department of the Interior auditorium.  They are in attendance for the swearing-in of Oscar Chapman as Secretary of the Interior.  Also pictured: Clarence Forsling, Chairman, Southwest Field Committee, Department of the Interior (tall man, near center, in front of window).  All others unidentified.

title: Krug Greets Interior Staff
Scopenote: Former Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (left) greets Interior staff as they file into the Department of the Interior auditorium.  Also pictured: Administrative Assistant Secretary of the Interior Vernon Northrop (background, right of Krug).  All others unidentified.

title: Chapman Sworn-In as Secretary
Scopenote: Oscar Chapman shakes hands with Julius A. Krug (center), former Secretary of the Interior, and Chief Justice Fred Vinson (right) after being sworn in as Secretary of the Interior.

title: Chapman Sworn-In as Secretary
Scopenote: Oscar Chapman being sworn in as Secretary of the Interior. Pictured, left to right: Oscar Chapman; Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman; Supreme Court Chief Justice Fred Vinson.

title: Chapman Sworn-In as Secretary
Scopenote: Oscar Chapman being sworn in as Secretary of the Interior. Pictured, left to right: Oscar Chapman; Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman; Supreme Court Chief Justice Fred Vinson.

title: Oscar and Mrs. Chapman with Unidentified Women
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (second row, fourth from right) and Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman (second row, fourth from left) pose for a picture with unidentified women in the Secretary's office.

title: Ambassador Philip C. Jessup in Seoul
Scopenote: United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup (left) with United States Ambassador to the Republic of Korea, John J. Muccio (second from left) in Seoul. All other individuals are unidentified.

Scopenote: Oscar Chapman sits for his official portrait as Secretary of the Interior.

All others unidentified.

All others unidentified.

title: Truman Returns from Key West

Pictured, foreground, left to right: President Truman; Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; and Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson.  All others are unidentified.

title: Ambassador Jessup Addressing Korean National Assembly

All others unidentified.

All others unidentified.

Scopenote: Seated, left to right: Rosa Gonzalez Videla; President Harry S. Truman; President Gabriel Gonzalez Videla of Chile; and First Lady Bess W. All others unidentified.

title: White House Renovations
Scopenote: Southwest view from the east basement entrance of White House during renovation. The Allis Chalmers Cletrac Diesel-powered shovel is being used to excavate below the basement floor. The earth is carried outside the opening in the south wall and loaded on trucks by a truck crane. Same as 71-285.

title: South Portico During White House Renovations
Scopenote: View of south front of the White House and a storage building housing special exhibits during renovations.  Taken during a visit by members of the Institute of Architects during a convention in Washington, D. C.

Scopenote: Vice President Alben Barkley speaks during the "I Am An American" Day program in front of the United States Capitol.  All others unidentified.

title: I Am An American Day Program
Scopenote: View of the speakers' platform, the band, and the crowd at the "I Am An American" Day program in front of the United States Capitol Building.  The speaker and all other people are unidentified.

Scopenote: Vice President Alben Barkley (second from right) and Jane (Mrs. Alben) Barkley (right) with an unidentified man and girl at the "I Am An American" Day program in front of the United States Capitol.

Scopenote: Vice President Alben Barkley (left) and Jane (Mrs. Alben) Barkley (right) with an unidentified girl at the "I Am An American" Day program which took place in front of the United States Capitol Building.

title: Truman Addresses Joint Session of Congress
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing at podium) delivering his State of the Union address to a joint session of Congress, with Cabinet members present.

title: Brotherhood Dinner
Scopenote: From left to right: Supreme Court Justice Hugo Black; Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman; Chief Justice Fred Vinson; and Vice President Alben Barkley at a Brotherhood dinner in honor of Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman at the Mayflower Hotel. The dinner was sponsored by the National Conference of Christians and Jews. Man in background unidentified.

title: Brotherhood Dinner
Scopenote: Vice President Alben Barkley (at podium) speaks during a Brotherhood dinner in honor of Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (second from right) at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D. C.  Also pictured: Chief Justice Fred Vinson (left); and Jane (Mrs. Alben) Barkley (right). The dinner was sponsored by the National Conference of Christians and Jews. Man in background unidentified.

Girard Davidson; Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Assistant Secretary of the Interior Dale Doty; and Administrative Assistant Secretary of the Interior Vernon Northrop in the Secretary's office after Doty's swearing-in ceremony.

title: Doty Appointed Assistant Secretary
Scopenote: Assistant Secretary of the Interior Dale Doty (second from right) and unidentified family pose with Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (left) after Doty's swearing-in ceremony.

All others unidentified.

O'Mahoney; Administrative Assistant Secretary of the Interior Vernon Northrop; and Assistant Secretary of the Interior William Warne.  All others unidentified.

title: Garden in Taipei, Taiwan
Scopenote: Scenic photo of the terrace and garden of Mr. McCarthy. This photo was taken by Vernice Anderson when she traveled with Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

Scopenote: Floyd Dotson, Chief Clerk, Department of the Interior (center) swears-in Dale Doty (right) as Assistant Secretary of the Interior.  Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman looks on.

Scopenote: Administrative Assistant Secretary Vernon Northrop (second from right) and family pose with Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (left) after Assistant Secretary of the Interior Dale Doty's swearing-in ceremony.

Howard McGrath; Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman.

title: Leslie Coffelt Funeral Services
Scopenote: The cortege bearing the flag-draped coffin of Private Leslie Coffelt during funeral services at Arlington National Cemetery.  Coffelt was killed while protecting President Harry S. Truman from an assassination attempt at Blair House on November 1, 1950.

title: Leslie Coffelt Funeral
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center group, front) and First Lady Bess W. Truman (center group, center) at Arlington National Cemetery, attending funeral services for Private Leslie Coffelt of the White House Police, who was killed while protecting President Truman from an assassination attempt on November 1. Walking behind President and Mrs. Truman are (left to right) General Robert Landry, General Harry Vaughan, and General Wallace Graham. All others are unidentified.

title: Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup's Farewell to Taipei

title: Leslie Coffelt Funeral Services

title: Leslie Coffelt Funeral Services

Watkins; Senator Carl Hayden; Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; President Truman; Senator Joseph C. O'Mahoney; Congressman John R. Murdock (standing); Senator Zales Ecton; and unidentified. Scopenote: Left to right: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; President Harry S. Truman; Congressman John R. Murdock; and Senator Joseph C. title: Auriol Receives Key to City
Scopenote: President of France Vincent Auriol (left) receives a key to Washington, D.C. from District Commissioner John R. Young during a welcoming ceremony outside the District Building.  All others unidentified.

title: Welcoming Ceremony for President Auriol
Scopenote: An unidentified man speaks at the welcoming ceremony for President of France Vincent Auriol in front of the District Building. Front row, left to right: Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan; Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Attorney General J. Howard McGrath; Secretary of Defense George Marshall; French Ambassador to the United States Henri Bonnet; Vice President Alben Barkley; French Foreign Minister Robert Schuman; President Truman; French President Auriol; and District Commissioner John R. Young. Seated in the front row on the right side of the speaker are, from left to right: First Lady Bess W. Truman; Michelle (Mrs. Vincent) Auriol; Jane (Mrs. Alben) Barkley; Helle (Mrs. Henri) Bonnet; Margaret Truman; Alice (Mrs. Dean) Acheson; Estelle (Mrs. J. Howard) McGrath; and Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman. All others are unidentified.

title: Welcoming Ceremony for President Auriol
Scopenote: From left to right: Secretary of Defense George Marshall; French Ambassador to the United States Henri Bonnet; Vice President Alben Barkley; President Harry S. Truman; Secretary of State Dean Acheson; President of France Vincent Auriol; French Foreign Minister Robert Schuman; District Commissioner John R. Young; and  an unidentified man at the welcoming ceremony for President Auriol outside the District Building.  All others are unidentified.

title: Welcoming Ceremony for President Auriol
Scopenote: President of France Vincent Auriol (at podium) speaks at a welcoming ceremony in his honor outside the District Building.  Front row, left to right: Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan; Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Attorney General J. Howard McGrath; Secretary of Defense George Marshall; French Ambassador to the United States Henri Bonnet (leaning behind Barkley); Vice President Alben Barkley; French Foreign Minister Robert Schuman; President Harry S. Truman; District Commissioner John R. Young; and an unidentified man.  Front row, right of podium, left to right: First Lady Bess W. Truman; Michelle (Mrs. Vincent) Auriol (behind column); and Jane (Mrs. Alben) Barkley.  All others unidentified.

title: Welcoming Ceremony for President Auriol
Scopenote: Attendees at the welcoming ceremony for President Auriol of France stand for the playing of the National Anthem.  Front row, left to right: Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan; Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Attorney General J. Howard McGrath; Secretary of Defense George Marshall; French Ambassador to the United States Henri Bonnet; President Harry S. Truman; President of France Vincent Auriol; District Commissioner John R. Young, and unidentified man.  Front row, right of podium, left to right: First Lady Bess W. Truman; Michelle (Mrs. Vincent) Auriol; Jane (Mrs. Alben) Barkley; Helle (Mrs. Henri) Bonnet; Margaret Truman; Alice (Mrs. Dean) Acheson; Estelle (Mrs. J. Howard) McGrath; and Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman.  Secretary of State Dean Acheson is in second row behind President Auriol.  All others unidentified.

title: President Auriol Receives Gifts
Scopenote: From left to right: President Harry S. Truman; French Ambassador Henri Bonnet; President of France Vincent Auriol; and Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman look at an album of National Park pictures that President Truman gave to President Auriol.  W. Averell Harriman, Special Assistant to the President (standing, left), looks on.  All others unidentified.

title: Deputy Administrators Sworn In

title: Lunch with Secretaries and Park Service Directors

At table, clockwise from bottom right: Ronald F. Lee, Assistant Director, National Park Service; Alfrida (Mrs. Arthur) Demaray; Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Charlotte (Mrs. Hillory) Tolson; Administrative Assistant Secretary of the Interior Vernon Northrop; Joel D. Wolfsohn, Assistant to the Secretary of the Interior; Jean (Mrs. Ronald) Lee; and Arthur E. Demaray, Director, National Park Service.  Standing, left to right: Assistant Secretary of the Interior Dale Doty; Mary (Mrs. Dale) Doty; and Hillory A. Tolson, Assistant Director, National Park Service.

title: Ambassador and Mrs. Jessup in Taipei
Scopenote: United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup (far right) and Lois (Mrs. Philip C.) Jessup (center) with Emma Martin, wife of the United States Consul to Taiwan, in Taipei. title: Demaray Sworn In as Park Service Director

title: Lee Sworn In as Park Service Assistant Director
Scopenote: Floyd Dotson, Chief Clerk of the Department of the Interior (left) swears-in Ronald F. Lee (center) as Assistant Director of the National Park Service.  Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman looks on.

title: Cherry Blossom Queen Pageant

title: Cherry Blossom Queen Pageant

title: Cherry Blossom Queen Pageant

Pictured, front row: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (third from left); Assistant Secretary of the Interior Dale Doty (sixth from left); Mary (Mrs. Dale) Doty (seventh from left); Edward J. Kelly, Superintendent of National Capital Parks (seventh from right).  All others unidentified.

title: Crowd at Cherry Blossom Queen Pageant
Scopenote: Crowd of people seated in front of the Jefferson Memorial to watch the Cherry Blossom Queen pageant.  Pictured, front row: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (third form left); Assistant Secretary of the Interior Dale Doty (third from right); and Mary (Mrs. Dale) Doty (second from right).  All others unidentified.

title: Chapman Crowns Cherry Blossom Queen
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (left) crowns Maldi Tarris as Cherry Blossom Festival Queen.

title: Chapman Crowns Cherry Blossom Queen
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (left) crowns Maldi Tarris (center) as Cherry Blossom Festival Queen.  Man at right is unidentified.

title: School Safety Patrol Parade
Scopenote: A crowd on a platform watches the National School Safety Patrol Parade on Constitution Avenue in Washington, D.C. Pictured: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (first row, fifth from right) and son, James Chapman (first row, third from right). All others unidentified.

title: Mrs. Maulding Receives Award
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (right) presents the Distinguished Service Award to Mrs. J. Atwood Maulding upon her retirement.

title: Aboard the S.S. President Cleveland After Departing From San Francisco
Scopenote: Aboard the S.S. President Cleveland after departing from San Francisco, California with the next destination being Los Angeles, California. The Golden Gate Bridge is on the left. All individuals are unidentified. Vernice Anderson was on board, sailing with Ambassador-at-Large Philip Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: Scenic view near Taipei, Taiwan
Scopenote: Scenic view of mountains near Taipei, Taiwan, taken during Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup's mission to the Far East.

title: Mrs. Maulding Receives Award
Scopenote: Administrative Assistant Secretary Vernon Northrop (left) and Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (right) present to Distinguished Service Award to Mrs. J. Atwood Maulding upon her retirement.

title: Chapman Visit to Mexican Oil Fields
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman greets an unidentified girl while visiting a school for children of oil workers at the Salamanca Refinery in Guanajuato, Mexico.  All others unidentified.

title: Chapman Visits Mexican Oil Plant
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (left) visits a school for children of oil plant workers at the Salamanca Refinery in Guanajuato, Mexico.  All others unidentified.

title: Chapman Visits Mexican School
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (center) talks with two unidentified children at a school on the Salamanca Refinery in Guanajuato, Mexico.  All others unidentified.

title: Chapman Visits Mexican Oil Refineries
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (right) speaks with Antonio J. Bermudez, Director, Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX), on an airplane to the Salamanca Refinery in Guanajuato, Mexico.

title: Chapman Visits Mexican Oil Refinery
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (center, right) speaks with Antonio J. Bermudez, Director of Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX) (center, left), on a plane to the Salamanca Refinery in Guanajuato, Mexico.  Also pictured: Bruce K. Brown, Deputy Administrator of the Petroleum Administration for Defense (back to camera, right).  All others unidentified.

title: Chapman Visits Mexican Oil Refinery
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (right) speaks with Antonio J. Bermudez, Director of Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX) at the Salamanca Refinery in Guanajuato, Mexico.  All others unidentified.

title: Chapman Tours Mexican Oil Refinery
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (left) and Antonio J. Bermudez, Director of Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX) tour the Salamanca Refinery in Guanajuato, Mexico. All others unidentified.

title: Chapman Tours Mexican Oil Refinery
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (center, right) talks with Antonio J. Bermudez (center, left), Director of Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX), while touring the Salamanca Refinery in Guanajuato, Mexico.  All others unidentified.

title: U.S. Officials Visit Mexican Oil Refinery
Scopenote: Bruce K. Brown, Deputy Administrator of the Petroleum Administration for Defense (center), Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (second from right), and Antonio J. Bermudez, Director of Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX)(right) speak with an unidentified man at the Salamanca Refinery in Guanajuato, Mexico.  All others unidentified.

title: View of Mountains Near Hong Kong
Scopenote: Aerial view of the mountain ranges near Hong Kong.  All individuals are unidentified.  This photo was taken by Vernice Anderson when she traveled with Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: U.S. Officials Tour Mexican Oil Refinery
Scopenote: Front row: Bruce K. Brown, Deputy Administrator of the Petroleum Administration for Defense (second from left); Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (second from right); and Antonio J. Bermudez (right), Director of Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX), tour the Salamanca Refinery in Guanajuato, Mexico.  All others unidentified.

title: Chapman Arrives in Mexico City
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (center, left) speaks with the United States Ambassador to Mexico William O'Dwyer (center, right) after arriving at the Central Airport in Mexico City.  Secretary Chapman is in town to tour several Mexican oil refineries.  All others unidentified.

title: Chapman Arrives in Mexico City
Scopenote: A large group gathers around Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (center, behind man in hat) after his arrival at the Central Airport in Mexico City.  Secretary Chapman is in town to visit several oil refineries.  Also pictured: Bruce K. Brown, Deputy Administrator of the Petroleum Administration for Defense (left of Chapman, back to camera); Antonio J. Bermudez, Director of Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX) (right of man in white hat); Manuel Tello, acting Secretary of State for Mexico (between Chapman and Bermudez); and U.S. Ambassador to Mexico William O'Dwyer (behind Bermudez, center).  All others unidentified.

title: Chapman Arrives in Mexico City
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (third from left) in front of an airplane at the Central Airport after arriving in Mexico City to visit several oil refineries. Also pictured: Antonio J. Bermudez, Director, Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX) (second from left); Manuel Tello, acting Secretary of State for Mexico (second from right); and U.S. Ambassador to Mexico William O'Dwyer (right).  All others unidentified.

title: Chapman Arrives in Mexico City
Scopenote: Antonio J. Bermudez (left), Director of Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX) greets Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman after his arrival at the Central Airport in Mexico City.  Secretary Chapman is in town to visit several oil refineries.  All others unidentified.

title: Chapman Arrives in Mexico City
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (center) disembarks an airplane at the Central Airport in Mexico City.  Secretary Chapman is in town to visit several oil refineries.  All others unidentified.

title: Chapman Arrives in Mexico City
Scopenote: Antonio J. Bermudez (left), Director of Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX), greets Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman after his arrival at the Central Airport in Mexico City.  Secretary Chapman is in town to visit several oil refineries.  All others unidentified.

Bermudez, Director, Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX) (left); and Mrs. Antonio Bermudez (second from left, in plumed hat).  All others unidentified.

title: Reception at Hotel del Prado
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (right) and Antonio J. Bermudez, Director of Petroleos Mexicano (PEMEX) (second from right) at a reception in the Secretary's honor at the Hotel del Prado in Mexico City.  Also pictured: Mrs. Antonio Bermudez (behind Chapman, in plumed hat).  All others unidentified.

title: Reception at Hotel del Prado
Scopenote: Antonio J. Bermudez (right), Director of Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX), Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (second from right), and unidentified guests at a reception in the Secretary's honor at the Hotel del Prado in Mexico City.  Bruce K. Brown, Deputy Administrator of the Petroleum Administration for Defense, is at left, in background.

title: Aerial View of Hong Kong
Scopenote: Aerial view of mountains near Hong Kong.  This photo was taken by Vernice Anderson when she traveled with Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: Reception at Hotel del Prado
Scopenote: Left to right: Antonio J. Bermudez, Director, Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX); Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Mrs. Antonio Bermudez; and an unidentified man at a reception for the Secretary at the Hotel del Prado in Mexico City. Chapman was in Mexico to visit various oil refineries. Woman in background is unidentified.

title: Reception at Hotel del Prado
Scopenote: Left to right: Antonio J. Bermudez, Director, Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX); Mrs. Antonio Bermudez; and Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman at a reception for the Secretary at the Hotel del Prado in Mexico City. Secretary Chapman was in Mexico to visit various oil refineries.

title: Chapman and Bermudez at Reception
Scopenote: Antonio J. Bermudez, Director of Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX) (left), and Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman at a reception for the Secretary at the Hotel del Prado in Mexico City. Chapman went to Mexico to visit various oil refineries.

title: Lunch at U.S. Embassy in Mexico
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (head of table) attends a luncheon at the U.S. Embassy in Mexico City.  Also pictured: Bruce K. Brown, Deputy Administrator of the Petroleum Administration for Defense (left side of table, second from right); and Antonio J. Bermudez, Director, Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX) (right side of table, left).  All others unidentified.

title: Lunch at the U.S. Embassy in Mexico
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (head of table) attends a luncheon at the U.S. Embassy in Mexico City during his visit to Mexican oil refineries.  Also pictured: Antonio J. Bermudez, Director, Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX) (right side of table, left).  All others unidentified.

title: Lunch at U.S. Embassy in Mexico
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (head of table) attends a luncheon at the U.S. Embassy in Mexico City during his visit to examine oil refineries.  Also pictured: Antonio J. Bermudez, Director, Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX) (right side of table, left).  All others unidentified.

title: Lunch at the U.S. Embassy in Mexico
Scopenote: Left to right: unidentified; Bruce K. Brown, Deputy Administrator of the Petroleum Administration for Defense; Antonio J. Bermudez, Director, Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX); Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Manuel Tello, acting Secretary of State of Mexico; Rogerio de la Selva, Mexican President Aleman's private secretary; Ernest Uruchurtu, Assistant Secretary of the Interior of Mexico; and U.S. Ambassador to Mexico William O'Dwyer at the U.S. Embassy in Mexico City for a luncheon. Secretary Chapman and Mr. Brown were in Mexico to visit oil refineries.

title: Lunch at U.S. Embassy in Mexico
Scopenote: Left to right: Bruce K. Brown, Deputy Administrator of the Petroleum Administration for Defense; Antonio J. Bermudez, Director, Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX); Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Manuel Tello, acting Secretary of State of Mexico; and Rogerio de la Selva, Mexican President Aleman's private secretary, at the U.S. Embassy in Mexico City for a luncheon.

Scopenote: Unidentified people on the pilothouse deck of the river steamboat Nenana.

Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman poses for a picture en route to Caracas, Venezuela as a U.S. delegate to the National Petroleum Convention.

Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman poses for a picture en route to Caracas, Venezuela as a U.S. delegate to the National Petroleum Convention.

Scopenote: Left to right: Conrad Wirth, Associate Director, National Park Service; Arthur Demaray, Director, National Park Service; Alfrida (Mrs. Arthur) Demaray; and Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman at a National Park Service dinner honoring Arthur and Mrs. Demaray.  The dinner was held in the Department of the Interior cafeteria.

title: Dinner for Arthur Demaray
Scopenote: Left to right: Conrad Wirth, Associate Director, National Park Service; Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman; Arthur Demaray, Director, National Park Service; Alfrida (Mrs. Arthur) Demaray; and Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman pose with unidentified people in bear costumes at a National Park Service dinner honoring Arthur and Mrs. Demaray.  The dinner was held in the Department of the Interior cafeteria.

title: Warne Receives Distinguished Service Award
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (standing, right) presents the Distinguished Service Award to Assistant Secretary of the Interior William Warne (standing, left) at a luncheon at the National Press Club. Also pictured: Assistant Secretary of the Interior Dale Doty (left); Mary (Mrs. Dale) Doty (second from left); Under Secretary of the Interior Richard Searles (third from left).  Man on right is unidentified.

title: American Flag in Hong Kong
Scopenote: Scenic view of a United States flag flying in Hong Kong, taken from the balcony of American Consulate General Karl L. Rankin. This photo was taken by Vernice Anderson when she traveled with Ambassador Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: Luncheon Honoring Assistant Secretary Warne
Scopenote: A luncheon at the National Press Club in honor of Assistant Secretary of the Interior William Warne (seated, left of podium).  Also pictured, head table: Joel D. Wolfsohn, Assistant to the Secretary of the Interior (second from left); Mary (Mrs. Dale) Doty (seventh from left); Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (right of podium); and Assistant Secretary of the Interior Robert Rose (fifth from right).  All others unidentified.

title: Assistant Secretary Warne at Honorary Luncheon
Scopenote: Assistant Secretary of the Interior William Warne (at podium) speaks during a luncheon in his honor at the National Press Club.  Warne also received the Interior's Distinguished Service Award.  Also pictured: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (third from right).  All others unidentified.

title: Honorary Luncheon for Assistant Secretary Warne
Scopenote: An unidentified man speaks during a luncheon at the National Press Club in honor of Assistant Secretary of the Interior William Warne. All others unidentified.

title: Dinner in Honor of Arthur Demaray
Scopenote: From left to right: Conrad Wirth, Associate Director, National Park Service; unidentified; Arthur Demaray, Director, National Park Service; Alfrida (Mrs. Arthur) Demaray; and Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman at a National Park Service dinner in the Interior cafeteria honoring Arthur and Mrs. Demaray.

Scopenote: Left to right: Tom Vance; Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman; and Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman tour Kulani work camp on the island of Hawaii.

Scopenote: William J. Dougherty, Director of Information, Department of the Interior (second from left), Governor Oren Long (center), and Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (second from right) with unidentified men at the Haleakala Observatory in Haleakala National Park, Maui, Hawaii.

title: Kulani Work Camp
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (foreground, crouched) pushes a hoe into one of the garden beds at Kulani work camp in Hawaii.  Also pictured: Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman (background, second from left); and Tom Vance (background, right).  All others unidentified.

title: Chapmans Arrive in Hilo, Hawaii
Scopenote: Left to right: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman; James Chapman (in front of Mrs. Chapman); James Kealoha, Chairman of the County Board of Supervisors, Hawaii County, Hawaii; and Oren E. Long, Territorial Governor of Hawaii, as they stand in front of an airplane after the arrival of Secretary Chapman and family in Hilo, Hawaii.

title: Chapmans Arrive at Hilo Airport
Scopenote: A large group greets Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman and family as they exit an airplane at the Hilo Airport in Hilo, Hawaii.  Pictured: Secretary Chapman (sixth from left); Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman (seventh from left); James Chapman (behind donkey); and Oren E. Long, Territorial Governor of Hawaii (standing, fourth from right).  All others unidentified.

title: Vice President and Mrs. Barkley in Hawaii
Scopenote: Vice President Alben Barkley (seated, left) and Jane (Mrs. Alben) Barkley (seated, second from right) with unidentified people at a dinner hosted by Mr. and Mrs. C. S. Wo in Honolulu, Hawaii.

title: View of Hong Kong from the Kowloon Hotel
Scopenote: View of Hong Kong and a United States flag from the Kowloon Hotel. This photo was taken by Vernice Anderson when she traveled with Ambassador Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: Chapman Family Trip to Hawaii
Scopenote: Geneva (Mrs. Oren) Long (second from left); Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman (center); Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (third from right); James Chapman (seated on floor); and Oren E. Long, Territorial Governor of Hawaii, pose in front of a Christmas tree with unidentified people and a Hawaiian Santa Claus at Washington Place, the Governor's residence, during the Chapmans trip to Hawaii.

title: James Chapman at Governor's Mansion
Scopenote: James Chapman poses with an unidentified dog in front of a Christmas tree at Washington Place, the Governor of Hawaii's residence.  Oren E. Long, Territorial Governor of Hawaii at right. James was in Hawaii with his father, Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, and mother.

title: James Chapman in Hawaii
Scopenote: James Chapman goofs around in front of a Christmas tree with an unidentified man dressed as a Hawaiian Santa Claus at Washington Place, the Governor of Hawaii's residence. James was in Hawaii with his father, Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, and mother.

Scopenote: An unidentified man dressed as a Hawaiian Santa Claus standing in front of a Christmas tree at Washington Place, the Governor of Hawaii's residence.

Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (right), standing in front of a Christmas tree, receives a fruit basket from an unidentified man dressed as a Hawaiian Santa at Washington Place, the Governor of Hawaii's residence.  Women in background unidentified.

Long, Territorial Governor of Hawaii (second from right); and Geneva (Mrs. Oren) Long (left).  All others unidentified.

Scopenote: View of the sea from the balcony of American Consul General Karl L. Rankin in Hong Kong.  This photo was taken by Vernice Anderson when she traveled with Ambassador Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

Scopenote: Left to right: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman, James Chapman, and Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman next to an airplane after arriving in Hawaii.

Scopenote: Left to right: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman; James Chapman; and William J. Dougherty, Director of Information, Department of the Interior, after arriving at the airport in Hawaii.

Scopenote: Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman (third from left), James Chapman (in front of Mrs. Chapman) and others pose for a group picture during the Chapmans trip to Hawaii.  Also pictured: Oren E. Long, Territorial Governor of Hawaii (second from right); and Geneva (Mrs. Oren) Long (left).  All others unidentified.

title: Chapman Family in Hawaii
Scopenote: Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman and James Chapman during their trip to Hawaii with Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman.

title: Dinner Party Hosted by C.S. Wo
Scopenote: A dinner party at the home of Mr. and Mrs. C. S. Wo in Honolulu, Hawaii. Pictured: William J. Dougherty, Director of Information, Department of the Interior (background, left); Oren E. Long, Territorial Governor of Hawaii (foreground, second from left); Vice President Alben Barkley (seated, left); James Chapman (seated, second from left); Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (in front of couch); Jane (Mrs. Alben) Barkley (seated, second from right, partly obscured); and Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman (seated, right). All others unidentified.

title: Contract for Morgantown Research Laboratory
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (seated) signs the contract to begin building the Bureau of Mines' Appalachian Experiment Station in Morgantown, West Virginia.  Standing, left to right: Congressman Cleveland M. Bailey; Thomas Kennedy, Vice President, United Mine Workers; Senator Matthew M. Neely; Congressman Harley O. Staggers; Congressman Maurice G. Burnside; Senator Harley Kilgore; and Congresswoman Elizabeth Kee.

title: Chapman Signs Contract for Power Companies
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman signs a contract between Arkansas Power & Light, Reynolds Metals Company and the Southwestern Power Pool. Standing, left to right: Senator John McClellan; Senator William Fulbright; and Under Secretary of the Interior Richard Searles. Seated, left to right: R. R. Ritchie, Arkansas Power & Light; Walter Rice, Reynolds Metals Company; and Secretary Chapman.

title: The Four Aces Sing to Chapman
Scopenote: The Four Aces sings to Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman and others.  Left to right: Al Alberts; Lou Silvestri; Rosario "Sod" Vaccaro; Dave Mahoney; unidentified; Secretary Chapman; and unidentified.

title: Chapman Presented with Record
Scopenote: Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman is presented a framed record of "Spring is a Wonderful Thing" by The Four Aces.  Left to right: Lou Silvestri; unidentified woman; Allan Zee; Secretary Chapman; Rosario "Sod" Vaccaro; Dave Mahoney; unidentified man; Al Alberts; and Herb Kessler.

title: Chapman Presented with Record

Scopenote: View of Repulse Bay in Hong Kong. This photo was taken by Vernice Anderson when she traveled with Ambassador Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

Scopenote: The singing quartet The Four Aces and others on the steps of the Department of the Interior building.  Left to right: Herb Kessler; Dave Mahoney; Lou Silvestri; Al Alberts; Rosario "Sod" Vaccaro; Allan Zee; unidentified man; and unidentified woman.

title: Jefferson-Jackson Day Dinner
Scopenote: Guests leave the head table at the Jefferson-Jackson Day dinner in Washington, D.C. after President Truman announced that he would not be running for another term of office.  Left to right: Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman; Attorney General J. Howard McGrath; and Alice (Mrs. Dean) Acheson.  All others unidentified.

title: Women's National Democratic Club Luncheon
Scopenote: Ann (Mrs. Oscar) Chapman stands next to the Hawaii table, of which she was hostess, at the Women's National Democratic Club spring luncheon at the Statler Hotel in Washington, D.C.  The table won second place in the "Most Beautiful" category.

title: Mellon Memorial Fountain Dedication

title: Mellon Memorial Fountain Dedication

title: National Council of Negro Women Convention
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with Under Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman at the 14th Annual Convention of The National Council of Negro Women in Washington, D.C.  Mary McLeod Bethune, Council President, is also pictured. From: Oscar Chapman Scrapbook

title: Truman Returns From Florida

Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder (behind Chapman) is also pictured.  All others unidentified. From: Oscar Chapman Scrapbook.

title: Truman at Amphitheatre Dedication

Truman (front row, center), seated with Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman (front row, right) shakes hands with an unidentified woman at the rededication of Sesquicentennial Amphitheatre in Washington's Rock Creek Park as the Carter Barron Amphitheatre. The men in military uniform behind Truman are General Robert Landry (left) and General Harry Vaughan (right).  All others are unidentified. From: Oscar Chapman Scrapbook

From: Oscar Chapman Scrapbook

title: Greeting the President of Ecuador
Scopenote: Cabinet members and others wait at Washington National Airport to greet the President of Ecuador.  Front row, left to right: Vice President Alben Barkley; Mrs. Jane Alben; Mrs. Alice Acheson; Secretary of State Dean Acheson; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; Secretary of Defense George C. Marshall; Postmaster General Jesse Donaldson; Secretary of the Interior Oscar Chapman; Attorney General Howard McGrath; Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan; Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer; and the Ambassador from Ecuador Luis Antonio Penaherrera.  All others unidentified. From: Oscar Chapman Scrapbook

title: Truman and President of Ecuador
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, right), President of Ecuador Galo Plaza Lasso (back seat, left), and others depart Washington National Airport in President Truman's limousine.  Also pictured, General Harry Vaughan (in military uniform).  All others unidentified. From: Oscar Chapman Scrapbook

title: President of Ecuador Welcoming Ceremony

Truman (sixth from left); and President Galo Plaza (seventh from left).  All others unidentified. From: Oscar Chapman Scrapbook

title: Truman and Plaza at Blair House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with President Galo Plaza on the steps at Blair House. From left to right: President Plaza, Luz Plaza, Mrs. Rosario Plaza, President Truman, Elsa Plaza, Jane (Mrs. Alben) Barkley, and Vice President Alben Barkley. From: Oscar Chapman Scrapbook

title: Equestrian Statues Dedication

title: Truman and Barkley Families at White House

Leahy and General Harry Vaughan. Standing behind President Truman, partly obscured, is Captain Robert Dennison. Standing in the background between Mrs. Truman and President Truman is Irving Geist. All others are unidentified.  From: Oscar Chapman Scrapbook

title: Clark Sworn In as Associate Justice

All others unidentified. From: Oscar Chapman Scrapbook

title: Truman Attends Luncheon in Department of Interior

Murdock (back of table, standing); and Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly (back of table, left).  All others unidentified. From: Oscar Chapman Scrapbook

Left table: General Harry Vaughan (left side, fourth form left); W. Averell Harriman (left side, eighth from left); and Congressman Michael J. Kirwan (left side, tenth from left).  All others unidentified.  Original oversize photo is in oversize file.

title: Evidence of Tapel Massacre
Scopenote: Pedro Cerono, holding a women's hair found in a group of destroyed native huts after the Tapel Massacre, Gonzaga Cagayan Province, Luzon, Philippines, which occurred July 1, 1945.  Donor: John Paxton

title: Swearing In of War Crimes Council
Scopenote: Japanese General Tomoyuki Yamashita and the defense attorneys, standing as the council is sworn in during the war crimes trials in Manila.  Donor:  John Paxton

title: Human Skulls Provide Evidence of Tapel Massacre
Scopenote: Pedro Cerono displays a group of skulls that he discovered after the Tapel Massacre on July 1, 1945, in Gonzaga Cagayan Province, Luzon, Philippines. The skulls were used as evidence in the war crimes trials. Donor: John Paxton

title: Wife of General Masaharu Homma
Scopenote: Wife of General Masaharu Homma who was on trial for war crimes in Manila, Philippines.  The High Commissioner's residence is in the background.  Donor:  John Paxton

title: Testimony At Trial of General Yamashita
Scopenote: A German Jewish refugee, Mr. Levy (left, seated) being questioned by Captain D. C. Hill, Assistant Prosecutor about his experiences at the hands of the Japanese in February, 1945.  Setting is the war crimes trial of Japanese General Tomoyuki Yamashita held at the High commissioner's residence in Manila, Philippines.  Donor:  John Paxton

title: Home Destroyed During Japanese Invasion of Bulacan Province, Philippines
Scopenote: Foundation of Ismael Buenaventura's home which is all that remains after it was burned by the Japanese.  Local man points to the spot where he and seven other men were lined up and shot by the Japanese during the invasion.  Donor:  John Paxton

title: Mass Killings in Batangas Province
Scopenote: Unidentified man stands at a river site of a mass killing by the Japanese during World War II, in the Batangas Province, Luzon, Philippines. Donor: John Paxton

title: Airplane in Singapore
Scopenote: View of United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup's plane at the Kallang Airport located in Kallang, Singapore.  The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by American Ambassador-at-large Philip C. Jessup and party. All individuals are unidentified.

title: Remains of House in Philippines
Scopenote: Remains of a house at an unidentified location in the Philippines, burned by the Japanese on January 27, 1945.  Donor:  John Paxton

title: Ruins of Primary School Used in Batangas Province Massacres
Scopenote: Ruins of a primary school in Batangas Province, Philippines where Japanese assembled hostages before executing them. Donor: John Paxton

title: Tapel Massacre Site, Philippines
Scopenote: A bridge near Tapel, Gonzaga Cagayan Province, Luzon, Philippines, where eight people were reported to have been killed by the Japanese on or about July 1, 1945.  Donor:  John Paxton

title: Swearing in of Captain N. J. Sparnon
Scopenote: Australian Captain N. J. Sparnon is sworn in as a witness for the prosecution during the war crimes trial of Japanese General Tomoyuki Yamashita.  Location is the High Commissioner's residence in Manila, Philippines.  Donor:  John Paxton

title: Mr. de Trinidad Testifies at War Crimes Trial, Manila
Scopenote: Mr. de Trinidad of the Philippines testifies at war crimes trial of Japanese General Tomoyuki Yamashita in Manila, Philippines, about injuries he received on February 3, 1945, at the hands of Japanese soldiers. Others are unidentified. Donor: John Paxton

title: Bridge Leading to the Village of Tapel
Scopenote: A small bridge leading to the village of Tapel on Luzon, Philippines, site of the Tapel Massacre on July 1, 1945.  The bridge is the site where three people were killed by the Japanese.  Donor:  John Paxton

title: Dignitaries Assembled at the Presidential Palace in Manila
Scopenote: (From L to R.) Philippine President Sergio Osmena, U.S. Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson, U.S. General Wilhelm D. Styer and U.S. General Russell at the Presidential Palace, Manila, Philippines. Donor: John Paxton

title: Dignitaries Leaving the Malacanang Presidential Palace, Manila
Scopenote: From left to right, Philippine President Sergio Osmena, U.S. Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson, U.S. General Wilhelm D. Styer and U.S. General Russell leave the Presidential Palace in Manila together. Donor: John Paxton

Scopenote: U.S. Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson (left) and U.S. General Wilhelm D. Styer (right) inspect Pier 7 in Manila, Philippines. Donor: John Paxton

title: General Styer, Secretary Patterson and Commissioner McNutt Meet
Scopenote: From left to right, United States General Wilhelm D. Styer, U.S. Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson and U.S. High Commissioner of the Philippines Paul V. McNutt met in McNutt's office in Manila in 1946. Donor: John Paxton

Scopenote: Kallang Airport located in Singapore.  The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.

title: Testimony at War Crimes Trial of Tomoyuki Yamashita
Scopenote: Mr. Esguarra testifies before the war crimes  trial of Tomoyuki Yamashita about injuries he received from a Japanese soldier. Location is the High Commissioner's residence in Manila, Philippines. Other soldiers are unidentified. Donor:  John Paxton

title: Japanese Lieutenant General Muto at War Crimes Trial, Manila
Scopenote: Japanese Lieutenant General Akira Muto, aide to General Tomoyuki Yamashita (not shown) during a break of the first day of General Yamashita's trial.  Location is the High commissioner's residence in Manila, Philippines.  Donor:  John Paxton

title: General Yamashita and Defense Counsel at War Crimes Trial, Manila
Scopenote: Japanese General Tomoyuki Yamashita (center back, in uniform) with unidentified man on his right and Lieutenant General Akira Muto on his left.  In front are two of Yamashita's defense counsel (unidentified). General Yamashita is on trial in Manila, Philippines, for war crimes committed there during World War II.  Donor:  John Paxton

title: Japanese General Yamashita During Break at His War Crimes Trial
Scopenote: Japanese General Tomoyuki Tamashita  with his unidentified interpreter to his right, takes a break during the war crimes trial which was held at the High Commissioner's residence in Manila, Philippines.  Donor:  John Paxton

title: Japanese General Yamashita Stands as Commission Enters
Scopenote: From Left to right Interpreter for General Yamashita (unidentified), Japanese General Tomoyuki Yamashita, Lieutenant General Akira Muto and unidentified man and unidentified military guard stand at attention as the War Crimes Trial Commission enters the court in Manila, Philippines.  Donor:  John Paxton

title: Japanese General Yamashita Converses with His Interpreter and Defense Counsel

title: Testimony at War Crimes Trial
Scopenote: A United States Army sergeant demonstrates to the court how the Japanese made American troops kneel when captured on Corregidor. This testimony took place during the trial of Japanese war criminals in Manila, Philippines. Donor: John Paxton

title: Japanese General Yamashita is Escorted Back to His Cell
Scopenote: Escorted by Military Police Major Kenworthy, Japanese General Tomoyuki Yamashita is escorted back to his cell after the fourth day of his trial for war crimes held in Manila, Philippines.  Donor:  John Paxton

Her husband is on trial for war crimes committed by the Japanese during World War II. Donor: John Paxton

Scopenote: Portrait of Bess W. Truman.  Autographed, "To Reathel, With love and best wishes, from, Bess W. Truman."

title: President and Cabinet
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with members of his Cabinet in the Cabinet Room of the White House.  Clockwise, from left: Secretary of Agriculture Clinton Anderson; Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach; Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman; Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug; Postmaster General Robert Hannegan; Secretary of War Robert Patterson; Secretary of State George C. Marshall; President Truman; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; Attorney General Tom Clark; and Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal.

title: Truman Returns to Washington
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated left, back seat, lead car) and Vice President Alben Barkley (seated right, back seat, lead car) wave from the motorcade during their return to Washington after the 1948 Presidential election. Crowds of people and a band line the street. All others unidentified.

title: Truman Returns to Washington
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated left, back seat, lead car) and Vice President Alben Barkley (seated right, back seat, lead car) wave to the crowd from the motorcade during their return to Washington after the 1948 Presidential election.  Also pictured: First Lady Bess W. Truman (second row, left).  All others unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Returns to Washington
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated left, back seat) and Vice President Alben Barkley (seated right, back seat) wave to the crowd from the motorcade during their return to Washington after the 1948 Presidential election.  Also pictured: First Lady Bess W. Truman (second row, left); Margaret Truman (second row, second from left); and Democratic National Committee Chairman J. Howard McGrath (center, back seat).  All others unidentified.

title: Truman Returns to Washington
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated left, back seat) and Vice President Alben Barkley (seated right, back seat) wave to the crowds and photographers from the motorcade during their return to Washington after the 1948 Presidential election. Seated between them is Democratic National Committee Chairman J. Howard McGrath.  Second row, left to right: First Lady Bess W. Truman; Margaret Truman; and Marian (Mrs. Max) Truitt, daughter of Vice President Barkley.  All others unidentified.

title: Band Plays for Truman's Return
Scopenote: A band plays along the motorcade route for President Harry S. Truman's return to Washington after the 1948 Presidential election.  All people unidentified.

title: Crowd Gathers for Truman's Return
Scopenote: A large crowd gathers in front of the White House to wait for President Harry S. Truman to return after the 1948 Presidential election.  All people unidentified.

title: Crowd Awaits Truman's Return
Scopenote: A large crowd gathers in front of the White House to wait for President Harry S. Truman to return after the 1948 Presidential election.  All people unidentified.

title: The President's Motorcade

title: Trumans Return to White House
Scopenote: Left to right: Vice President Alben W. Barkley; Marian Barkley Truitt; Margaret Truman; First Lady Bess W. Truman; and President Harry S. Truman return to the White House after the 1948 Presidential election.  Also pictured: General Harry Vaughan (behind Mrs. Truman, left).  All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Cabinet Members
Scopenote: President Truman and his Cabinet members pose for a picture in front of an unknown building.  Left to right: Secretary of Agriculture Charles F. Brannan; Attorney General Tom C. Clark; Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer; Secretary of State George C. Marshall; President Harry S. Truman; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; Secretary of Defense James Forrestal; Postmaster General Jesse M. Donaldson; and Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug.

title: President Harry S. Truman Announces Japanese Surrender
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing at desk) announces the surrender of Japan to the media.  First row, left to right: Admiral William D. Leahy, Chief of Staff; Secretary of State James F. Byrnes; President Truman; and Cordell Hull, Secretary of State under Franklin Roosevelt.  Second row, left to right: Julius Krug, Chairman, War Production Board; Leo Crowley, Administrator of the Foreign Economic Administration; Major General Philip Fleming, Administrator, Federal Works Agency; William Davis, Director of the Office of Economic Stabilization; John Snyder, Director, Office of War Mobilization and Reconversion; Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal; Secretary of the Treasury Fred Vinson; Attorney General Tom C. Clark; Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach; John Blandford, Administrator of the National Housing Agency; and Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan.

title: Arrival in Rangoon (Yangon), Burma
Scopenote: United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup (second from left)shaking hands with an unidentified individual upon arrival in Rangoon (Yangon), Burma.  Also pictured are: Lois (Mrs. Philip C.) Jessup (left), William Gibson (third from right), and Mr. Day (second from right). In the background, in the polka-dotted dress is Vernice Anderson, Secretary to Mr. Jessup. The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by Ambassador Jessup and party. All other individuals are unidentified.

title: Truman and Cabinet Members

All others unidentified.  Signed by President Truman and John Snyder.

title: Ambassador Philip C. Jessup and Others in Bangkok
Scopenote: The Grand Palace in Bangkok, Thailand. The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup. Muccio, United States Ambassador to Korea; unidentified man (partly obscured); Robert M. Scotten, United States Ambassador to New Zealand; and Vernice Anderson, Secretary to Ambassador Jessup (partly obscured). Third row, left to right: Robert C. Strong, Charge d'Affaires to the Nationalist Government of China; and H. Merle Cochran, United States Ambassador to Indonesia. All others are unidentified.

Harry S. Truman."  Original photo is stored in oversize file.

Others are unidentified.

Scopenote: Reathel Odum and others have cocktails with Mr. Cooper, the ship's purser, while on the S.S. Constitution. Ms. Odum was personal secretary to First Lady Bess W. Truman and traveling companion of Margaret Truman at the time this photo was taken.

Scopenote: Passengers gather in a lounge aboard the S.S. America.  Pictured: Reathel Odum (third row, second from left).  All others unidentified. Margaret Truman, Annette Wright, and Reathel Odum traveled to Europe on board this ship.

title: Aboard the S.S. America

Scopenote: Margaret Truman (right) and Annette Wright sit on the couch in their suite aboard the S.S. America. Margaret, Annette, and Reathel Odum traveled to Europe on board this ship.

Scopenote: The S.S. America at sea. Margaret Truman, Annette Wright, and Reathel Odum traveled to Europe on board this ship.

Scopenote: The Il Vittoriano, a monument in honor of the first king of unified Italy, and the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Rome. This photo was taken while Reathel Odum accompanied Margaret Truman on her vacation trip to Europe.

title: Indian Man in Front of the Taj Mahal
Scopenote: An unidentified Indian male posing in front of the Taj Mahal in Agra, India.  The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.

title: Truman's Secretaries
Scopenote: Left to right: Mildred Dryden, Reathel Odum, and Catherine Bixler pose for a picture by the Potomac River. All three women served as secretaries to Senator Harry S. Truman.

title: Truman Employees by the River
Scopenote: Left to right: Catherine Bixler, Mildred Dryden, and Reathel Odum pose for a picture next to the Potomac River. All three women served as secretaries to Senator Harry S. Truman.

title: Reathel Odum in Washington, D.C
Scopenote: Reathel Odum stands on the National Mall with the U.S. Capitol in the background. At this time, Ms. Odum served as a secretary to Senator Harry S. Truman.

title: Odum and Bixler Under Cherry Trees
Scopenote: Catherine Bixler (left) and Reathel Odum under blossoming cherry trees in Washington, D.C. These two women were secretaries in Senator Harry S. Truman's office at the time this photo was taken.

title: Bixler and Dryden with Cherry Trees
Scopenote: Catherine Bixler (left) and Mildred Dryden under blossoming cherry trees in Washington, D.C. These two women were secretaries in Senator Harry S. Truman's office at the time this photo was taken.

title: Truman Employees at Supreme Court
Scopenote: Left to right: Reathel Odum, Mildred Dryden, and Catherine Bixler sit on a bench outside the Supreme Court. These women were all secretaries in Senator Harry S. Truman's office at the time this photo was taken.

title: Messall and Bixler
Scopenote: Vic Messall (left) and Catherine Bixler, employees of Senator Harry S. Truman, sit on a concrete bench in Washington, D.C.

title: Truman Secretaries at Supreme Court
Scopenote: Left to right: Catherine Bixler, Mildred Dryden, and Reathel Odum post outside the Supreme Court building in Washington, D.C. These women were secretaries to Senator Harry S. Truman at the time this photo was taken.

title: Margaret Truman in Concert
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (right) in concert with her accompanist, Herman Allison.

title: Margaret and Drucie
Scopenote: Margaret Truman (left) and her friend Drucie Snyder pose for a picture.

title: Itmad-ud-Daulah's Tomb
Scopenote: Inside view of the tomb of Itmad-ud-Daulah located in Agra, India.  The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.

title: Harry S. Truman Portrait, autographed to Reathel Odum
Scopenote: Autographed portrait painting of President Harry S. Truman.  Signed by artist Greta Kempton in the lower left corner. Also autographed by Truman:  "My very best to Miss Reathel Odum, an efficient and capable public servant.  White House, Sept. 26, 1947.  Harry S. Truman."  Original is filed in oversize file.

title: Camp Riley, Kansas
Scopenote: Left to right: Harry S. Truman, Harry H. Vaughan, and John W. Snyder at Camp Riley, Kansas.

title: Truman and Snyder
Scopenote: Former Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder (left) visits with former President Harry S. Truman at the Truman home.

title: Snyder at Truman Home
Scopenote: Former Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder (left) visits Bess W. Truman and former President Harry S. Truman at their home.

title: Truman Meets Evlyn Horton
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) meets Evlyn Horton (center), granddaughter of Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder (left).  All others unidentified.

title: Trumans at Baseball Game
Scopenote: Stereoscope photo of President Harry S. Truman and others standing for the National Anthem at a baseball game.  First row, left to right: Reathel Odum; First Lady Bess W. Truman; President Harry S. Truman; and Admiral William Leahy.  Second row: Matthew Connelly, Appointments Secretary to the President (third from left); and William Hassett, Correspondence Secretary to the President (fourth from left).  Standing in the third row, directly behind Admiral Leahy is Senator Arthur Vandenberg. All others unidentified.

title: Truman at Baseball Game
Scopenote: Stereoscope photo of President Harry S. Truman (standing, left) shakes hands with a player during a baseball game.  Also pictured: First Lady Bess W. Truman (first row, left); Admiral William Leahy (first row, right); and Matthew Connelly, Appointments Secretary to the President (second row, between Mrs. and President Truman).  All others unidentified.

title: Truman at Baseball Game
Scopenote: Stereoscope photo of President Harry S. Truman (standing, left) as he throws out a baseball from the crowd during a baseball game.  Also pictured: First Lady Bess W. Truman (first row, left).  Standing beside President Truman is  Clark Griffith, owner of the Washington Senators. Seated on the right in the front row is Charles Ross, President Truman's Press Secretary. Seated behind Mr. Ross is Major General Harry Vaughan, President Truman's military aide. All others unidentified.

title: Truman Signs Baseball
Scopenote: Stereoscope photo of President Harry S. Truman (first row, center) autographing a baseball for a young boy.  First row, left to right: First Lady Bess W. Truman; President Truman; and Admiral William Leahy.  Second row: Matthew Connelly, Appointments Secretary to the President (center); and William Hassett, Correspondence Secretary to the President (right).  All others unidentified.

title: Louis and Harry Truman
Scopenote: Lieutenant General Louis W. Truman (left) meets with former President Harry S. Truman.  All others unidentified. Louis Truman is Harry S. Truman's first cousin once removed. At the bottom are photographic reproductions of both men's autographs.

title: Exterior of the Tomb of Itmad-ud-Daulah
Scopenote: View of the outside of Itmad-ud-Daulah's tomb located in Agra, India.  The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.

title: Odum at White House Luncheon
Scopenote: First Lady Nancy Reagan (second from left) hosts a luncheon at the White House.  Also pictured: Reathel Odum (sixth from left, obscured).  All others unidentified.

title: Margaret Truman Portrait
Scopenote: Publicity portrait of Margaret Truman.

title: Martha Truman Portrait
Scopenote: Photo of Boris B. Gordon's portrait painting of Martha Ellen Truman.

title: Truman Portrait
Scopenote: Portrait of Senator Harry S. Truman.

title: White House Spanish Class
Scopenote: Ramon Ramos (standing by the blackboard) teaches a Spanish Class at the White House for wives of government officials.  Seated, from left to right, are Mamie (Mrs. Dwight D.) Eisenhower, Margaret (Mrs. Robert) Patterson, Maryon (Mrs. Lester B.) Pearson, First Lady Bess W. Truman, and Josephine (Mrs. Hugo L.) Black.  Standing, from left to right, are Miss Florence King, Mrs. Williams H. Davis, Miss Reathel Odum, Representative Jessie Sumner of Illinois, Priscilla (Mrs. John L.) Sullivan, Augusta (Mrs. Clarence N.) Goodwin, and an unidentified woman.

title: Spanish Class
Scopenote: Professor Ramon Ramos (first row, seventh from left) with all the members of his Spanish class.  Also pictured: Augusta (Mrs. Clarence) Goodwin (first row, sixth from left); First Lady Bess W. Truman (first row, sixth from right); and Mrs. Truman's Personal Secretary, Reathel Odum (second row; right).  All others unidentified. Photo is autographed at the bottom: "To Reathel Odum with kindest regards Naomi Nover."

title: Ladies Spanish Class
Scopenote: Professor Ramon Ramos (first row, fifth from left) with his entire Spanish class, possibly at the White House.  Also pictured: Augusta (Mrs. Clarence) Goodwin (first row, fourth from left); First Lady Bess W. Truman (first row, sixth from left); and Mrs. Truman's Personal Secretary Reathel Odum (second row, right).  Mrs. Dwight D. (Mamie) Eisenhower is second from left on first row. All others unidentified.

Scopenote: Left to right: First Lady Bess W. Truman; Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder; Margaret Truman; Drucie Snyder Horton; and John E. Horton at an unknown event.

Scopenote: Margaret Truman's bedroom in her apartment at the Carlyle Hotel in New York City.
