title: Christmas Dinner at White House with Truman Family
Scopenote: Members of the Truman and Wallace families seated for Christmas dinner at the White House. Clockwise, from left: Christine (Mrs. Fred) Wallace, Fred Wallace, First Lady Bess W. Truman, May (Mrs. George) Wallace, George Wallace, Natalie (Mrs. Frank) Wallace, Frank Wallace, Mary Jane Truman, President Harry S. Truman, David Wallace, Marian Wallace, and Margo Wallace.  See also 77-4090, where President Truman is more visible.

title: Second Floor of White House
Scopenote: View of the second floor of the White House during the Truman administration.

title: Coin Exhibit Opening
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left), Bess W. Truman (second from left), John Snyder (right), and an unidentified man at the opening of the Snyder coin collection exhibit at the Harry S. Truman Library. All others unidentified. Signed by Harry S. Truman and John Snyder.

title: The Agra Fort
Scopenote: Columns at the Agra Fort located in Agra, India. The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.

title: Hurricane Damage at Key West Naval Air Station
Scopenote: Unidentified people lined up outside a building in Key West, Florida, with damaged palm trees in the foreground. On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida damaging several of the buildings at the Naval Air Station and killing three people in the area.

title: Hurricane Damage at Key West Naval Air Station
Scopenote: Extensive damage to trees along a road at the Key West Naval Air Station as a result of a hurricane that came through on September 20-21, 1948. People in the background standing near the car are unidentified.

title: Hurricane Damage at Key West Naval Air Station
Scopenote: Extensive damage to trees and buildings at the Key West Naval Air Station and Submarine Base as a result of a hurricane that came through on September 20-21, 1948.

title: Hurricane Damage at Key West Naval Air Station, 1948
Scopenote: Extensive damage to trees and high water at the Key West Naval Air Station, stranding a car in between several buildings. On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida damaging several of the buildings at the Naval Air Station and killing three people in the area.

title: Hurricane Damage at Key West Naval Air Station, 1948
Scopenote: Damage to buildings near the beach of the Key West Naval Air Station. On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida damaging several of the buildings at the Naval Air Station and killing three people in the area.

title: Hurricane Damage at Key West Naval Air Station, 1948
Scopenote: Damage to a garage storing boats and cars at the Key West Naval Air Station. On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida damaging several of the buildings at the Naval Air Station and killing three people in the area.

title: Flooding at Key West Naval Air Station From  Hurricane
Scopenote: Extensive flooding, high water, and tree damage on the Key West Naval Air Station Base. On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida causing flooding and damaging several of the buildings at the Naval Air Station. Three people in the area were killed.

title: Flooding Due to Hurricane at Key West Air Naval Station
Scopenote: High water and flooding damage on a street on the Key West Naval Base. Cars can be seen parked on the right side of the street. On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida causing some flooding at the Naval Air Station and killing three people in the area.

title: Hurricane Damage to a Small Navy Boat
Scopenote: A boat along a dock at the Key West Naval Air Station, showing damage from a hurricane that struck Key West, Florida and swamped some of the smaller naval vessels docked at the Naval Air Station. All people are unidentified.

title: Hurricane Damage to Key West Naval Air Station
Scopenote: Damage to the roof of a building at the Key West Naval Air Station from a hurricane struck Key West, Florida on September 20-21st.

title: Agra Fort and Taj Mahal
Scopenote: Distant view of the Taj Mahal from the balcony of the Agra Fort located in Agra, India.  The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.

title: Hurricane Debris Washed up at Key West Naval Air Station Dock
Scopenote: On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida damaging several of the buildings at the Naval Air Station and killing three people in the area. Debris from the hurricane washed up near the docks at the Naval Air Station.

title: Hurricane Damage at Key West Naval Air Station, 1948
Scopenote: Extensive damage to trees and buildings at the Key West Naval Air Station. On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida damaging several of the buildings at the Naval Air Station and killing three people in the area.

title: Navy Vessel Damaged by Hurricane
Scopenote: On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida.  A six foot storm surge swamped this small Naval vessel docked at the Naval Air Station. People on the dock are unidentified.

title: Hurricane Damage at Key West Naval Air Station
Scopenote: Damage to palm trees and buildings at the Key West Naval Air Station. On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida damaging several of the buildings at the Naval Air Station and killing three people in the area.

title: Flooding at Key West Naval Air Station Caused by Hurricane
Scopenote: Flooding and high water at the Key West Naval Air Station which damaged several buildings. On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida, killing three people in the area.

title: Flooding at Key West Naval Air Station Caused by Hurricane
Scopenote: On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida causing flooding at the Naval Air Station. Unidentified sailor and young boy stand in the street, demonstrating the depth of the high water. Damage to the trees and palms is also evident.

title: Flooding at Key West Naval Air Station Caused by Hurricane
Scopenote: On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West causing severe flooding at the Naval Air Station. Unidentified sailor stands in the street, demonstrating the depth of the high water. Damage to the trees and palms is also evident.

title: Hurricane Damage at Key West Naval Air Station
Scopenote: On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida damaging several of the buildings at the Naval Air Station and killing three people in the area. This photo shows extensive damage to trees along a street.

title: Hurricane Damage at Key West Naval Air Station, 1948
Scopenote: Unidentified civilians and military personnel survey damage to cars, trees, and buildings from the hurricane that struck Key West Florida and the Naval Air Station on September 20-21, 1948. All are unidentified.

title: Hurricane Damage at Key West Naval Air Station
Scopenote: Damage to one of the buildings on the Key West Naval Air Station base. On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida damaging several of the buildings at the Naval Air Station and killing three people in the area.

title: Mausoleum in Agra
Scopenote: Unidentified mausoleum in Agra, India. The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by American Ambassador Philip C. Jessup and party.

title: Hurricane Debris Washed Up at Key West Naval Air Station Dock
Scopenote: Debris from hurricane that struck Key West, Florida and the Key West Naval Air Station on September 20-21, 1948 washes up near the naval docks. Some of the buildings in the background also exhibit damage from the hurricane.

title: Damaged Naval Vessel After Hurricane Struck Key West Naval Air Station
Scopenote: A small naval vessel shows damage from the hurricane that struck Key West, Florida, and the Naval Air Station on September 20-21, 1948. People on board are unidentified. Truman occasionally used the boat, the "Big Wheel," on some of his fishing expeditions during his vacations in Key West.

title: Boarded Up Building at Key West Naval Air Station
Scopenote: A building at the Key West Naval Air Station shown with windows boarded up to prevent damage from the hurricane that struck Key West, Florida and the Naval Air Station on September 20-21, 1948. Palm trees in front of the building show extensive damage.

title: Cleaning Up Damage from Hurricane
Scopenote: Workers use a crane to clean up palm trees damaged when a hurricane struck Key West, Florida and the Naval Air Station on September 20-21, 1948. All people are unidentified.

title: Hurricane Damage at Key West Naval Air Station
Scopenote: Extensive damage to buildings and trees can be seen at the Key West Naval Air Station, as a result of a hurricane struck Key West, Florida, killing three people in the area.

title: Hurricane Damage at Key West Naval Air Station
Scopenote: Extreme damage to various buildings and trees at the Key West Naval Air Station. On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida damaging several of the buildings at the Naval Air Station and killing three people in the area.

title: Hurricane Damage to Buildings at Key West Naval Air Station
Scopenote: Damage to buildings and other structures at the Key West Naval Air Station. On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida damaging several of the buildings at the Naval Air Station and killing three people in the area.

title: Flooding From Hurricane that Struck Key West Naval Air Station
Scopenote: Unidentified woman walks in high waters left behind after a hurricane struck Key West, Florida and the Naval Air Station on September 20-21, 1948. Extensive to damage to trees and buildings can also be seen.

title: Hurricane Damage at Key West Naval Air Station
Scopenote: Damage to trees, palm trees, and buildings at the Key West Naval Air Station. On September 20-21, 1948 a hurricane struck Key West, Florida damaging several of the buildings at the Naval Air Station and killing three people in the area.

title: Hurricane Damage at Key West Naval Air Station Beach
Scopenote: Hurricane damage to the docks and other structures along the beach at the Key West Naval Air Station. On September 20-21, 1948, a hurricane struck Key West, Florida, damaging several of the buildings at the Naval Air Station and killing three people in the area.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) with Chief Justice Fred Vinson (left) on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida, while Truman was on vacation.

title: Inaugural Billboard
Scopenote: Billboard featuring President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley offering a welcome to Washington, D.C., for the 1949 Inaugural festivities.

title: Recording of the Inaugural Ceremonies
Scopenote: Record album cover for recordings of the January 20, 1949 inaugural ceremonies, and an inaugural committee pendant.

title: Inaugural Ceremonies Staff Badges
Scopenote: Badges worn by personnel during the 1949 inaugural ceremonies which denote the role each individual served such as "Supervisor," "Aide," "Usher," and "Hostess."

title: Jessups at Itmad-ud-Daulah's Tomb
Scopenote: United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup (left) and Lois (Mrs. Philip C.) Jessup (second from right) outside the tomb of Itmad-ud-Daulah in Agra, India.  All other individuals are unidentified. The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East Ambassador Philip C. Jessup and party.

title: Kentucky Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Kentucky agriculture, specifically butter production.

title: Nebraska Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float featuring agriculture and re-enactors representing early settlement in Nebraska. Crowds of people line the streets.

title: Puerto Rico Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float featuring landscapes and native Puerto Ricans representing Puerto Rico. The United States Capitol Building can be seen in the distance.

title: Mississippi Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Mississippi, featuring swans and two young women in formal gowns.

title: Idaho Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Idaho which features recreational activities such as skiing and hunting.

title: Maryland Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Maryland Inaugural parade float featuring representations of the 1649 Maryland Toleration Act. A group of men in uniform can be seen marching behind them.

title: Louisiana Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Louisiana which features symbols of Mardi Gras festivities.

title: American Federation of Labor Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the American Federation of Labor (AFL) featuring the construction of a cornerstone, as the float stated that the AFL was the "cornerstone of prosperity." A float for the Congress of Industrial Organizations (CIO) can be seen behind the AFL float.

title: Communication Workers of America Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the Communication Workers of America (CWA) featuring telephone lines connecting the Capitol to a globe. All people on the float are unidentified.

title: Niagara Frontier Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the Niagara Frontier featuring Niagara Falls and other natural and man-made resources which support and/or are produced by the area.

title: Taj Mahal
Scopenote: The interior view of an unidentified mausoleum in Agra, India.  The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup.   The individual is unidentified.

title: Marine Corps Reserve Officers Association Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the Marine Corps Reserve Officers Association featuring men reenacting the 1945 raising of the flag over Iwo Jima, Japan. All people are unidentified. The floats of the American Federation of Labor (AFL) and the Congress of Industrial Organizations (CIO) can be seen behind the Marine Corps float.

title: National Fraternal Order of Negro Churches of America Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the National Fraternal Order of Negro Churches of America featuring members standing behind signs which list areas such as athletics, labor, and arts which the organization supports.

title: National Conference of Christians and Jews Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: This is a view of the Inaugural parade float representing the National Conference of Christians and Jews featuring symbols of the United States including an eagle, American flag, and the Statue of Liberty. The woman posing as the Statue of Liberty is Laura Brooks Jaecks. All others are unidentified.

title: B'nai B'rith Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing B'nai B'rith featuring a menorah. A banner along the bottom of the float has text "From Tyler to Truman" with a portrait of President John Tyler on the left and a portrait of President Truman on the right. A band can be seen marching behind the float.

title: Chinese American Community Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the Chinese American community featuring women in traditional Chinese clothing and small scale replicas of pagodas, lanterns, and the Great Wall. The float of the National Conference of Christians and Jews can be seen behind this float.

title: Truman-Barkley Club Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the Truman-Barkley Club featuring a ballot box and scenes from Washington, D.C., including the Washington Monument and the White House. The ballot box has "Freedom to Vote" printed on the side. Soldiers and a band can be seen marching behind the float.

title: Tennessee Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Tennessee featuring a re-enactment of early settlers. Part of the crowd alongside the street can be seen. All are unidentified.

title: Michigan Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Michigan featuring a map of the state which highlights various wildlife and recreational activities. A band can be seen marching behind the float.

title: Florida Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Florida featuring marlins, ocean waves, and oranges. A woman appears to be water-skiing. The slogan along the bottom of the float is "Florida/Where Summer Spends the Winter."

title: South Carolina Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing South Carolina featuring plant life from the state and unidentified women greeting parade attendees.

title: Wing of the Aircraft Bataan
Scopenote: Wing of the Aircraft Bataan as it flew over Japan. This photo was taken while Vernice Anderson traveled with Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: Gate at the Taj Mahal
Scopenote: The entrance gate to the Taj Mahal located in Agra, India.  The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.  All individuals are unidentified.

title: Delaware Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Delaware featuring re-enactors signing the United States Constitution. All are unidentified.

title: Lamar, Missouri Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Lamar, Missouri featuring a team of mules pulling a wagon of people, all of whom are unidentified.

title: Whistle Stop Express Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float featuring a train called "The Whistle Stop Express" and riders. Various cars of the train are labeled "Independence," "Lamar," and "Kansas City." All people are unidentified. A band can be seen marching behind the float.

title: Kentucky Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Kentucky featuring a fake race horse, jockeys, and horseshoes. A banner near the top of the float says "Truman Barkley Ran Like Citation."

title: Virginia Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Virginia featuring re-enactors of early United States presidents. Text printed at the bottom of the float is "Virginia/The Mother of States and of Statesmen." Presidents depicted on the visible side of the float include Thomas Jefferson, James Monroe, and James Madison.

title: American Federation of Musicians Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the American Federation of Musicians featuring live musicians and symbols such as treble clefs and piano keyboards.

title: Association of Railway Labor Executives Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the Association of Railway Labor Executives featuring a train and various railway laborers. All are unidentified.

title: Congress of Industrial Organizations Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the Congress of Industrial Organizations (CIO) featuring a house and men and women greeting parade attendees. All are unidentified. The Iowa state float can be seen behind the CIO float.

title: International Association of Lions Clubs Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the International Association of Lions Clubs featuring a statue of a lion and globe, and imagery related to the organization's blood donor program. Four unidentified women wearing what appear to be Red Cross uniforms are also on the float.

title: Hawaii Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Hawaii featuring torches and men in traditional Hawaiian clothing. The entire float and the vehicle pulling the float are covered with woven palm leaves, and the banner on the vehicle says "Hawaii/The 49th State." The floats for Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands can be seen behind the Hawaii float.

title: Relief Sculptures At Mausoleum in Agra
Scopenote: Relief sculptures at an unidentified mausoleum in Agra, India, possibly the tomb of Akbar the Great. The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.

title: International Association of Machinists Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the International Association of Machinists featuring cogs, a hand holding a tool, and men and a woman greeting parade attendees. Text on the side of the float reads "Freedom and Skill Make This Nation Great."

title: Texas Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Texas featuring symbols of the state including a star, oil rig, bull, and men and women dressed up in cowboy attire. All are unidentified. Following behind them is a marching band.

title: Kentucky Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing vacationing in Kentucky featuring a rainbow, waterfall, and map of the state. All people on the float are unidentified.

title: Paducah, Kentucky, Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Paducah, Kentucky, home of Vice-President Alben Barkley. Marching behind the float is Ashland, Kentucky's Tomcat Band. All are unidentified.

title: George Washington University Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing George Washington University featuring re-enactors displaying areas of study at the university including law, medicine, government, and engineering. Text at the bottom of the float is: "The George Washington University Educates for Leadership."

title: Virgin Islands Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the Virgin Islands featuring palm trees. A marching band is visible following behind the float.

title: District of Columbia Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the District of Columbia featuring the Capitol, Washington Monument, and an eagle.

title: U.S. Treasury Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the United States Treasury featuring savings bonds. Another unidentified float can be seen following behind.

title: Chicago, Illinois Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the city of Chicago, Illinois featuring imagery of the Chicago skyline and a heart that says "Chicago's Heart Turned the Tide to Victory to Harry S. Truman." The woman in the white velvet dress trimmed in gold at the front of the float is Patricia Reedy, who was designated the Inaugural Queen by the Chicago Sun-Times newspaper. The four other women on the float are unidentified. The float was designed by Alan Metreger.

title: Labor's League for Political Education Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the Labor's League for Political Education featuring an American family and a gate labeled "votes." A banner along the side of the float says "You Won the Day - In the American Way."

title: Entrance Gate of the Taj Mahal
Scopenote: View of the entrance gate of the Taj Mahal in Agra, India.  The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by the United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.

title: Massachusetts Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Massachusetts featuring a ship, Plymouth Rock, and re-enactors dressed as early colonists. All are unidentified.

title: Kentucky Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Kentucky coal mining featuring a mining site.

title: Nevada Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Nevada featuring wildlife and recreation opportunities found within the state. The United States Capitol Building can be seen in the far distance.

title: Oklahoma Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Oklahoma featuring a horse drawn carriage, cityscape, and men and women dressed in cowboy style and traditional Native American clothing greeting parade attendees. All are unidentified. The United States Capitol Building can be seen in the far distance.

title: North Carolina Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing North Carolina featuring a cityscape and a scale.

title: Illinois Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Illinois featuring the state seal and men and women greeting parade attendees. All are unidentified. The float for the city of Chicago can be seen behind the Illinois float.

title: New York Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing the State of New York featuring the New York City skyline. A marching band can be seen following behind the float.

title: Ohio Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Ohio featuring the state name in large free-standing letters and women greeting parade attendees.

title: Missouri Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Missouri featuring eight live horses pulling the float, a map of the state, the White House, American flags, and an eagle. Sign at the top of the float printed with wording "Our Greatest Missourian/Harry S. Truman." People standing on float are unidentified. The Lamar, Missouri float can be seen following behind the Missouri float, as well as various people on horseback.

title: Kentucky Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing Kentucky featuring a steam circus calliope pulled by eight horses. Sign on the side printed with wording: "Kentucky Salutes/President Truman/Vice Pres. Barkley/Under Their Leadership America Will Prosper." A row of motorcycles is following behind the float as the crowds of people spill into the street.

title: Building Interior at the Taj Mahal
Scopenote: View of the interior of one of the outbuildings at the Taj Mahal in Agra, India.  The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by the United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.  All individuals are unidentified.

title: California Inaugural Parade Float
Scopenote: Inaugural parade float representing California featuring the state seal and imagery of California's gold centennial including a covered wagon and Sutter's Mill. The Occidental Restaurant can be seen behind the float, with people standing on the roof viewing the parade.

title: Inaugural Grandstand Ticket Sales Sign
Scopenote: Sign advertising the availability of tickets for purchase for seating in Inaugural Grandstand No. 6.

title: Grandstands Along the Inaugural Parade Route
Scopenote: Grandstands located at Constitution Avenue and Delaware Avenue for the Inaugural Parade.

title: Presidential Stand on Inaugural Parade Route
Scopenote: Presidential stand for viewing the Inaugural Parade.

title: Grandstand No. 4 on the Inaugural Parade Route
Scopenote: View of a portion of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 4 is visible in the foreground.  The presidential stand for viewing the parade can be seen in the background. Cars and other vehicles can be seen along the road.

title: Grandstands No. 3 and 5 on the Inaugural Parade Route
Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route along Pennsylvania Avenue.  Grandstands No. 3 and 5 are featured. Some cars can be seen along the street. The White House is visible in the background, partly obscured.

title: Grandstand No. 5B on the Inaugural Parade Route
Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route passing by the Old Executive Office Building.  Grandstand No. 5B is featured.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route. Grandstand No. 6 is featured.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 7 is featured.

Scopenote: The Diwan-i-Khas, or the Hall of Private Audience, at Fatehpur Sikri in Agra, India. The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by the United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 8 is featured.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 8 is featured. Several cars can be seen along the street.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 9 is featured. People in photograph are unidentified.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 10 is featured. Unidentified people and cars can be seen along the street.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 11 is featured. Several cars are parked along the street.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 12 is featured. All people in photograph are unidentified.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 13 is featured. The dome of the United States Capitol Building can be seen in the distance at the end of the street. Cars can also be seen lined up along the side of the street.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 14 is featured. Cars and taxis are moving down the street. The Raleigh Hotel can be seen on the left side of the street.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 15 is featured.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 16 is featured. All people are unidentified.

Scopenote: The palace of Mughal Emperor Akbar the Great, the Fatehpur Palace, located in Fatehpur Sikri, India, near Agra.  All individuals are unidentified.  The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by the United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.

title: Grandstand No. 17 on the Inaugural Parade Route
Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 17 is featured, located outside the Department of Justice building. Cars can be seen along the street.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 18, along the side of the Department of Justice building, is featured. Cars can be seen along the side of the street.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 19 is featured. A car is parked in front of the stand.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 19A is featured.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 23 is featured. Several cars are lined up along the sidewalk.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 24, along part of Pennsylvania Avenue, is featured.

Scopenote: A view of a structure located with in the complex built by the Mughal Emperor Akbar the Great, Fatehpur Sikri, India, near Agra.  All individuals are unidentified.  The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by the United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 26 is featured. Cars can be seen moving along the street.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstands No. 27 and 28, near the United States Capitol Building are featured. Numerous cars are parked along the sidewalk and are moving down the street.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 29 is featured. Cars can be seen parked along the side of the street.

Scopenote: View of a section of the inaugural parade route.  Grandstand No. 30 is featured.

title: Chairman Accepts Automobile from Packard Motor Company
Scopenote: Melvin D. Hildreth, general chairman of the 1949 Inaugural Committee (left), accepts a new Packard automobile from Sam Broden (right), zone manager of the Packard Motor Company.  The car was loaned to the Inaugural Committee by the Packard Motor Company as a person vehicle for Mr. Hildreth.

title: Inaugural Committee Chairman and Secretary
Scopenote: Melvin D. Hildreth (left) and Walter F. Bramhall (right), Chairman and Secretary respectively of the 1949 Inaugural Committee, stand in front of committee office space.

title: Secretary and Chairman of the Inaugural Committee
Scopenote: Walter F. Bramhall and Melvin D. Hildreth, Secretary and Chairman respectively of the 1949 Inaugural Committee, stand in front of committee office space.

title: Inaugural Gala Performers Chester Lauck and Norris Goff, "Lum and Abner"
Scopenote: Chester Lauck and Norris Goff who played Columbus Edwards "Lum Eddards" and Abner Peabody in the radio show "Lum and Abner."  Lauck and Goff performed a comedy routine during the Inaugural Gala held January 19, 1949.

title: Inaugural Gala Performer Lucy Monroe
Scopenote: Singer Lucy Monroe performed the "Star Spangled Banner" at the Inaugural Gala held January 19, 1949.

title: Inaugural Gala Performer Jane Froman
Scopenote: Singer Jane Froman performed at the Inaugural Gala held January 19, 1949.

title: Ambassador Philip C. Jessup's Trip to India
Scopenote: Unidentified figures standing in an unidentified river in India. The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by the United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.

title: Inaugural Gala Performer George Jessel
Scopenote: Singer and actor George Jessel served as a Master of Ceremonies and performed three songs at the Inaugural Gala held January 19, 1949.

title: Inaugural Gala Performer Lena Horne
Scopenote: Singer and actress Lena Horne performed the song "Stormy Weather" at the Inaugural Gala held January 19, 1949. This photo is a production still from the MGM movie "Swing Fever."

title: Inaugural Gala Performer Lionel Hampton
Scopenote: Jazz musician Lionel Hampton and his band performed at the Inaugural Gala held January 19, 1949. In this photo, he is shown playing his vibraphone.

title: Inaugural Gala Performers Tony and Sally De Marco
Scopenote: Dancers Tony and Sally De Marco performed at the Inaugural Gala held January 19, 1949.

title: Inaugural Gala Performer Gene Kelly
Scopenote: Dancer and actor Gene Kelly served as a Master of Ceremonies and performed at the Inaugural Gala held January 19, 1949. This photo is a still from the MGM motion picture "Living in a Big Way."

title: Inaugural Gala Performer Phil Regan
Scopenote: Singer Phil Regan served as a Master of Ceremony and performed at the Inaugural Gala held January 19, 1949.

Scopenote: Singer Jane Powell performed "Love Is Where You Find It" and "Buttons and Bows" at the Inaugural Gala held January 19, 1949.

title: Inaugural Gala Performer Dorothy Maynor
Scopenote: Opera singer Dorothy Maynor performed "Were You There When They Crucified My Lord" and "Alleluja" at the Inaugural Gala held January 19, 1949.

title: Inaugural Gala Performer Justin Lawrie
Scopenote: Chorus master Justin Lawrie led a group of singers gathered from choirs, colleges, and organizations of Washington, D.C. during a performance at the Inaugural Gala held January 19, 1949.

Scopenote: Conductor Phil Spitalny directed the Hour of Charm All-Girl Orchestra during a performance at the Inaugural Gala held January 19, 1949.

Scopenote: Opera singer Lawrence Tibbett participated in the inaugural events held January 1949.

Scopenote: Actor Gene Autry participated in the inaugural events held January, 1949. This photo is a still from the Columbia Pictures motion picture "Loaded Pistols."

title: Aerial View of Inauguration Stand Arrangement Plans
Scopenote: This aerial view of the inauguration stand arrangement plans shows the main stand (No. 1) level with and about 100 feet from the president (in circle); stands No. 2 and 3, at the rear of the important guest's seats about 130 feet from the president, and below; two additional grand stands located at the fountains (No. 4 and 5) about 275 feet away; two small stands at No. 6 for a backshot of the ceremony; long overhead backshots from the roofs at No. 7 and 8; and a possibility of additional positions on the roof of the Senate office building and the dome of the Library of Congress.

title: American Federation of Music Inaugural Parade Float Design
Scopenote: The design for the American Federation of Music float seen in the Inaugural Parade held January 20, 1949.  Meant to honor piano-playing President Harry S. Truman, the float depicts a 30 x 11-foot piano decorated in red, white, and blue, atop which rides a 25-piece band.

title: Inaugural Parade Float Preparations
Scopenote: Floatbuilder Earl Hargrove constructed paper-mache animals at the Washington, D.C. National Guard Armory for Inaugural Parade floats.  The longhorn appeared on the Texas float, the eagle served as bowpiece on the Missouri Float, and the other cattle pictured were placed on various Kentucky floats.

title: Inaugural Parade Float Designs
Scopenote: Paul Riedel and Earl Hargrove discuss an artist's sketch from which they constructed floats for the Inaugural Parade. On the wall are sketches for floats for (top, left to right) North Carolina and Kentucky, (center) Communications Workers of America and an early Kentucky sketch, (bottom) Missouri and Texas. Partially blocked by Riedel's hat is another Kentucky float sketch.

title: Inaugural Parade Missouri Float Design
Scopenote: Design for the Missouri Inaugural Parade Float drawn by Frank B. Nuderscher of St. Louis, Missouri.  The Missouri float, constructed at the Washington, D.C. National Guard Armory, led all other floats in the Inaugural Parade held January 20, 1949.

title: Model of Proposed Corregidor-Bataan Memorial
Scopenote: Photograph of a model showing a proposed design for the Corregidor-Bataan Memorial, later called the Pacific War Memorial.  The model was created by Naramore, Bain, Brady & Johanson Architects, AIA.

title: Photograph of Chester William Nimitz
Scopenote: Photograph of Admiral Chester William Nimitz sent to the members of the Corregidor-Bataan Memorial Commission. Mat of photograph is autographed by Nimitz: "To the Members of the Corregidor-Bataan Commission with best wishes C.W. Nimitz, Fleet Admiral, USN."

title: Emmet O'Neal with Filipino Soldiers and Their Families
Scopenote: United States Ambassador to the Philippines Emmet O'Neal (back to camera), standing among a group of Filipino soldiers and their family members, holding the hand of a woman wearing a medal presented to her in honor of a family member's military service. All others are unidentified.

title: Corregidor-Bataan Memorial Commission Members
Scopenote: Members of the Corregidor-Bataan Memorial Commission gathered around proposal documents for the construction of the memorial.  Emmet O'Neal, who served as a member and eventually Chairman of the commission, is seated third from the left. Also present is Admiral Chester W. Nimitz (second from the left). All others are unidentified.

title: Emmet O'Neal With Filipino Leaders
Scopenote: United States Ambassador Emmet O'Neal with Philippine leaders, who worked together to get the Philippine Veterans Bill reported out of the United States House of Representatives. From left to right: Philippine Representative Ramon Magsaysay; Ambassador O'Neal; Philippine Ambassador to the United States Joaquin Elizalde; and Philippine Representative Atilano Cinco.

title: Merchant in the Streets of Pakistan
Scopenote: A unidentified sugar cane merchant in an unidentified location in Pakistan. The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.

title: Truman Signs P.L. 82-21 Surrounded by Legislation Supporters
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated) signing Public Law 82-21 which authorized funeral and burial benefits, including burial flags, for Commonwealth Army veterans residing in the Philippines.  Behind the President are supporters of the legislation comprised of members of the Philippine government including Philippine Ambassador J.M. Elizalde (third from left) and Philippine Representatives Atilano Cinco and Ramon Magsaysay (second and third from right).  Standing center is American Ambassador Emmet O'Neal. Others are unidentified.

title: Artist's Rendering of the Pacific War Memorial
Scopenote: Artist's rendering of the Pacific War Memorial drawn for the Corregidor-Bataan Memorial Commission as construction began on the memorial on island of Corregidor, Philippines.

title: Emmet O'Neal Boarding a Vessel
Scopenote: United States Ambassador to the Philippines Emmet O'Neal (in white suit, back to camera) boarding a vessel as United States Naval personnel stand at his sides. Others are unidentified.

title: Artist's Rendering of the Corregidor-Bataan Memorial
Scopenote: Artists rendering of the Corregidor-Bataan Memorial, later called the Pacific War Memorial.  The design was created by Naramore, Bain, Brady & Johanson Architects & Engineers with Lawrence Halprin & Associates Landscape Architects.

title: Alexander Wiley with Members of the Corregidor-Bataan Memorial Commission
Scopenote: Senator Alexander Wiley with Members of the Corregidor-Bataan Memorial Commission. From left to right: Philippine General Balatio Cruz; Colonel Jose Razon, Congressman James E. Van Zandt; General Carlos P. Romulo, Philippine Ambassador; Emmet O'Neal, Chairman of the Corregidor-Bataan Memorial Commission; General Eulodio Baleo, Secretary of National Defense of the Philippines; Senator Wiley; Captain Samuel G. Kelly; and Congressman Armistead Selden in the Vice-President of the United States' office.  The picture O'Neal and Baleo hold is a rendering of the proposed memorial to be constructed on the island of Corregidor, Philippines.

title: Emmet O'Neal Exchanging a Document with a Filipino Leader
Scopenote: United States Ambassador to the Philippines Emmet O'Neal (left) exchanging a document with a Filipino leader during a ceremony. Other people and event are unknown.

title: Philippine and American Troops at the Pacific War Memorial
Scopenote: Philippine and American colors, standards, and soldiers for the arrival honors for Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos at the Pacific War Memorial inaugural ceremony.  The memorial is located on the island of Corregidor, Philippines.

title: Pacific War Memorial Inaugural Ceremony Invocation
Scopenote: Invocation being delivered by Fr. Pacifico Ortiz, S.J. at the inaugural ceremony of the Pacific War Memorial located on the island of Corregidor, Philippines.

title: Ferdinand Marcos Presenting an Award to Armistead Seldon, Jr., at the Pacific War Memorial
Scopenote: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos (left) presenting the Ancient Order of Sikatuna Award for the late Honorable Emmet O'Neal to Congressman Armistead Selden, Jr., during the Pacific War Memorial inaugural ceremony. Seated in the background on the right is the First Lady of the Philippines, Imelda Marcos. Others are unidentified. The Pacific War Memorial is located on the island of Corregidor, Philippines.

title: Ambassador Williams Delivering a Speech at the Pacific War Memorial
Scopenote: Ambassador G. Mennen Williams (standing) delivering a speech during the inaugural ceremonies for the Pacific War Memorial. Seated behind him is Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos (left), Philippine First Lady Imelda Marcos (second from left), and Nancy (Mrs. G. Mennen) Williams. All others are unidentified. The memorial is located on the island of Corregidor, Philippines.

title: Marcos and Williams Signing Turnover Document for the Pacific War Memorial
Scopenote: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos (left) and United States Ambassador G. Mennen Williams (right) signing the document for the turnover of the Pacific War Memorial from the United States government to the Philippine government during the inaugural ceremony for the memorial. All others are unidentified. The memorial is located on the island of Corregidor, Philippines.

title: Ferdinand Marcos Delivering a Speech at the Pacific War Memorial
Scopenote: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos (standing) delivering a speech during the inaugural ceremony for the Pacific War Memorial.  Seated behind him are United States Ambassador to the Philippines G. Mennen Williams (front row, third from the left), Philippine First Lady Imelda Marcos (fourth from left), and Nancy (Mrs. G. Mennen) Williams (fifth from left). All others are unidentified. The memorial is located on the island of Corregidor, Philippines.

title: Dedicatory Tablet Unveiling at the Pacific War Memorial
Scopenote: Philippine First Lady Imelda R. Marcos (under umbrella) and Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos (standing next to children, right) unveiling the dedicatory marble tablet of the Pacific War Memorial during the inaugural ceremony for the memorial.  All others are unidentified. The memorial is located on the island of Corregidor, Philippines.

title: Ferdinand Marcos Speaking at Inaugural Ceremony for the Pacific War Memorial
Scopenote: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos (right) speaking at the inaugural ceremony for the Pacific War Memorial.  All others are unidentified. The memorial is located on the island of Corregidor, Philippines.

title: Imelda Marcos and Nancy Williams Cut Ceremonial Ribbon for the Pacific War Memorial
Scopenote: Philippine First Lady Imelda R. Marcos (center) and Nancy (Mrs. G. Mennen) Williams (right), wife of the United States Ambassador, cut the ceremonial ribbon for the Pacific War Memorial during the inaugural ceremony for the memorial.  Looking on his Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos (left). All others are unidentified. The memorial is located on the island of Corregidor, Philippines.

title: The Admiralty Arch
Scopenote: View of the Admiralty Arch located in London, England.  The archway leads to the Admiralty Building, which was commissioned in memory of Queen Victoria.  The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.

title: Ferdinand and Imelda Marcos Lead Crowd in Touring the Pacific War Memorial
Scopenote: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos (foreground second from left, behind Mrs. Marcos) and Philippine First Lady Imelda R. Marcos (foreground, center) lead attendees of the Pacific War Memorial inaugural ceremony on a tour of the memorial.  The presidential party is approaching the marble altar within the rotunda at the memorial.  Others are unidentified. The memorial is located on the island of Corregidor, Philippines.

title: View of the Pacific War Memorial Rotunda
Scopenote: View of the marble panel walls leading to the rotunda at the Pacific War Memorial located on the island of Corregidor, Philippines.

title: Interior View of the Pacific War Memorial Rotunda
Scopenote: Interior view of the rotunda at the Pacific War Memorial located on the island of Corregidor, Philippines.  This view shows the circular marble altar at the center directly under the rotunda's oculus.

title: View of the Pacific War Memorial
Scopenote: View of the Pacific War Memorial located on the island of Corregidor, Philippines.  The rotunda is visible in the background, while ruins and the ceremonial court appear in the foreground.  Within the ceremonial court one of two flagpoles is seen.  These flagpoles were installed to fly the Philippine and American flags.

title: Architects Perspective Drawing of the Pacific War Memorial
Scopenote: Architects perspective drawing of the Pacific War Memorial located on the island of Corregidor, Philippines.  Shown predominantly at the center is the rotunda with a circular altar directly under the dome's oculus.  On the left foreground is the tourist building housing a museum and film projection room.  Beyond the rotunda on the left is the monument on a raised platform at the end.

title: Douglas MacArthur and Jonathan M. Wainwright
Scopenote: General Douglas MacArthur (right) and Major General Jonathan M. Wainwright (left).  Wainwright served under MacArthur as the senior field commander of Filipino and United States forces responsible for resisting the Japanese invasion of the Philippines.
