title: Ambassador and Mrs. Robert Butler Leave the U.S.S. Williamsburg at Havana, Cuba
Scopenote: United States Ambassador to Cuba Robert Butler and his wife disembark from the presidential yacht U.S.S. Williamsburg. First Lady Bess W. Truman, Margaret Truman, and others used the Williamsburg to travel to Havana, Cuba for a day while they were on vacation with President Harry S. Truman in Key West, Florida. The Butlers called upon Mrs. Truman and Miss Truman while they were in Havana.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman Depart Key West
Scopenote: From left to right, Washington Governor Monrad C. Wallgren, an unidentified man, Margaret Truman, First Lady Bess W. Truman and General Harry H. Vaughan watch departure ceremonies at the airport in Key West, Florida. They are preparing to return to Washington, D.C. after a vacation in Florida with President Harry S. Truman (not pictured). All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Inspects the Marine Guard at Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in civilian clothes, center) holds an informal inspection of the detachment of Marines that guarded the Little White House while he was on vacation at Key West, Florida. He is accompanied by Major Harold A. Hayes. All other Marines are unidentified.

title: President Truman Inspects Marine Guard at Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, in civilian clothes) holds an informal inspection of the detachment of Marines that guarded the Little White House while he was on vacation at Key West, Florida. He is accompanied by Major Harold A. Hayes. All other Marines are unidentified.

title: The London Bridge
Scopenote: Distant view of the London Bridge which connects the city of London and Southwark, London. The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.

title: President Truman Holds Press Conference in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, with hands on hips) holds a press conference in the garden of The Little White House while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Standing behind the President, from left to right are: Press Secretary Charles Ross (partly obscured by camera flash bulb) Admiral William Leahy, General Harry Vaughan, Stuart Symington and Clark Clifford. All other reporters and photographers are unidentified.

title: President Truman with Staff Members On Vacation
Scopenote: From left to right in the foreground, Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington, President Harry S. Truman and Washington State Governor Monrad Wallgren pose for pictures at The Little White House while on vacation in Key West, Florida. In the background on the left is Special Counsel to the President Clark Clifford. All others are unidentified.

title: Marching Band in Key West
Scopenote: As part of a joke played on Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly (background, right, in suit and tie), an African-American marching band led Mr. Connelly and Press Secretary Charles Ross (partly obscured by trumpeter) into the gates of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. They were in Key West to join President Harry S. Truman on vacation. All others are unidentified.

title: Baton Twirlers from the Douglas School of Key West
Scopenote: In a joke being played on Appointment Secretary  Matthew Connelly and Press Secretary Charles Ross upon their arrival at Key West, Florida, African-American baton twirlers and a marching band lead them to the Little White House. They are in Key West to join President Harry S. Truman and his party on vacation. Mr. Ross can be seen on the far left, behind the band, wearing a bow tie. On the extreme right, from right to left, are Stanley Woodward, General Harry Vaughan, Margaret Truman, and General Wallace Graham. All others are unidentified.

title: Presidential Party Passes the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in large white hat) and other members of his party pass by the presidential yacht U.S.S. Williamsburg on the way to the beach to swim. They are in Key West, Florida for a post-election vacation. All others are unidentified.

title: Barkley, Biffle and Captain Dennison at Airport
Scopenote: From left to right, Senator and Vice President-Elect Alben Barkley, Mr. Leslie Biffle and Captain Robert Dennison depart the Boca Chica airfield in an open car on the way to meet President Harry S. Truman at the Little White House in Key West, Florida. They are joining President Truman and the rest of his party for a post-election vacation.

title: Captain Adell Greets President Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) is greeted by Captain Cecil Adell upon his arrival at the Boca Chica airfield. President Truman is on his way to the Little White House, Key West, Florida to vacation after winning the election for his second term. In the background is the presidential airplane, the Independence.

title: President Harry S. Truman's Motorcade Travels to The Little White House
Scopenote: Onlookers lined the streets in Key West, Florida, as the Presidential motorcade travels to The Little White House for vacation. President Harry S. Truman is sitting in the back of the open car at the front. All others are unidentified.

title: Small Craft Comes Alongside the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: A small craft comes along side the presidential yacht U.S.S Williamsburg crewed by United States sailors. All are unidentified. This photo was taken during President Harry S. Truman's post-election vacation in Key West, Florida.

title: Truman Aboard the U.S.S Williamsburg with His Staff and Others
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (far right with back to camera) and others on board the presidential yacht U.S.S. Williamsburg during a vacation cruise to Bermuda. From left to right: Special Counsel to the President Clark Clifford; Ted Marks; unidentified Navy officer; unidentified man; Press Secretary Charles Ross (back to camera); Major General Harry Vaughan; George Allen; and President Truman.

title: The Palace of Westminster
Scopenote: View of the Palace of Westminster (also referred to as the Houses of Parliament) and the Victoria Tower.  The photograph was taken during a trip to the Far East by United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup and party.

title: President Truman with Others on Vacation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) visits with Press Secretary Charles Ross  (left) and unidentified man while he is on a vacation cruise. They are probably on board the presidential yacht U.S.S. Williamsburg.

title: President Truman Displays His Catch
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, on board the presidential yacht U.S.S. Williamsburg, displays his catch after a day of fishing. President Truman was on the Williamsburg on a vacation cruise. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman with the Day's Catch
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and two unidentified sailors show off the results of a days worth of fishing by President Truman and other members of his party. President Harry S. Truman was on board the presidential yacht U.S.S. Williamsburg on a vacation cruise. All others are unidentified.

title: Snyder and Truman on a Fishing Expedition
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground) on a fishing expedition aboard the presidential yacht, the U.S.S. Williamsburg. Also present is Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder (left). Sailors in the background on the right are unidentified.

title: President Truman and Others on the Beach
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in hat) talks with two unidentified members of his party as they relax on the Enlisted Men's Beach at Key West, Florida. President Truman was in Key West for a post-election vacation.

title: Truman with Staff and Others on Key West Beach
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (in hat) talks with several members of his party as they relax on the Enlisted Men's Beach at the naval station at Key West, Florida. Among those present are Vice President-elect Alben Barkley (standing, second from right) and Assistant Press Secretary Eben Ayers (right). Truman was in Key West for a post-election vacation. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Enjoys a Swim Off Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with unidentified members of his party enjoy a swim at the Enlisted Men's Beach at naval air station at Key West, Florida. He is in Key West for a post-election vacation.

title: Harry S. Truman's Party Relaxes On the Beach at the Naval Air Station, Key West
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's party relax on the Enlisted Men's Beach at the naval air station at Key West, Florida. They joined President Truman (not pictured) for a post-election vacation in Key West.

title: Truman with Representatives of The American Legion
Scopenote: From left to right, Mr. Vance Stirrup, Commander American Legion 10th District, Florida; Mr. Albert Mills, Past National Committeeman; President Harry S. Truman; and Mr. George A. Warren, American Legion Post Commander visit with President Truman while he is on vacation. The gentlemen present President Truman with guyaberas (Cuban Irish linen sport shirts) and a gold medal commemorating his visit to the 1948 American Legion Convention. They are standing on the grounds of the Little White House in Key West, Florida.

title: President Truman Receives Gifts from American Legion
Scopenote: From left to right, Mr. Vance Stirrup, Commander American Legion 10th District, Florida; Mr. Albert Mills, Past National Committeeman; President Harry S. Truman; and Mr. George A. Warren, American Legion Post Commander visit with President Truman while he is on vacation. The gentlemen present President Truman with guyaberas (Cuban Irish linen sport shirts) and a gold medal commemorating his visit to the 1948 American Legion Convention. They are standing on the grounds of the Little White House in Key West, Florida.

title: Luncheon for Ambassador Jessup
Scopenote: United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup (far right) during a trip to the Far East.  Pictured: unidentified man, Ambassador Jessup's Secretary, Miss Vernice Anderson (second from left), unidentified male, and Ambassador Jessup.

title: Truman Receives American Legion Representatives
Scopenote: From left to right, Mr. Albert Mills, Past National Committeeman; Mr. Vance Stirrup, Commander American Legion 10th District, Florida; President Harry S. Truman; and Mr. George A. Warren, American Legion Post Commander visit with President Truman while he is on vacation. The gentlemen present President Truman with guyaberas (Cuban Irish linen sport shirts) and a gold medal commemorating his visit to the 1948 American Legion Convention. They are standing on the grounds of the Little White House in Key West, Florida.

title: Ambassador and Mrs. Robert Butler Board the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: United States Ambassador to Cuba Robert Butler and his wife board the presidential yacht U.S.S. Williamsburg. First Lady Bess W. Truman, Margaret Truman, and others used the Williamsburg to travel to Havana, Cuba for a day while they were on vacation with President Harry S. Truman in Key West, Florida. The Butlers called upon Mrs. Truman and Miss Truman while they were in Havana.

title: Guests of the Trumans Board the U.S.S Williamsburg in Havana, Cuba
Scopenote: Unidentified guests of the Trumans board the U.S.S Williamsburg in Havana, Cuba. First Lady Bess W. Truman, Margaret Truman, and others used the Williamsburg to travel to Havana, Cuba for a day while they were on vacation with President Harry S. Truman in Key West, Florida.

title: United States Sailors Stand At Attention
Scopenote: United States sailors stand at attention and salute. They are probably aboard the presidential yacht U.S.S. Williamsburg. The exact location is unknown.

title: View of Havana Harbor From the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: View of Havana Harbor taken from the U.S.S. Williamsburg, showing the lighthouse. First Lady Bess W. Truman, Margaret Truman, and others used the Williamsburg to travel to Havana, Cuba for a day while they were on vacation with President Harry S. Truman in Key West, Florida.

title: View of Havana Harbor from U.S.S Williamsburg
Scopenote: View of Havana Harbor taken from the U.S.S. Williamsburg, showing the lighthouse. First Lady Bess W. Truman, Margaret Truman, and others used the Williamsburg to travel to Havana, Cuba for a day while they were on vacation with President Harry S. Truman in Key West, Florida.

title: Sailor Lowers the American Flag as the Sun Sets
Scopenote: As the sun sets, an unidentified United States sailor lowers the American flag on the presidential yacht U.S.S. Williamsburg. This photo was taken during a cruise by First Lady Bess W. Truman and Margaret Truman to Cuba during their vacation to Key West, Florida with President Harry S. Truman.

title: Garden of Little White House, Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Chairs and tables are arranged in customary fashion in the garden of the Little White House, Key West, Florida, in preparation for meetings with the press. President Harry S. Truman vacationed at the Little White House following the 1948 presidential election.

title: Garden of Little White House, Arranged for Press Conference
Scopenote: Chairs and tables are arranged in customary fashion in the garden of the Little White House, Key West, Florida, in preparation for meetings with the press. President Harry S. Truman vacationed at the Little White House following the 1948 presidential election.

title: Truman Arrives at Boca Chica Airfield, Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is the first to deplane from the presidential plane Independence upon arrival at Boca Chica Airfield, Key West, Florida.  The president was vacationing after he successfully won election for a second term in office.

title: Ambassador Jessup Arrives in New York
Scopenote: United States Ambassador-at-large Philip C. Jessup (left) with an unidentified reporter. Ambassador Jessup had just returned to New York City from a two and a half month trip to the Far East.

title: Truman Leaves Boca Chica Airfield for The Little White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing) joins Captain Cecil Adell (seated, right) and Honorable A. Maitland Adams, Mayor of Key West, Florida (seated, left) in a car in preparation for traveling to the Little White House in Key West. President Truman is in Key West for a post-election vacation. The presidential plane Independence is in the background. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Motorcade Travels to the Little White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands in his Lincoln convertible automobile and waves at the welcoming Key West, Florida crowd on his way to the Little White House as Captain Cecil Adell sits in the center.  Naval signal flags flutter in the breeze over the street. President Truman is in Key West for a post-election vacation. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman with Barkley and Biffle, Key West, Florida
Scopenote: From left to right, Senator and Vice President-elect Alben Barkley, President Harry S. Truman, and Mr. Leslie Biffle pose outside the Little White House upon the gentlemen's arrival. President Truman is in Key West for a post-election vacation. Others in background are unidentified.

title: Dennison Greets Barkley Upon His Arrival at Boca Chica Airfield, Key West
Scopenote: Captain Robert Dennison (foreground, left) greets Senator and Vice President-elect Alben Barkley (foreground, right) upon his arrival at Boca Chica airfield, Key West, Florida, with an airplane in the background. He is joining President Harry S. Truman for a post-election vacation. Others in background are unidentified.

title: Dennison Greets Boyle Upon His Arrival at Boca Chica Airfield, Key West
Scopenote: Captain Robert Dennison (left) greets William Boyle, Assistant to the Chairman of the Democratic National Committee (right) upon his arrival at Boca Chica airfield, Key West, Florida, with an airplane in the background. He is joining President Harry S. Truman for a post-election vacation.

title: Senator McGrath and Mr. Boyle Arrive at Boca Chica Airfield
Scopenote: In the back seat of the car are Senator J. Howard McGrath, Chairman of the Democratic National Committee, (right) and Mr. William M. Boyle, Assistant to the Chairman of the Democratic National Committee, (second from right) after they arrive in Key West, Florida from Washington, D.C. They were met at Boca Chica Airfield by Naval Aide to the President Captain Robert Dennison (front seat of car). Their airplane can be seen in the background. They flew to Key West to join President Harry S. Truman on a post-election vacation. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Greets Senator McGrath Upon His Arrival at The Little White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from left) greets Senator and Democratic National Committee Chairman J. Howard McGrath (left) upon his arrival at the Little White House, Key West, Florida. He flew to Key West to join President Truman on a post-election vacation. Also present is Assistant Press Secretary Eben Ayers (third from left) and Assistant to the Democratic National Committee Chairman William Boyle (fourth from left, partly obscured). Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Goes For A Walk with Members of His Party
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center with cane) and members of his vacation party prepare to go for a walk. From left to right, Leslie Biffle, Admiral William D. Leahy, unidentified naval officer mostly obscured by Leahy, President Truman, Senator and Vice President-elect Alben Barkley, Jonathan Daniels (behind Barkley) and William J. Bray.

title: Truman and His Party Pose for Photograph During Visit to Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his vacation party pose for photograph in the garden of the Little White House. Back row, left to right: Administrative Assistant to the President Donald Dawson, Assistant Press Secretary Eben Ayers, General Robert Landry, General Harry Vaughan, Leslie Biffle, Special Counsel to the President Clark Clifford, Stanley Woodward, General Wallace Graham, Captain Robert Dennison, William J. Bray, Jonathan Daniels. Front row, left to right: Correspondence Secretary William D. Hassett, Senator and Vice President-elect Alben Barkley, President Truman, Admiral William D. Leahy, and Assistant to the President John R. Steelman.

title: Truman Motorcade Travels Along Caroline Street
Scopenote: Naval men and officers "manned the rail" along Caroline Street after the President Harry S. Truman's motorcade enters naval air station on the way to the Little White House in Key West, Florida. President Truman traveled to Key West for a post-election vacation. Truman in seated in the left back seat of the first car. All others are unidentified.

title: The Royal Palace in Kyoto
Scopenote: The Royal Palace in Kyoto, Japan.  All people are unidentified. This photo was taken while Vernice Anderson traveled with Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: Ambassador Jessup's Return From the Far East
Scopenote: United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup prior to his return from his trip to the Far East.  From left to right: William M. Gibson, Aide to Ambassador Jessup; Lois (Mrs. Philip C.) Jessup; Ambassador Jessup; and Vernice Anderson, Secretary to Ambassador Jessup.

title: Truman Arrives at Boca Chica, Florida
Scopenote: Captain Cecil Adell (far right) presents civic officials and a group of senior naval officers to President Harry S. Truman (foreground right, with cane) in Key West, Florida. President Truman was in Key West on a vacation.

title: Truman at Veterans of Foreign War Convention
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman wearing an attendee badge for the 1944 Veterans of Foreign Wars convention.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Party Tour Fort Jefferson National Monument
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (far right with cane) tour Fort Jefferson National Monument with members of his White House staff and advisors. Also present are First Lady Bess Truman (foreground, in solid dress) and Margaret Truman (foreground, in patterned dress). All others are unidentified. The Truman family and staff were on a post-election vacation.

title: The Presidential Yacht U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: The presidential yacht the U.S.S. Williamsburg under way off Key West, Florida. President Harry S. Truman used the yacht while he was taking a post-election vacation in Florida.

title: Truman Family and Staff On the Way to Fort Jefferson
Scopenote: (L-R) Margaret Truman, President Harry S. Truman, unidentified naval officer, and First Lady Bess Truman on board the ships The Big Wheel on the way to Fort Jefferson National Monument, which is off the coast of Key West, Florida. They are in Florida for a post-election vacation.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman Enter Fort Jefferson National Monument
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman (second from left) and Miss Margaret Truman (second from right) approach the entrance to Fort Jefferson National Monument accompanied by two unidentified naval officers. They are at Fort Jefferson with President Harry S. Truman and other members of his party for a post-election vacation.

title: President Harry S. Truman and His Party Tour Fort Jefferson National Monument
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at far right with cane) listens as a guide conducts a tour of Fort Jefferson National Monument, off of Key West, Florida. Other members of President Truman's party are unidentified. President Truman and members of his staff visited Fort Jefferson and Key West while on a post-election vacation.

title: President Truman and His Party Tour Fort Jefferson National Monument
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (with hat and cane on left) and his party are given a tour of Fort Jefferson National Monument by one of the historical guides at Fort Jefferson, off of Key West, Florida. Standing on the right of President Truman is First Lady Bess W. Truman. All others are unidentified. President Truman and members of his staff took a post-election vacation in Key West.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman Enter Fort Jefferson National Monument
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman (third from left, mostly obscured by Margaret) and Miss Margaret Truman (second from left) approach the entrance to Fort Jefferson National Monument accompanied by two unidentified naval officers. They are at Fort Jefferson with President Harry S. Truman and other members of his party for a post-election vacation.

title: Sailors Assist Margaret Truman Aboard The Wheel
Scopenote: Miss Margaret Truman boards ship The Big Wheel with the assistance of several unidentified sailors. She is boarding the ship for fishing excursion off of Key West, Florida. She is with President Harry S. Truman and other members of his party for a post-election vacation in Key West. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman at Wake Island
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) on Wake Island, where he flew to meet with General Douglas MacArthur.  All other individuals are unidentified.

title: President Truman Sees His Family Off For a Day of Fishing Off Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, second from left) greets an unidentified naval officer while Miss Margaret Truman (right) looks on.  The President had escorted Miss Truman and her mother, Mrs. Bess Truman (not pictured) to the dock where they would embark on a day of fishing off Key West on board the ship Big Wheel. The family was in Key West for a post-election vacation.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman Fish Off Key West
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman (in hat) and her daughter Margaret Truman and an unidentified naval officer fish off the side of the ship Big Wheel while visiting Key West, Florida. They joined President Harry S. Truman (not pictured) for a post-election vacation.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman Enjoy the Sun Off Key West
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman (right) sits next to an unidentified naval officer while Miss Margaret Truman relaxes in the sun.  They were onboard the ship Big Wheel off Key West, Florida. They joined President Harry S. Truman (not pictured) for a post-election vacation.

title: Stanley Woodward Fishes Off Key West
Scopenote: State Department Chief of Protocol Stanley Woodward fishes while on board the Big Wheel off Key West, Florida. He joined President Harry S. Truman (not pictured) on a post-election vacation in Key West.

title: Deep Sea Fishing Off Key West
Scopenote: An unidentified member of President Harry S. Truman's vacation party fishes while on board the Big Wheel off Key West, Florida. He joined President Truman (not pictured) on a post-election vacation in Key West.

title: Margaret and Bess Truman Sailing with Stanley Woodward
Scopenote: Miss Margaret Truman (back to camera, third from left) talks with Department of State Chief of Protocol Stanley Woodward while her mother, First Lady Bess Truman and two unidentified men look on.  The Trumans and their guests were on board the ship Big Wheel off Key West, Florida. They joined President Harry S. Truman (not pictured) for a post-election vacation in Key West.

title: Margaret and Bess Truman Fish Off Key West
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman (in hat) and her daughter Margaret Truman fish off the side of the ship Big Wheel while visiting Key West, Florida. They joined President Harry S. Truman (not pictured) for a post-election vacation.

title: The Big Wheel Docked at the Naval Air Station, Key West
Scopenote: The ship Big Wheel docked at the Naval Air Station, Key West, Florida. First Lady Bess W. Truman and Margaret Truman (not pictured) took the Big Wheel out for a fishing excursion off the coast of Florida while they were on a post-election vacation with President Harry S. Truman.

title: Truman Walks at the Key West Naval Air Station
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (far left with cane) walks at the Naval Air Station in Key West, Florida, accompanied by (from left to right) Senator and Vice President-elect Alben Barkley, Leslie Biffle, Jonathan Daniels, Admiral William D. Leahy, William J. Bray, and an unidentified naval officer (mostly obscured by Leahy). President Truman and his advisors were in Key West for a post-election vacation.

title: Truman Walks at Key West Naval Air Station with Members of His Party
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front left) walks with Senator and Vice President-elect Alben Barkley, followed by Leslie Biffle (left) and William J. Bray (right) at the Naval Air Station in Key West, Florida. President Truman and his advisors were in Key West for a post-election vacation.

title: Truman at Wake Island
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) on Wake Island, along with his Press Secretary, Charles Ross (third from right).  All other individuals are unidentified.  President Truman traveled to Wake Island to meet with General Douglas MacArthur.

title: President Truman Greets Visitors
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, in light shirt and pants) joins in the fun of the mock reception held for the arrival of Press Secretary Charles Ross (right) and Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly (far right in profile) at Key West, Florida.  Also present are (from left to right) State Department Chief of Protocol Stanley Woodward, Administrative Assistant David Niles, Assistant to the President John Steelman, and Governor of Washington Mon Wallgren. All others are unidentified. Truman and his staff and advisors were in Key West for a post-election vacation.

title: Truman Greets New Arrivals at Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) participates in the mock reception of Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly (far right) and Press Secretary Charles Ross (left of Connelly) to Key West, Florida by unidentified person.  Also present are (from left to right) Assistant to the President John R. Steelman, governor of Washington Monrad Wallgren, and writer Jonathan Daniels. Truman and his advisers and staff were in Key West for a post-election vacation.

title: President Truman Joins in the Fun of the Mock Reception in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) joins in the fun of the mock reception for Press Secretary Charles Ross and Appointment Secretary Matthew Connelly upon their arrival in Key West, Florida. From left to right, Jonathan Daniels, Charles Ross, Matthew Connelly (partially obscured), and  President Harry S. Truman. Others are unidentified. President Truman and his advisors and staff were in Key West for a post-election vacation.

title: Truman Poses with Members of His Staff at Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) with Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington (left) and Washington State Governor Monrad Wallgren as they pose for pictures in the garden of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. In the background on the left is Special Counsel Clark Clifford. All others are unidentified. President Truman and members of his staff and advisors were in Key West for a post-election vacation.

title: Presidential Press Conference While on Vacation in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing, right) gives a press conference in the garden of the Little White House while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Photographers and reporters gathered around are all unidentified.

title: Truman Gives a Press Conference While on Vacation at Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing, center foreground) gives a press conference in the garden of the Little White House while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Reporters and photographers who are gathered in front of him are unidentified. Standing behind Truman are, from left to right: Captain Robert Dennison; Washington State Governor Mon Wallgren; Admiral William Leahy; General Harry Vaughan; Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington; and Special Counsel Clark Clifford.

title: Truman Gives a Press Conference While On Vacation In Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing, center foreground) gives a press conference in the garden of the Little White House while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Reporters and photographers who are gathered in front of him are unidentified. Seated second from the left is Press Secretary Charles Ross. Standing behind Truman are, from left to right: two unidentified men; Department of State Chief of Protocol Stanley Woodward; Captain Robert Dennison; Washington State Governor Mon Wallgren; Admiral William Leahy; General Harry Vaughan (partly obscured by Truman); Administrative Assistant David Niles; Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington; and Special Counsel Clark Clifford.

title: Truman Press Conference, Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing, left) gives a press conference in the garden of the Little White House while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Photographers and reporters gathered around are all unidentified.

title: Truman Holds Press Conference in Garden of Little White House, Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing, foreground, left) gives a press conference in the garden of the Little White House while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Photographers and reporters gathered around are all unidentified. Standing behind President Truman, from left to right, are: General Harry Vaughan; Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington (mostly obscured); and Special Counsel Clark Clifford.

title: President Harry S. Truman Conducts Press Conference While in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing, foreground, left) gives a press conference in the garden of the Little White House while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Photographers and reporters gathered around are all unidentified.

title: Arriving on Wake Island
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) upon his arrival to Wake Island to meet with General Douglas MacArthur.  All other individuals are unidentified.

title: Truman Gives a Press Conference While on Vacation in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing, right, in light shirt) gives a press conference in the garden of the Little White House while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Photographers and reporters gathered around are all unidentified. The man partly obscured by Truman, getting ready to stand up, is Press Secretary Charles Ross. Standing on the right in the striped shirt is Washington State Governor Mon Wallgren.

title: President Harry S. Truman Gives a Press Conference While on Vacation in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing, foreground, left) gives a press conference in the garden of the Little White House while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Reporters and photographers present are unidentified. Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington can be seen on the far left behind President Truman.  Margaret Truman can be seen behind the unidentified man in the rocking chair.

title: Margaret Truman Poses for Photographs in the Garden of the Little White House
Scopenote: Miss Margaret Truman (foreground, left) poses for photographs after President Harry S. Truman's press conference in the north garden of The Little White House. She joined her father in Key West, Florida, for a post-election vacation. Photographers in the foreground and reporters in the background are unidentified. Standing behind Margaret is Special Counsel to the President Clark Clifford.

title: Margaret Truman Gives Press Interview at Little White House
Scopenote: Miss Margaret Truman talks with reporters and poses for pictures after President Harry S. Truman's press conference in the north garden of the Little White House. Margaret joined her father at the Little White House in Key West, Florida for a post-election vacation. All others are unidentified.

title: The Truman Family Poses for Pictures Outside The Little White House
Scopenote: From left to right, First Lady Bess W. Truman, President Harry S. Truman and their daughter, Margaret Truman pose for pictures in the southwest garden of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. They were in Key West for a post-election vacation.

title: Truman Family Poses For Pictures Outside Little White House
Scopenote: From left to right, First Lady Bess W. Truman, President Harry S. Truman and their daughter, Margaret Truman pose for pictures in the southwest garden of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. They were in Key West for a post-election vacation.

title: President Truman Inspects the Marine Guard at Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, in civilian clothes) holds an informal inspection of the detachment of Marines that guarded the Little White House in Key West, Florida while he stayed there on vacation. He is accompanied by Major Harold A. Hayes. All other Marines are unidentified.

title: President Truman Conducts Informal Inspection of Marines at Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, in civilian clothes) holds an informal inspection of the detachment of Marines that guarded the Little White House in Key West, Florida while he stayed there on vacation. He is accompanied by Major Harold A. Hayes. All other Marines are unidentified.

title: President Truman Inspects the Marine Guard at Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) stands with Major Harold A. Hayes during an informal inspection of the detachment of Marines that guarded the Little White House while he was on vacation in Key West, Florida.

title: Truman Walking Around Little White House, Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, right) stops to talk to a young admirer while on vacation at The Little White House in Key West, Florida. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman With Ambassador Jessup
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, second from left) shaking hands with United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup (center, left). Also pictured: U.S. Secretary of State Dean Acheson (center, right of President Truman) and White House Press Secretary Charles Ross (far left). All other individuals are unidentified.

title: Truman and His Party Eat Lunch in Little White House Garden
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and members of his White House staff and advisors eat lunch on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. President Truman and his staff took a post-election vacation in Key West. All are unidentified.

title: Members of Mrs. Truman's Bridge Club During Visit
Scopenote: From left to right, Thelma (Mrs. Mell) Pallette, Edna (Mrs. John B.) Hutchison, Natalie (Mrs. Frank) Wallace and Helena (Mrs. E. K.) Crow during a visit to Washington, D.C. The ladies are members of Bess Truman's Independence, Missouri, Bridge Club, and traveled to Washington, D.C. to visit her.

title: Members of Mrs. Truman's Bridge Club
Scopenote: Members of First Lady Bess W. Truman's Independence, Missouri Bridge Club. From left to right: Adelaide (Mrs. Tom) Twyman, Linda (Mrs. Oscar) King, Lucy (Mrs. Mize) Peters, Edna (Mrs. John B.) Hutchinson, Thelma (Mrs. Mell) Pallette, Mary (Mrs. Leslie) Shaw, May (Mrs. George) Wallace, Mag (Mrs. J. C.) Noel and Helena (Mrs. E. K.) Crow.

title: Members of Bess Truman's Bridge Club
Scopenote: From left to right, Thelma (Mrs. Mell) Pallette, May (Mrs. George) Wallace and Helena (Mrs. E. K.) Crow, standing in front of a building in Washington, D.C. They were in the capital to visit their friend and fellow bridge club member, First Lady Bess W. Truman.

title: Bess Truman Stands by the White House Fountains
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman stands to the left of the fountains on the White House lawn.

title: The Deck of the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: On board the presidential yacht, U.S.S. Williamsburg.  Two unidentified members of First Lady Bess Truman's bridge club are on the left in the picture.

title: Dumbarton House, Georgetown, Washington, D.C
Scopenote: A front view of Dumbarton House, Georgetown, Washington, D.C. where First Lady Bess W. Truman and her bridge club had tea during their visit to see the First Lady.

title: View of South Portico of the White House
Scopenote: A photograph of the South Portico of the White House with the fountains in the foreground.  Taken by a member of First Lady Bess W. Truman's bridge club while visiting with the First Lady.

title: View of the Washington Monument Taken from the White House
Scopenote: The Washington Monument stands in the background and the White House fountains are in the foreground of this picture taken from the White House by one of members of First Lady Bess W. Truman's bridge club while on a visit to the First Lady.

title: View of the South Portico of the White House
Scopenote: Picture taken of the South Portico of the White House by one of the members of First Lady Bess W. Truman's bridge club while on a visit with Mrs. Truman.

title: Truman Speaking With Acheson
Scopenote: Secretary of State Dean Acheson (foreground, back to camera) speaking with President Harry S. Truman (facing Acheson, mostly obscured) at the foot of the stairs leading to the Presidential plane. All other individuals are unidentified.

title: View of the South Portico of the White House
Scopenote: A view of the South Portico of the White House in Washington, D.C., taken by a member of First Lady Bess W. Truman's bridge club while visiting with the First Lady.

title: View of the White House's North Entrance and Fountains
Scopenote: View of the north entrance of the White House and the fountains taken by one of the members of First Lady Bess W. Truman's bridge club while on a visit with the First Lady.

title: Chauffeur and Car Used to Convey the Bridge Club Members
Scopenote: Unidentified chauffeur poses beside the car used to transport the members of Mrs. Bess W. Truman's bridge club while on a visit with the First Lady in Washington, D.C.

title: Chauffeur Poses in Front of the South Portico of the White House
Scopenote: Unidentified chauffeur poses beside the car used to transport the members of Mrs. Bess W. Truman's bridge club while on a visit with the First Lady in Washington, D.C. In the background can be see the South Portico of the White House.

title: Margaret Truman With Wallace Aunts on the Williamsburg
Scopenote: From left to right, Natalie (Mrs. Frank) Wallace, Margaret Truman and May (Mrs. George) Wallace on board the presidential yacht U.S.S. Williamsburg. They were on the yacht during a visit of members of First Lady Bess W. Truman's bridge club to Washington, D.C. Natalie and May are the wives of Bess W. Truman's brothers.

title: The U.S.S. Williamsburg Under Way
Scopenote: A picture of the presidential yacht U.S.S. Williamsburg taken by Charles Alford.  On board is First Lady Bess W. Truman and members of her bridge club.

title: Robert Hunt Shrine at Jamestown, Virginia
Scopenote: Picture of Robert Hunt Shrine at Jamestown, Virginia, taken by one of the members of First Lady Bess W. Truman's bridge club while on a visit to the historic site.

title: Pocahontas Monument at Jamestown Historic Site, Virginia
Scopenote: Photograph of the Pocahontas Monument at Jamestown Historic Site taken by an member of First Lady Bess W. Truman's bridge club while on a visit with the First Lady.

title: Monument to Captain John Smith at Jamestown Historic Site
Scopenote: Photograph of Captain John Smith Monument at Jamestown Historic Site in Jamestown, Virginia, taken by a member of First Lady Bess W. Truman's bridge club while on a visit to the site with the First Lady.

title: Unidentified Man
Scopenote: Photograph of an unidentified man. Possibly a passport photo of Mell Pallette.

title: President Truman's Arrival in Washington, D.C
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman returning to Washington, D.C. after his trip to Wake Island to meet with General Douglas MacArthur. From left to right: Secretary of Defense George Marshall, President Truman, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, and Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder. All others are unidentified.

title: Vernice and Maude Anderson at Washington, D.C. Airport
Scopenote: Miss Vernice Anderson (left), secretary to United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup, with her mother, Maude G. Anderson (left) upon Vernice's return from Wake Island.  All other individuals are unidentified.

Scopenote: Military Tribunal 5, Case 12, Nuremberg, Germany: Brigadier General Telford Taylor (Chief of Counsel) seated, front center, with members of the prosecution counsel and assistant secretaries general.  (See Volume 10 of the trials of war criminals before the Nuremberg Military Tribunals).

title: Brigadier General Telford Taylor in Courtroom at Military Tribunal 5, Nuremberg
Scopenote: Brigadier General Telford Taylor, Chief of Prosecution Counsel. He is in the courtroom - Palace of Justice, Military Tribunal 5, Case 12, Nuremberg, Germany.

title: Ambassador Jessup Arriving in Washington, D.C
Scopenote: United States Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup (right) and Lois (Mrs. Philip C.) Jessup (second from the right) upon Ambassador Jessup's return to Washington, D.C. from Wake Island.  All other individuals are unidentified.

Scopenote: A Prosecution Counselor at the rostrum during the Military Tribunal Number 5, Case 12, in Nuremberg, Germany.  This is in the courtroom of the Palace of Justice.

title: President Truman's Return From Wake Island
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman with members of his Cabinet and advisors upon his return to Washington, D.C. Truman flew to Wake Island to meet with General Douglas MacArthur. From left to right: President Truman, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, Secretary of the Army Frank Pace, Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder, and General Omar Bradley.

title: Aerial View of Osaka
Scopenote: Aerial view of a city in Japan, possibly Osaka. This photo was taken while Vernice Anderson traveled with Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: President Truman's Return From Wake Island
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman upon his return to Washington, D.C., from his trip to Wake Island to meet with General Douglas MacArthur. From left to right: President Truman, Secretary of State Dean Acheson (behind Truman, mostly obscured), Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder (third from right), Secretary of the Army Frank Pace (mostly obscured by Snyder), and General Omar Bradley (right). All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: Unidentified man walking through African American soldiers at the Palace of Justice,  Military Tribunal Number 5, Case 12, Nuremberg, Germany.

Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman upon his return to Washington, D.C. from his trip to Wake Island to meet with General Douglas MacArthur. From left to right: Secretary of Defense George Marshall, President Truman, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, and Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Upon His Return From Wake Island
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman upon his return to Washington, D.C., from his trip to Wake Island to meet with General Douglas MacArthur. From left to right: unidentified, Secretary of Defense George Marshall (shaking hands with Truman), President Truman, Secretary of State Dean Acheson, Secretary of the Army Frank Pace, and Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder.

title: John C. Young Seated in Chair
Scopenote: Photograph of Nuremberg Trials Judge John C. Young seated in a chair, smoking a pipe.

Scopenote: Brigadier General Telford Taylor, Chief of Prosecution Counsel, seated at a desk during  Military Tribunal Number 5, Case 12 in  Nuremberg, Germany.

title: President Truman in San Francisco
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman in a motorcade with (left) Vice-President Alben Barkley (right) and the Mayor of San Francisco, California, Elmer G. Robinson. President Truman stopped in San Francisco during his return from conferring with General Douglas MacArthur on Wake Island.

title: Wake Island
Scopenote: View of artillery piece on Wake Island. President Harry S. Truman traveled to Wake Island to meet with General Douglas MacArthur.

title: General MacArthur on Wake Island
Scopenote: General Douglas MacArthur boarding a plane in Wake Island after his visit with President Harry S. Truman.

title: Awards Presentation for Completion of Second Incident Process Course in Treasury Department
Scopenote: Awards presentation for completion of second incident process course in Robert W. Maxwell's office in the Treasury Department.  Front row - left to right:  Mrs. Morgan, Mrs. Ferguson, Mrs. Saracco, Mr. Henriksen, Mrs. Marks, Mr. Gerardi, Mr. Dunn, Mr. Glover, Mr. Reichhardt.  Second row - left to right:  Mr. Gearhart, Mr. Pacheco, Mr. Porteous, Mr. Herrell, Mr. Fama, Mr. Sullivan, Mr. Pearce, Mr. Cox, Mr. Horn, Mr. Taylor, Mr. Norman, Mr. Maxwell.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Wake Island
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman delivering a speech and presenting a Distinguished Service Medal to General Douglas MacArthur.  In the foreground, from left to right, facing the camera: Press Secretary Charles Ross, Special Assistant to the President Averell Harriman, General Robert Landry, Admiral Arthur Radford (partly obscured by Truman), President Truman, Secretary of the Army Frank Pace, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff General Omar Bradley, General Harry Vaughan, Charles Murphy, David Bell, General Wallace, Graham, and Assistant Secretary of State Dean Rusk. General MacArthur is facing Truman, his back to the camera, with the top of his hat between Mr. Ross and Mr. Harriman. All others are unidentified.

title: Generals MacArthur and Bradley at Wake Island
Scopenote: General Omar Bradley (right) with General Douglas MacArthur (left) at the airport at Wake Island.  All other individuals are unidentified.

title: Robert W. Maxwell
Scopenote: Autographed photograph of Robert W. Maxwell, a Commissioner with the Treasury Department.

title: Harry S. Truman with Three Unidentified Men in a Library
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman with three unidentified men in an unidentified library.  Possibly post presidential.    Original 4x5 negative.

title: Two Unidentified Men, Possibly from Treasury Dept
Scopenote: Two unidentified men in an office with bouquet of flowers on desk. There are gift boxes on the desk and they are holding what appears to be a whip; they are possibly Treasury Department employees.  There is a graph on the wall of the office.  Original 4x5 negative.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Wake Island
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with General Douglas MacArthur (left) in the back of an automobile at Wake Island.

title: Mother of Francis L. Hossack
Scopenote: Portrait photograph of the mother of Francis L. Hossack.  Born 1837. Died 1924.  Names also mentioned are Jane (Jennie) Esther Hossack Maxwell, Minnie Hossack Raphael, Lawrence Hossack. This is a relative of Robert W. Maxwell.

title: Clarence Osthagen with Lady
Scopenote: Clarence Osthagen with an unidentified lady, possibly his mother, Elise Osthagen.

Scopenote: Clarence Osthagen sitting on the sofa in a living room.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Wake Island
Scopenote: The presidential car carrying President Harry S. Truman (backseat, left) and General Douglas MacArthur (backseat, right) during Truman's trip to Wake Island.  All other individuals are unidentified.

Scopenote: Photo of Clarence Osthagen.

Scopenote: The airfield in Wake Island, where President Harry S. Truman traveled to confer with General Douglas MacArthur.  All individuals are unidentified.

Scopenote: Photo of Secretary of Defense Robert Lovett (right, in tuxedo) and General Henry H. Arnold standing in front of a fireplace decorated for Christmas.

title: National Science Board Dinner
Scopenote: Miss Vernice Anderson (left) with Norman Hackerman (second from left) and Lewis M. Branscomb (right), Chairman of the National Science Board, at the National Science Board Dinner, held in the Diplomatic Functions Area, Department of State. Vernice received an award for her long service to the National Science Board. All other individuals are unidentified.

title: Autographed Photo of Thomas K. Finletter
Scopenote: Autographed photo of Thomas K. Finletter.  "To Clarence H. Osthagen, with best wishes, Thomas K. Finletter."

title: Vernice Anderson Receives Award

title: Vernice Anderson Receives Award
Scopenote: Miss Vernice Anderson (left) with the former Chairman of the National Science Board, Norman Hackerman (right). She was presented with an award at the National Science Board Dinner, held in the Diplomatic Functions Area of the Department of State.

title: Autographed Photo of Unidentified Man
Scopenote: Autographed photo to Clarence Osthagen, with best wishes.  Signature not legible.

title: National Science Board Honoring Vernice Anderson
Scopenote: Miss Vernice Anderson (left), with National Science Board Chairman Lewis M. Branscomb (right), being honored at the National Science Board Dinner, held in the Diplomatic Functions Area of the Department of State.

title: Autographed Photo of General H. H. Arnold
Scopenote: Autographed photo of General H. H. "Hap" Arnold.  "To Colonel C. H. Osthagen - with best wishes and kindest regards of H. H. Arnold."

Scopenote: Autographed photo of Eugene M. Zuckert. "To Clarence Osthagen - With appreciation for his friendship and hard-hitting assistance - Gene Zuckert, Assistant Secretary US Air Force."

Scopenote: Autographed photo of General Hoyt S. Vanderberg.  "To the Honorable Clarence Osthagen with appreciation for fine service for the Air Force.  Hoyt S. Vanderberg"

title: Autographed Photo of Louis Johnson
Scopenote: Autographed photo of Louis A. Johnson, Secretary of Defense.  "To Clarence H. Osthagen, with appreciation and best wishes.  Louis Johnson."

title: Vernice Receiving Necklace
Scopenote: Miss Vernice Anderson (left) with the Chairman of the National Science Board, Dr. Norman Hackerman (right), at the National Science Board Dinner.  She received a necklace in honor of her 25th anniversary with the National Science Board. The dinner was held at the National Science Foundation in Washington, D.C.

title: National Science Board Dinner
Scopenote: Miss Vernice Anderson (second from left) with the National Science Board chairman Dr. Philip Handler (left), Dr. Detlev Bronk (second from the right), and Representative Emilio Daddario at the Great Hall at the Smithsonian Institution. She received a gift at this event in commemoration of her fifteenth anniversary with the National Science Board.

Scopenote: Distance view of the Robin Hood Dell anniversary, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.  Robin Hood Dell is a famous theater in Philadelphia.

title: Christmas Tree on White House Lawn
Scopenote: At dusk each Christmas Eve, whether he is in Washington or in Independence, Missouri, the President (Harry S. Truman) lights the Community Christmas Tree on the south lawn of the White House.  The ceremonies are witnessed by several thousand persons, many of them children.  If he is in Independence, the President lights the tree by pressing a button that sets off the 800 glittering lights 1,000 miles away.  The tree is a symbol of all community Christmas trees in the United States.

title: Bust of Richard Evelyn Byrd
Scopenote: Laurence Gould posing next to a bust of American polar explorer Richard Evelyn Byrd.

title: Truman Home in Independence, Missouri in Snow
Scopenote: Snow covers the home of President Harry S. Truman in Independence, Missouri, at Christmas.  When the President and his family spend Christmas in Independence, they always have in a window facing the street a Christmas tree, sparkling with colored lights and decorations.  Neighbors and members of church choirs often gather to sing carols to the nation's "first family" on Christmas night.  This 18 room house was built by Mrs. Truman's grandfather in 1865 and has been occupied by the family since that time.

title: President Truman Carrying Christmas Presents
Scopenote: Merry Christmas is the greeting from  President Harry S. Truman as he sets forth from his home in Independence, Missouri, to deliver Christmas gifts to members of his family who live nearby.  Whether they are in Washington or Independence, Missouri, the President and his family celebrate Christmas by putting gifts under the Christmas tree and by singing Christmas carols around the piano.  Independence is often blanketed by snow at Christmas.  Similar to 59-1558 and 69-635.

title: President Truman Boarding Plane
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman preparing to board a plane at Washington National Airport for his vacation to Florida. Same as 73-3107 but better photo.

title: Katyn Forest Victims Reburial
Scopenote: Solemn reburial of the remnants of over four thousand Polish Army Staff Officers whose bodies have been discovered executed (shot in the back of the neck) in a dense forest near the Polish village of Katyn.  Polish priest (center, dark robe) celebrates.  Villagers herded up to witness.  German propaganda staff and foreign correspondents are in background.  Responsibility still not definitely established.  Both opponents accused each other.  From:  Photos used in the 1984 Truman Centennial Exhibit.

title: Bombing Map of Manhattan
Scopenote:
The original version of this bombing map of New York was first published by German scientists Eugen Sänger and Irene Bredt-Sänger in Über einen Raketenantrieb für Fernbomber, a German Research Institute for Aviation Secret Command Report, UM 3538 in 1944.

Original caption on verso of this print: New York's map drawn up by World War II German Luftwaffe planners in 1944. Powerful V2 rockets to be launched from German submarines were aimed at Mid-Manhattan. Judging from the circles of effect drawn on the map, such rockets should have been armed by atomic warheads. This is assumed to be the "new, final, secret weapon" the Nazis worked on and promised to Hitler up to the last days. 

From: Photos used in the 1984 Truman Centennial Exhibit. This print was obtained from G.D. Hackett, who claims the copyright to this image.

title: Bombing map of Washington, D.C.

title: Chrysler Assembly Plant in Detroit
Scopenote: Body of a 1958 Plymouth Suburban station wagon is poised over the assembly line, ready to be lowered onto the chassis.  This delicate operation is completed as the chassis moves steadily along the  conveyorized assembly line.  Matching bodies and chassis arrive at the "body drop" at precisely the proper time, thanks to a plant-wide teletype network controlling movement of parts. This assembly line is located at the Chrysler Corporation, Plymouth Division, in Detroit, Michigan.  From: Photos used in the 1984 Truman Centennial Exhibit. National Archives Photo Number: 306-PS-61-6799.

DuBridge, President of the California Institute of Technology, (foreground, second from right) during a visit to Caltech. Also present is Antony Armstrong-Jones, the Earl of Snowdon and husband of Princess Margaret (foreground, left). All other individuals are unidentified.

title: Files of Social Security Account Holders

title: Smash this octopus before it strangles you Sign
Scopenote: Smash this octopus before it strangles you is one sign carried by people in an unidentified parade. The sign mentions the McCarren Act, the Taft Hartley Act, loyalty oaths, lynchings, and the Atlantic War Pact.  From: Photos used in the 1984 Truman Centennial Exhibit.

title: Bodies Discovered Outside Taejon, Korea

Library of Congress Photo Number: LC-USZ62-80605.

title: Protestors with Signs about the People's Liberties

title: C-47 planes parked on the ramp at Rhein Main Air Base
Scopenote: At the time of the Berlin Airlift, C-47 airplanes are parked on the ramp at Rhein Main Air Base, Frankfurt, Germany.  They are being loaded with food and supplies to be flown to Templehof Air Base in Berlin during "Operation Vittles."  From:  Photos used in the 1984 Truman Centennial Exhibit. United States Air Force Photo Number: A-67703 AC.

title: Northrop B-49 in Flight
Scopenote: Northrop B-49 bomber in flight.  From:  Photos used in the 1984 Truman Centennial Exhibit. United States Air Force Photo Number: K 4665.

title: Photo of an Unidentified Nuclear Test
Scopenote: This photo of an unidentified nuclear test bomb was taken at a height of approximately twelve thousand feet - fifty miles from the detonation site.  Two minutes after Zero Hour, the cloud rose to forty thousand feet, the height of thirty two Empire State Buildings.  Ten minutes later, as it neared its' maximum, the cloud stem had pushed upward about twenty five miles deep into the stratosphere.  The mushroom portion went up to ten miles and spread for one hundred miles.  From:  Photos used in the 1984 Truman Centennial Exhibit. United States Air Force Photo Number: K-KE 8325.
