title: Melby Erskine Mission arrives in Hanoi, Vietnam
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine of the Melby Erskine Mission is being greeted by a man believed to be the Governor of North Vietnam upon arriving in Hanoi, Vietnam.

title: Melby Erskine Mission arriving in Hanoi, Vietnam
Scopenote: Arrival of the Melby Erskine Mission in Hanoi, Vietnam. John F. Melby is shown on left. Others are unidentified.

title: Arrival of the Melby Erskine Mission in Hanoi, Vietnam
Scopenote: Ambassador Donald R. Heath, General Graves B. Erskine and John F. Melby upon arrival at Hanoi, Vietnam.  The man behind General Erskine is unidentified.

title: Melby Erskine Mission arriving in Hanoi, Vietnam
Scopenote: The Melby Erskine Mission is greeted upon arrival in Hanoi, Vietnam. Ambassador Donald R. Heath (center), General Graves B. Erskine, and John F. Melby. The man on the right is believed to be the Governor of North Vietnam. Others are unidentified. Reportage No. T-578, Photo No. 11.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission arriving in Hanoi, Vietnam
Scopenote: The Melby Erskine Mission is greeted upon arrival in Hanoi, Vietnam. John F. Melby is in the center and General Graves B. Erskine to his right. Others are unidentified. Reportage No. T-578, Photo No. 12.

title: Hannegan and O'Connor Talking In Warm Springs
Scopenote: Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan (left) and Basil O'Connor, President of the National Foundation for Infantile Paralysis (right), talking in the Little White House at Warm Springs, Georgia. The men were in Warm Springs for a Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Stamp Ceremony.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission arriving in Hanoi, Vietnam
Scopenote: The Melby Erskine Mission is greeted upon arriving in Hanoi, Vietnam. The man on the left is believed to be the Governor of North Vietnam. General Graves B. Erskine is standing third from left. Donald R. Heath is on the right facing left. John F. Melby is partially visible behind Mr. Heath. Others are unidentified. Reportage No. T-578, Photo No. 14

title: The Melby Erskine Mission arriving in Hanoi, Vietnam
Scopenote: The Melby Erskine Mission arriving in Hanoi, Vietnam. Donald R. Heath is center front, walking toward camera. John F. Melby is standing on right. General Graves B. Erskine is partially visible to Mr. Melby's right. A man believed to be the Governor of North Vietnam is on the left side leaning forward. Others are unidentified. Reportage No. T-578, Photo No. 17.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission arriving in Hanoi, Vietnam
Scopenote: The Melby Erskine Mission arriving in Hanoi, Vietnam. General Graves B. Erskine, on right, is being greeted by an unidentified man upon arrival. Reportage No. T-578, Photo No. 20.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission arriving in Hanoi, Vietnam
Scopenote: The Melby Erskine Mission arriving in Hanoi, Vietnam. The man on far left is believed to be His Majesty's Vice Consul. John F. Melby and Donald R. Heath are in center. The man on the right is believed to be the Governor of North Vietnam. The man with his back to the camera is unidentified. Reportage No. T-578, Photo No. 22.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission arriving in Hanoi, Vietnam
Scopenote: The Melby Erskine Mission is greeted upon arrival in Hanoi, Vietnam. John F. Melby is facing forward. Donald R. Heath is behind Mr. Melby. The man believed to be the Governor of North Vietnam is on Mr. Heath's left. General Graves B. Erskine on right. Others are unidentified. Reportage No. T-578, Photo No. 17.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission arriving in Hanoi, Vietnam
Scopenote: The Melby Erskine Mission is greeted upon arrival in Hanoi, Vietnam. John F. Melby is in the center holding his coat on his left arm. Others are unidentified. Reportage No. T-578, Photo No. 35.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Haiphong, Vietnam
Scopenote: The Melby Erskine Mission in Haiphong, Vietnam. Donald R. Heath (wearing hat) and John F. Melby are standing center front. Others are unidentified. Reportage No. T-579, Photo No. 1.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Haiphong, Vietnam
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine, front, during the Melby Erskine Mission visit to Haiphong, Vietnam. Others are unidentified. Reportage No. T-579, Photo No. 3.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Haiphong, Vietnam
Scopenote: The sign on the front of the building reads "Welcome to the American Diplomatic and Military Mission" as the Melby Erskine Mission visits Haiphong, Vietnam. Donald R. Heath (wearing hat) and John F. Melby are shown in front. Others are unidentified. Reportage No. T-579, Photo No. 5.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Haiphong, Vietnam
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine is walking in front as the Melby Erskine Mission visits Haiphong, Vietnam. Donald R. Heath is shown, holding hat, in center. Others are unidentified. Reportage No. T-579, Photo No. 7.

title: Aerial View of Kyoto
Scopenote: Aerial view of Kyoto, Japan. This photo was taken while Vernice Anderson traveled with Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: Hannegan Talking With Men In Warm Springs
Scopenote: Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan (left) talking with Cason J. Callaway (center), member of Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Committee, and Basil O'Connor (right), President of the National Foundation for Infantile Paralysis, at the Little White House in Warm Springs, Georgia. The men were in Warm Springs for a Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Stamp Ceremony. All people in the background are unidentified.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Haiphong, Vietnam
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine is shown facing camera as the Melby Erskine Mission visits Haiphong, Vietnam. John F. Melby is on right, facing camera. Others are unidentified. Reportage No. T-579, Photo No. 9.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Haiphong, Vietnam
Scopenote: John F. Melby is walking in front. Donald R. Heath is shown, second from left, as the Melby Erskine Mission visits Haiphong, Vietnam. Others are unidentified. Reportage No. T-579, Photo No. 11.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Haiphong, Vietnam
Scopenote: Donald R. Heath, left, John F. Melby and General Graves B. Erskine meet as the Melby Erskine Mission visit Haiphong, Vietnam. The man on the right is unidentified. Reportage No. T-579, Photo No. 12.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Haiphong, Vietnam
Scopenote: John F. Melby is walking down the steps in front as the Melby Erskine Mission visits Haiphong, Vietnam. Others are unidentified. Reportage No. T-579, Photo No. 14 .

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Haiphong, Vietnam
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine, center, is leaving Base Navale Haiphong Bureaux during the Melby Erskine Mission visit to Haiphong, Vietnam. Others are unidentified. Reportage No. T-579, Photo No. 22.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Haiphong, Vietnam
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine is shaking hands with a policeman during the Melby Erskine Mission visit to Haiphong, Vietnam. Others are unidentified. Reportage No. T-579, Photo No. 27

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Haiphong, Vietnam
Scopenote: Photo of unidentified people meeting in a room during the Melby Erskine Mission visit to Haiphong, Vietnam. Reportage No. T-579, Photo No. 33.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Haiphong, Vietnam
Scopenote: Donald R. Heath, standing at the head table, at a dinner for the Melby Erskine Mission delegation during their visit to Haiphong, Vietnam. Others are unidentified. Reportage No. T-579, Photo No. 35.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Haiphong, Vietnam
Scopenote: The Melby Erskine Mission to Southeast Asia being greeted upon arrival in Haiphong, Vietnam. All are unidentified. Reportage No. T-579, Photo No. 41.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Singapore
Scopenote: Formal visit to the Government House in Singapore made by the United States Military Survey Mission.  Left to right:  Ambassador John F. Melby, Governor Sir Franklin Gimson, General Graves B, Erskine and Consul-General W. R. Langdon.

title: Basil O'Connor Speaking In Warm Springs
Scopenote: Basil O'Connor, President of the National Foundation for Infantile Paralysis, speaking from a podium in front of Little White House in Warm Springs, Georgia. Seated from left to right are Warm Springs Mayor Frank W. Allcorn and Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan. All others unidentified. O'Connor is speaking at a Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Stamp Ceremony at Roosevelt's Little White House in Warm Springs, Georgia.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Singapore
Scopenote: The Melby Erskine Mission delegation made a formal visit to the Government House.  Left to right:  unidentified, Governor Sir Franklin Gimson, General Graves B. Erskine, Consul-General William R. Langdon.  Others are unidentified.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Singapore
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine, center, visits the Government House in Singapore during the Melby Erskine Mission.  Others are unidentified.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Singapore
Scopenote: Consul-General William R. Langdon, second from left, and John F. Melby at Kallang Airport.  Others are unidentified.  Mr. Melby was in Singapore with the Melby Erskine Mission delegation.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Singapore
Scopenote: Members of the Melby Erskine Mission delegation visited the Governor of Singapore, Sir Franklin Gimson.  Left to right: the Governor, General Graves B Erskine and Consul-General William R. Langdon.

title: The Melby Erskine Mission in Singapore
Scopenote: Formal visit to the Government House made by the United States Military Survey Mission, the Erskine-Melby Mission in Singapore.  All are unidentified in this photo.

title: John F. Melby Press Conference in Singapore
Scopenote: John F. Melby, Chairman of the American Military Mission to Southeast Asia (the Erskine Melby Mission), addressing a press conference at the United States Information Service office in Singapore.

title: John F. Melby Press Conference in Singapore
Scopenote: John F. Melby, Chairman of the American Military Mission (the Erskine Melby Mission) to Southeast Asia, addressing a press conference at the United States Information Service office in Singapore.  Mr. Melby is sitting at the table with his back to the camera.

title: Allcorn and Hannegan on Platform at Warm Springs
Scopenote: Warm Springs Mayor Frank W. Allcorn (standing on left of platform) and Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan (standing on right of platform) outside Little White House in Warm Springs, Georgia. The crowd in the photo gathered for a Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Stamp Ceremony at Roosevelt's Little White House in Warm Springs. All others unidentified.

title: Parade Marshalling Area in Bangkok
Scopenote: The Chairman of the Erskine Melby Mission, John F. Melby, and the Director General of the Police Department arrive at the marshalling area in Bangkok, Thailand for the police parade.

title: John F. Melby and General Graves B. Erskine at Parade in Bangkok
Scopenote: The Chairman of the Erskine Melby Mission, John F. Melby, the Director General of the Police Department and General Graves B. Erskine chatting before the beginning of the parade in Bangkok, Thailand.

title: Melby Erskine Mission Member Waiting for a Parade in Bangkok
Scopenote: A member of the Melby Erskine Mission with a group of Army and police officers waiting for the parade in Bangkok, Thailand.

title: Waiting for the Parade in Bangkok
Scopenote: Officers and men of the Metropolitan Police Patrol Squad waiting for the parade in Bangkok, Thailand.  This was taken during the Melby Erskine Mission in Southeast Asia.

title: Waiting for the Parade in Bangkok
Scopenote: Officers and men of the Metropolitan Police Division waiting for the parade in Bangkok, Thailand.  This was taken during the Melby Erskine Mission to Southeast Asia.

title: Watching the parade in Bangkok
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine and John F. Melby of the Melby Erskine Mission watch the parade with the Director General of Police in Bangkok, Thailand.

title: Arnall Speaking at Warm Springs
Scopenote: Georgia Governor Ellis Arnall speaking at a podium outside the Little White House in Warm Springs, Georgia. Seated on platform from left to right: Warm Springs Mayor Frank W. Allcorn; Basil O'Connor, President of the National Foundation for Infantile Paralysis; unknown officer; and Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan. All others in photo unidentified. The group is gathered for a Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Stamp Ceremony outside Roosevelt's Little White House in Warm Springs, Georgia.

title: The Traffic Police Squad on Parade in Bangkok
Scopenote: The Traffic Police Squad on parade in Bangkok, Thailand.  This was taken during the Melby Erskine Mission to Southeast Asia.

title: The Metropolitan Police Patrol Squad on Parade in Bangkok
Scopenote: The Metropolitan Police Patrol Squad on parade in Bangkok, Thailand.  This was taken during the Melby Erskine Mission in Southeast Asia.

title: The Jeep's Company on Parade in Bangkok
Scopenote: The Jeep's company on parade in Bangkok, Thailand.  General Graves B. Erskine is standing on the left watching with parade.  This was taken during the Melby Erskine Mission to Southeast Asia.

title: The Land Rover's Company on Parade in Bangkok
Scopenote: The Land Rover's Company on parade in Bangkok, Thailand.  This was taken during the Melby Erskine Mission to Southeast Asia.

title: Armored Car Parade in Bangkok
Scopenote: The Commander of the Armored Cars Unit made a salute during the parade in Bangkok, Thailand.  General Graves B. Erskine is standing on the left side watching the parade.  This was taken during the Melby Erskine Mission to Southeast Asia.

title: The Armored Cars Unit on Parade in Bangkok
Scopenote: The Armored Cars Unit on parade in Bangkok, Thailand.  General Graves B. Erskine and John F. Melby are standing on the left side watching the parade. They are in Bangkok for the Erskine-Melby Mission.

title: Breakfast for Melby Erskine Mission in Bangkok
Scopenote: Breakfast at Parusakawan Palace in Bangkok, Thailand during the Melby Erskine Mission.  John F. Melby is being served by the waiter.

title: Breakfast for Melby Erskine Mission in Bangkok
Scopenote: Breakfast is being served to the Melby Erskine Mission group at the Parusakawan Palace in Bangkok, Thailand.  John F. Melby is sitting on the left.  General Graves B. Erskine is sitting across the table from Mr. Melby.

title: Breakfast for Erskine Melby Mission in Bangkok
Scopenote: Breakfast is being served at the Parusakawan Palace in Bangkok, Thailand for the Melby Erskine Mission delegation.

title: Hannegan Passing Stamps Out to Patients
Scopenote: A group of polio patients receive Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Stamps from Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan (standing center foreground) at Warm Springs, Georgia. Standing to the left of Hannegan is Georgia Governor Ellis Arnall. Standing at right of Hannegan is Basil O'Connor, President of the National Foundation for Infantile Paralysis. All others in photo are unidentified. The group gathered for a Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Stamp Ceremony outside Roosevelt's Little White House in Warm Springs, Georgia.

title: Breakfast for Erskine Melby Mission in Bangkok
Scopenote: Breakfast is being served at the Parusakawan Palace in Bangkok, Thailand for the Melby Erskine Mission delegation.

title: General Graves B. Erskine Examining a Cartridge in Bangkok
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine examining the 20 mm anti-tank cartridge during the Melby-Erskine Mission to Bangkok, Thailand.

title: General Graves B. Erskine watching the Gun Crew in Bangkok
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine on an armored car overlooking the gun crew during the Melby-Erskine Mission to Bangkok, Thailand.

title: General Graves B. Erskine Watching the Gun Crews in Action in Bangkok
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine on an armored vehicle watching the gun crews in action during the Melby-Erskine Mission to Bangkok, Thailand.

title: Watching the Gun Crews in Action in Bangkok
Scopenote: The Deputy Director General of Police watching the gun crews in action during the Melby-Erskine Mission to Bangkok, Thailand.

title: Armored Vehicle Firing Exercise in Bangkok
Scopenote: The Deputy Director General of Police observing the firing exercise of an armored vehicle during the Melby-Erskine Mission to Bangkok, Thailand.

title: General Graves B. Erskine watching the gun crew in Bangkok
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine climbing on an armored vehicle to get a better look at the gun crew.  John F. Melby is standing on the left watching with binoculars.  This occurred during the Melby-Erskine Mission to Bangkok, Thailand.

title: Observing the Gun Crew in Bangkok
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine is standing on the armored vehicle observing the gun crew.  John F. Melby is standing behind the vehicle.  The Director General of Police is standing behind Mr. Melby during the Melby-Erskine Mission visit to Bangkok, Thailand.

title: Firing exercise in Bangkok
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine is watching the firing exercise from the armored vehicle. The Director General of Police, John F. Melby, and members of the Melby-Erskine Mission are standing behind.

title: Spotting the Target with Binoculars, in Bangkok
Scopenote: A member of the Melby-Erskine Mission spotting the target with binoculars during their visit to Bangkok, Thailand.  They are at a firing range.

title: Hannegan Passing Out Stamps to Patients
Scopenote: Polio patients receive Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Stamps in Warm Springs, Georgia. Standing on the right side: Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan (leftmost) and Basil O'Connor (rightmost), President of the National Foundation for Infantile Paralysis. All others in the photo are unidentified. The group gathered for a Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Stamp Ceremony outside Roosevelt's Little White House in Warm Springs, Georgia.

title: Military firing range in Bangkok
Scopenote: John F. Melby, second from right, and General Graves B. Erskine, on right, with the Director General of Police at the military firing range in Bangkok, Thailand, during the Melby-Erskine Mission visit.

title: Firing exercise in Bangkok
Scopenote: The Director General of Police chatting with a member of the Melby-Erskine Mission during the firing exercise in Bangkok, Thailand.  John F. Melby is second from left.

title: Trumpeter on hill in Bangkok
Scopenote: The Commander of the Bangkok Police School giving an order to an officer with a trumpeter standing behind.  This took place during the Melby Erskine Mission to Thailand.

title: Hannegan Passing Out Stamps to Patients
Scopenote: Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan (standing in right foreground) passes out Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial stamps to polio patients in Warm Springs, Georgia. All others unidentified. The group gathered for a Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Stamp Ceremony outside Roosevelt's Little White House in Warm Springs, Georgia.

title: Mission arrival at Don Muang in Thailand
Scopenote: The mission arrives at Don Muang in Thailand.  John F. Melby is shown in the center.  General Graves B. Erskine is shown at the bottom of the steps.  Others are unidentified.

title: The Mission is Received by the Commander in Chief, Royal Thai Air Force
Scopenote: The mission is received by the Commander in Chief, Royal Thai Air Force, in Don Muang.  General Graves B. Erskine is on the left.  John F. Melby is standing by General Erskine.  The other man is unidentified.

title: Hannegan Passing Out Stamps to Patients
Scopenote: Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan (leftmost standing in foreground) and Basil O'Connor (rightmost standing in foreground) pass out Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Stamps to polio patients at Warm Springs, Georgia. Standing on the far right in the background is Georgia Governor Ellis Arnall. All others are unidentified. The group gathered for a Franklin D. Roosevelt Memorial Stamp Ceremony outside Roosevelt's Little White House in Warm Springs, Georgia.

title: Leaving for the Ministry of Defense in Thailand
Scopenote: John F. Melby, front left; the Commander in Chief, Royal Thai Air Force, front center; General Graves B. Erskine, behind Mr. Melby; and other unidentified men leaving for the Ministry of Defense in Don Muang, Thailand. This is the visit of the Erskine-Melby mission to Thailand.

title: Roosevelt Speaking at Puget Sound Navy Yard
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt (foreground at right) speaking from the deck of a destroyer to shipyard workers and the nation at the Puget Sound Navy Yard. Roosevelt talked about the need for forward bases nearer to Japan.

title: Roosevelt Speaking at International Teamsters' Union Dinner
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt acknowledging applause after his first speech of the 1944 Campaign at the International Teamsters' Union Dinner in Washington, D.C. From left to right: Henry J. Kaiser; William Green, President of the American Federation of Labor; President Roosevelt; and Daniel Tobin, President of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters.

title: Garden in Kyoto
Scopenote: A garden in a Shinto shrine in Kyoto, Japan. This photo was taken while Vernice Anderson traveled with Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: Roosevelt Delivering a Speech From Train Platform
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt (third from left at podium) speaks from the back platform of his train to a crowd in Wilmington, Delaware. The President stopped while on his way to a political rally in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. All others unidentified.

title: John F. Melby Observing a Ground Demonstration in Thailand
Scopenote: Members of the Erskine-Melby mission observing a ground military demonstration in Prachuap, Thailand. John F. Melby is watching from the center back.

title: Erskine-Melby Mission go Hunting on Elephants
Scopenote: Members of the Erskine-Melby mission are taken hunting on elephants.  John F. Melby is on the back of the middle elephant. They are in Thailand.

title: Invitation to Grand Dinner Sponsored by General Phin Choonhavan for Erskine-Melby Mission
Scopenote: Invitation to Grand Dinner sponsored by General Phin Choonhavan, Commander-in-Chief, Royal Thai Army.  In honour of John F. Melby and the Joint Military Aid Program Mission.

title: Table Setting for Dinner Given for Erskine-Melby Mission
Scopenote: Table setting for dinner given by General Phin Choonhavan, Commander-in-Chief, Royal Thai Army for John F. Melby and members of the Erskine Melby mission.

title: Table Setting for Dinner Given for John F. Melby and Members of the Erskine-Melby Mission
Scopenote: Table setting for dinner given by General Phin Choonhavan, Commander-in-Chief, Royal Thai Army, honoring John F. Melby and members of the Erskine-Melby mission.

title: Grand Dinner Given for Members of the Melby Erskine Mission
Scopenote: Dinner in honor of the Melby Erskine Mission given by General Phin Choonhavan, Commander-in-Chief of the Royal Thai Army.  All are unidentified.

title: Roosevelt Greeting Crowd in Philadelphia
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt waves to the crowd at Shibe Park in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania prior to giving a speech.

title: Thai Dancers Entertain for the Melby Erskine Mission
Scopenote: Thai dancers entertain following the dinner given by General Phin Choonhavan, Commander-in-Chief, Royal Thai Army, honoring the Melby Erskine Mission.

title: Thai Dancers Entertain, Honoring the Melby Erskine Mission
Scopenote: Thai dancers entertain following the dinner given by General Phin Choonhavan, Commander-in-Chief, Royal Thai Army, honoring the Melby Erskine Mission.

title: Thai Dancers Entertain Following the Dinner  Honoring the Melby-Erskine Mission
Scopenote: Thai dancers entertain following the dinner given by General Phin Choonhavan, Commander-in-Chief, Royal Thai Army, honoring the Melby Erskine Mission.

title: Thai Dancers Entertain at Dinner Honoring the Melby Erskine Mission
Scopenote: Thai dancers entertain following the dinner given by General Phin Choonhavan, Commander-in-Chief, Royal Thai Army, honoring the Melby Erskine Mission.

title: Roosevelt Parade in Philadelphia
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt (lead car, back seat, passenger side) waves at crowd in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania from his motorcade. All others unidentified.

title: General Graves B. Erskine and members of the Melby Erskine Mission having lunch
Scopenote: Lunch for the Melby Erskine Mission team given by General Phin Choonhavan, Commander-in-Chief of the Royal Thai Army.  General Graves B Erskine is seated to the right of the centerpiece.  Others are unidentified.

title: General Graves B. Erskine saluting
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine and other officers saluting.  John F. Melby is left of General Erskine.  Others are unidentified. They are evidently in Thailand.

title: John F. Melby and General Graves B. Erskine Shaking Hands with Others
Scopenote: John F. Melby is shaking hands with an unidentified man.  General Graves B. Erskine is in the background shaking hands with another man.  They are evidently in Thailand.

title: General Graves B. Erskine and John F. Melby with Officers Saluting
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine, right front, and other officers are saluting.  John F. Melby is standing on the left of General Erskine.  Others are unidentified. They are apparently in Thailand.

title: John F. Melby and Others Standing at Attention
Scopenote: John F. Melby and others walking behind the soldiers standing at attention with the flag.  A building is under construction in the background. This apparently is in Thailand.

title: General Graves B. Erskine and John F. Melby Walking up the Steps
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine and John F. Melby walking up the steps with an unidentified man.  The soldiers and building under construction can be seen in the background. They are evidently in Thailand.

title: General Graves B. Erskine and John Melby
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine, saluting, and John F. Melby walking in front of the soldiers. The soldiers are standing at attention with the flag. They are probably in Thailand.

title: Philadelphia Crowd Greeting Roosevelt
Scopenote: Crowd on both sides of Broad Street in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania greeting President Franklin D. Roosevelt and members of his party in the parade. Roosevelt was headed to the Philadelphia Navy Yard. In the background is the City Hall.

title: John F. Melby disembarking the Plane in the Philippines
Scopenote: John F. Melby disembarking the plane in the Philippines during the Melby Erskine Mission.

title: General Graves B. Erskine Being Greeted in the Philippines
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine is being greeted in the Philippines during the Melby Erskine Mission.  Others are unidentified.

title: General Graves B. Erskine and others looking at papers
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine (center) and others looking a papers. They are in the Philippines during the Melby Erskine Mission.  Others are unidentified.

title: John F. Melby and General Graves B. Erskine Being Greeted in the Philippines
Scopenote: John F. Melby, on left, and General Graves B. Erskine, second from left, being greeted. They are in the Philippines during the Melby Erskine Mission. Others are unidentified.

title: Melby Erskine Mission in Thailand
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine, left, and John F. Melby, right, meet with unidentified people in Thailand during the Melby Erskine Mission.

title: General Graves B. Erskine and John F. Melby Meet with People in Thailand
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine and John F. Melby meet with unidentified people in Thailand during the Melby Erskine Mission.

title: Roosevelt Speaking at Fort Wayne, Indiana
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt (standing at microphones) speaking from train to crowd at Fort Wayne, Indiana while on the way to Chicago, Illinois. At far left is Governor Henry F. Schricker and at far right is Indiana Senator Samuel D. Jackson. All others unidentified.

title: John F. Melby meeting with Unidentified Men in Thailand
Scopenote: John F Melby meeting with unidentified men in Thailand during the Melby Erskine Mission.

title: General Graves B. Erskine meeting with Men in Thailand
Scopenote: General Graves B. Erskine meeting with unidentified men in Thailand during the Melby Erskine Mission.

title: John F. Melby and General Graves B. Erskine in Thailand
Scopenote: John F. Melby, back to camera, and General Graves B. Erskine, facing camera, meet with unidentified men in Thailand during the Melby Erskine Mission.

title: John F. Melby and Lady
Scopenote: John F. Melby and an unidentified lady on the front steps of a home.

title: John F. Melby Talking about his Book "The Mandate of Heaven"
Scopenote: John F. Melby talking about his book "The Mandate of Heaven".  The other man is unidentified.

title: Roosevelt Greeting Crowd at Chicago
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt greeting the crowd by waving his hat at Soldier Field in Chicago, Illinois. Roosevelt gave a campaign speech that evening. All others unidentified.

title: John F. Melby and his Book
Scopenote: John F. Melby (center) talking to two unidentified men about his book, "The Mandate of Heaven."

title: John F. Melby and an Unidentified Man Discuss his Book
Scopenote: John F. Melby (left) discussing his book, "The Mandate of Heaven" with an unidentified man.

title: John F. Melby Autographs his Book
Scopenote: John F. Melby (right) autographing his book, "The Mandate of Heaven" for an unidentified man.

title: Tintype of Unidentified Man
Scopenote: Tintype of unidentified man, possibly related to Stuart A. Rice.

title: Unidentified Girl in Goat Drawn Wagon
Scopenote: Unidentified girl, possibly Sarah Alice Mayfield, second wife of Stuart A. Rice.  She is sitting in a wagon being pulled by a goat.

title: Roosevelt Speaking From Platform in Fort Wayne
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt speaking from platform next to his train in Fort Wayne, Indiana. Roosevelt stopped while on his way to Chicago, Illinois. All people unidentified.

title: Roosevelt Waving From Train Platform
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt waves from the platform of his train while at a campaign stop in Springfield, Massachusetts. From left to right: Roosevelt, Boston Mayor Maurice J. Tobin, and William Burke, Massachusetts State Democratic Chairman.

title: Atlantic Fleet on North River, New York City
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice writes: "A few of the one million people who saw the Atlantic Fleet. This was two days after the sinking of the Lusitania. The fleet is lined up on the North River for five or six miles. This was taken from a touring car in which we were riding with Uncle "D" Rich and Aunt Carrie."

title: Sing Sing Prison
Scopenote: Sing Sing Correctional Facility in New York.  Stuart A. Rice describes the snapshot: "Prisoner's band in court.  Utmost freedom prevails inside the prison yard.  Good view of cell house.  Cells are cut in solid stone 3 ft. 4 in. x 6 ft. & some inches.  Many have 2 occupants.  One of Warden Osborne's chief endeavors is to keep them out of the cells."

title: Sing Sing Prison in New York
Scopenote: Sing Sing Correctional Facility in New York.  "Excursion of Monday Clubs.  View shows two industrial buildings, at either side, power house, cell house at back."

title: Excursion to Sing Sing
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice describes this snapshot: "Excursion to Sing Sing.  Looking toward East Shore.  One of the Hudson Day Line Boats overtook us.  We were very heavily loaded - 500 even aboard."

title: Roosevelt on Train Platform in Worcester
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt (seated) on the back platform of his train while in Worcester, Massachusetts. Roosevelt was on his way to deliver the final speech of his campaign in Boston, Massachusetts. From left to right: Massachusetts Senator David I. Walsh; Admiral William D. Leahy, Commander-in-Chief of the United States Naval Forces; Boston Mayor Maurice J. Tobin, and President Roosevelt.

title: Excursion of New York and Brooklyn
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice describes this snapshot:  "Excursion of N. Y. & Brooklyn Monday Clubs to Sing Sing Prison, Ossining, N.Y."

title: Horsecar Passing Through Municipal Building
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice describes this snapshot: "Horsecar passing through Municipal Building.  Chambers St. passes thru the Mun. Bldg. as an arcade."

title: A New York Merchant
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice describes this snapshot:  "A New York Merchant (Retail) under L on 1st Ave. about 11th or 12th.  He has not yet acquired his own pushcart, but carries his stock of goods (garlics) over his shoulder."

title: New York Tribune Bulletin Board
Scopenote: The bulletin board for the New York Tribune.

title: Brooklyn Bridge
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice describes this snapshot:  "Looking East on Bkn. Bridge.  Bridge erected (date at x) 1875."

title: East River From Brooklyn Bridge
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice describes this snapshot:  "Looking up East River from Brooklyn Bridge showing Manhattan bridge and navy yard section of Bkn."

title: Looking West on Brooklyn Bridge
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice describes this snapshot:  "Looking West on Brooklyn Bridge showing Woolworth, World, Municipal & other buildings."

title: Hudson River and Palisades
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice describes this snapshot:  "Hudson & Palisades.  The Kodak was pointed almost straight down, so that what appears to be sky is all part of the river.  Ripples may be seen near shore."  Palisades Park was in New Jersey.

title: Hudson River From Palisades
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice describes this snapshot:  "Hudson from Palisades.  Note ferry landing at bottom.  Vehicle ferrys from here to Dyckman St.  Expected Riverside Drive to show on other side."

title: Brook in Palisades Park
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice described this snapshot: "A little brook in Palisades Park."  Palisades Park was in New Jersey overlooking the Hudson River.

title: Roosevelt Seated in Car
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt in car while riding through the streets of Poughkeepsie, New York. Later that evening Roosevelt addressed the nation from his home in Hyde Park, New York.

title: Hudson River From Palisades
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice described this snapshot:  "Hudson River from top of Palisades.  Elevation of about 500 ft.  The Dyckman hollow thru may be seen below."

Scopenote: Many vehicles parked in an unidentified location.  There is a water tower in the background.  This is probably in New York.

Scopenote: An unidentified vehicle on a street in New York.  There is a harnessed horse standing by the vehicle.

Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice writes "The Hamburg American Line docks across the Hudson at Hoboken.  The large boat is The Vaterland - all tied up here ever since the war began".

Scopenote: The ship Polynesia Norge on the Hudson near Hoboken, New Jersey.

Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice quote "The true temple of prosperity and the high sanctified college of glory 'New York Branch'".

Scopenote: An unidentified man is fishing in an unidentified location, possibly in New York area.  Other nearby photos were taken in New York.

Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt (left) and Secretary of the Treasury Henry Morgenthau (right) seated in a car in Poughkeepsie, New York. President Roosevelt was finishing his campaign for re-election.

title: West Point
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice quote "West Point after we'd gone around the point". The view is from the Hudson River.

title: West Point
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice quote "Excellent picture of main bldgs. at West Point.  Observe the tunnel under the bldg. where the West Shore Line R.R. goes thru."

Scopenote: The road goes back and forth up the hillside to reach the top.  The location is unidentified. Possibly taken in the New York area.

Scopenote: Looking out over the area from the hilltop.  The location is unidentified. Possibly taken in New York area.

Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice quote "The Storm King on the left.  Anthony's Nose on right - near West Point."  These are mountains on the Hudson River.

Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice quote "A typical 5 river scow (part of it) interminable in length - all connected."  This is probably taken on the Hudson River.

Scopenote: The laundry hangs from lines between apartments.  The location is not identified, but many of these 1915 photos were taken in New York City.

Scopenote: An unidentified person is climbing the pole.  The location is also unidentified.

Scopenote: An unidentified ship is docked in an unidentified location.

Scopenote: A ship is docked by a large unidentified building.  There are numerous smaller buildings nearby. This photo is near other photos taken around New York City.

title: Building Under Repair
Scopenote: Large unidentified building, possibly apartments, apparently under repair. There is a lady with children in center front among what appears to be workers. This appears to be in a city, possibly New York City, as other nearby photographs were taken there.

title: Census Report, New York
Scopenote: Maximum Minimum Daily Census, New York.  Monthly Yearly Average Census.  1897-1916.

title: A View of the City
Scopenote: A view of the city, apparently New York City.  Buildings are unidentified.

title: Roosevelt Outside Polling Station
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt seated in his car outside the polling station at the Town Hall in Hyde Park, New York after voting on Election Day. The photographers, reporters, and all others are unidentified.

title: Hudson and Palisades From Fort Tryon Hill
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice quote "Hudson & Palisades from Fort Tryon Hill.  Dyckman St. ferry below.  Taken from a point of rock on which we often sit - near 120 Arden St." The Palisades in is New Jersey.

title: Fort George Hill
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice quote "Fort George Hill from roof of 428 W. 204 St. showing Washington Bridge and High Bridge over Harlem River.  At the left the plant of the United Elec. Light & Power Co.  In the foreground, Sherman Creek (A) Speedway and Speedway Inn (B) 203 St. (C)".  This is in New York City.

title: D.P.C. Excursion to Bear Mountain
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice wrote on back of snapshot: "D.P.C. Excursion to BEAR Mountain on Str. Thomas S. Brennan.  Com'r Dougherty standing by mast.  Com'r Kingsbury seated in center.  Part of Yonkers in background."

title: Roosevelt Watching Torchlight Parade
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt (seated) watches a torchlight parade in his honor on election evening staged by his neighbors outside his home in Hyde Park, New York. Standing, from left to right: Elmer Van Wagner, former law partner; Mrs. John Boettiger, the President's daughter; and Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt.

title: D.P.C. Excursion to Bear Mountain
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice wrote on the back of the snapshot: "D.P.C. Excursion to Bear Mountain.  The Randall's Island Band."

title: Kingsbridge from Inwood Hill
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice quote "Kingsbridge from Inwood Hill.  Thanksgiving Day 1915.  Ship canal in left center.  215 St. in right center.  On top of hill, on opposite side to Harlem River, silhouetted against sky, the great Armory - Cath. Orphan Asylum (Extreme right)."  This is in New York City.

title: Fireplace in British Officer's Hut, Inwood Hill
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice quote "Fireplace in British Officer's Hut.  Excavated near W 204 St. - Foot of Inwood Hill.  37 Huts on this site have been uncovered under direction of Reginald Pelham Bolton".  This snapshot was evidently taken in New York City.

title: The Curfew and Fire Alarm in New Jersey
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice quote "The curfew and fire alarm.  Typical of a rural New Jersey Borough Hall."

title: Fort Ticonderoga
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice quote "Fort Ticonderoga.  Enn & Maurice - posed by me."

title: Trout Brook
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice quote "Trout Brook - Olmstedville.  Staker - bridge by Floyds".

Scopenote: Hungry people wait in line for free bread at the Municipal Lodging Home in New York City.  Enlarged photo also included.

title: Hannegan Kisses the Ring of Cardinal Spellman
Scopenote: Postmaster General Robert Hannegan (foreground, right) kisses the ring of Francis Cardinal Spellman (standing) during a formal reception welcoming the Cardinal that took place in the Metropolitan Opera House in New York City. Seated on the left are, from left to right: Mrs. James F. McDonnell, Mayor William O'Dwyer, and Governor Thomas E. Dewey. All others are unidentified.

title: International Statistical Conference in Washington, D.C
Scopenote: Technical simultaneous translation equipment was first used at the International Statistical Conference in Washington, D.C.  Interpreters were used at the Prague meeting in 1938, last meeting before World War II.

title: Reception For Cardinal Spellman
Scopenote: Postmaster General Robert Hannegan (front row, right) attending a reception for Francis Cardinal Spellman (front row, second from left) at the Metropolitan Opera House in New York, New York. Also present is New York Governor Thomas Dewey (left). The speaker and all others are unidentified.

title: Wives of International Statistical Conference Delegates
Scopenote: Quote from Sarah Alice Rice, "Since the International Statistical Conferences in 1947 was the first international meeting anywhere in the U.S. following the second war, every effort was made for the participants to have some opportunity of informal acquaintance with Washingtonians.  As far as I know, this was the first time an effort was made to have every wife or daughter accompanying delegates to be entertained in small groups in U.S. homes.  This program was most successful and even high-ranking women in government graciously participated, including Mrs. Frances Perkins, the first woman to serve in the cabinet.  This set something of a precedent for many times in following meetings of the International Statistical Institute meeting in other countries, delegates and wives were invited in small groups to homes for dinner, i.e. Stockholm, Belgrade, Sydney.  In Washington we invited only wives to luncheons, for the membership of the entire five meetings would have been too large to organize, there being well over 500."

title: Unidentified Man and Stuart A. Rice
Scopenote: An unidentified man and Stuart A. Rice (at right). Information with photo: "The Business Advisory Council was formed during the Truman Administration with government representatives and outstanding business men representing such groups as the National Association of Manufacturers, Retail Trade Association, Comptroller's Institute, etc.  They met, and continue to do so, once a month in 'business/working' sessions and once a year a special dinner to which wives are invited from around the country, and the Director of the Budget is guest of honor and speaker.  The President of the U.S. is always invited and often comes in briefly, as did President Truman and others. (Sarah Alice Rice 3/10/76)"

title: Stuart Rice Car Unable to Pass on Road in Northern Okinawa
Scopenote: Stuart A. Rice quote: "Coming down through a cut, around a curve, singularly like a spot on the road from Petroplis, we met a truck coming up.  The only way for the truck, when we'd given all the ground we could, was blocked by a telephone pole.  The wire had been removed (to go over the top, I guess) so the two or three Okinawan truck drivers and helpers, cheered on by the girls in the back, set to work and pulled and dug up the pole.  But the worst for us was when we mired in deep mud, with all hands collecting brush and the drivers working the jack we managed - both ways, the worst being coming back."  The Statistical Advisors were in Okinawa, Japan to learn about the conditions, problems and developments.

title: Road Too Narrow to Pass in Okinawa
Scopenote: The Statistical Advisory Group traveled north of Naha, Okinawa, Japan.  Mr. Rice quotes: "A road such as I have not travelled over.  Coming down through a cut, around a curve, singularly like a spot on the road from Petroplis, we met a truck coming up.  The only way for the truck, when we'd given all the ground we could, was blocked by a telephone pole.  The wire had been removed (to go over the top, I guess) so the two or three Okinawan truck drivers and helpers, cheered on by the girls in the back, set to work and pulled and dug up the pole.  But the worst for us was when we mired in deep mud, with all hands collecting brush and the drivers working the jack we managed - both ways, the worst being coming back."

title: Sugar Cane Field in Northern Okinawa
Scopenote: Horse hitched to wagon to haul sugar cane from field.  The Statistical Advisors visit the  field in Northern Okinawa, Japan to learn about the conditions and problems.  Stuart A. Rice is shown on the right.  Others are unidentified.

title: Truman's First Day as President
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman walks through the door of the White House on his first day as President.

title: Truman Receiving Discharge Emblem Stamps
Scopenote: Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan (third from right) presents sheets of "Ruptured Duck" Discharge Emblem postage stamps to (l-r): U.S. Coast Guard Machinist's Mate 1/c Paul Leaman Clark; U.S. Navy Chief Electrician's Mate Charles V. Claybourn; President Harry S. Truman; U.S. Army Sergeant Michael Pulice; and U.S. Marine Corps Sergeant Douglas T. Jacobson.

title: Truman Receiving Discharge Emblem Stamps
Scopenote: Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan (third from right) presents sheets of the "Ruptured Duck" Discharge Emblem postage stamps to (l-r): U.S. Coast Guard Machinist's Mate 1/c Paul Leaman Clark; U.S. Navy Chief Electrician's Mate Charles V. Claybourn; President Harry S. Truman; U.S. Army Sergeant Michael Pulice; and U.S. Marine Corps Sergeant Douglas T. Jacobson.

title: Swearing-In of Secretary Byrnes
Scopenote: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes kisses the Bible as he is sworn in as Secretary of State in the White House Rose Garden.  Also pictured, front row (l-r): Chief Justice Richard S. Whaley of the U.S. Court of Claims; Mrs. Maude Byrnes; and President Harry S. Truman.  Second row (l-r): unidentified; Senator Kenneth McKellar; Secretary of War Henry L. Stimson; and Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan.  Standing behind Hannegan on the right is Secretary of Labor Lewis Schwellenbach. All others are unidentified.

title: Swearing-In of Secretary Byrnes
Scopenote: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes (center) shakes hands with President Harry S. Truman (left) after being sworn-in as Secretary of State in the White House Rose Garden.  Also pictured (second row, l-r): Former Secretary of State Edward R. Stettinius, Jr.; Senator Kenneth McKellar; Secretary of War Henry L. Stimson; and Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan.  All others unidentified.

title: Swearing-In of Secretary Byrnes
Scopenote: Secretary of State James F. Byrnes (center) shakes hands with President Harry S. Truman (right) after being sworn-in as Secretary in the White House Rose Garden.  Also pictured (second row, l-r): Former Secretary of State Edward R. Stettinius, Jr.; Senator Kenneth McKellar; Secretary of War Henry L. Stimson; and Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan.  All others unidentified.

title: Truman and Hannegan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan in the Oval Office.

title: Hannegan Presenting Stamps
Scopenote: Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan (left) presents sheets of postage stamps commemorating Franklin D. Roosevelt's birthday to President Harry S. Truman (center).  All others are unidentified.

title: Truman and Hank Greenberg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) receives an autographed baseball from Detroit Tigers first baseman Hank Greenberg (right).  Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan is on left.

title: Tunnel at the 38th Parallel
Scopenote: United States Ambassador Philip C. Jessup (middle) with his wife Lois Jessup (front) in a dugout tunnel at the 38th Parallel in South Korea.  All other individuals are unidentified.

title: Garden Party for Wounded Veterans
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with an Army Nurse Lieutenant at a White House Garden Party for wounded veterans.  Brigadier General Harry Vaughan is pictured on the President's left and Naval Aide Captain Clark Clifford is in the background, center.  All others unidentified.

title: Truman Signs Air Mail Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) signs a bill reducing air mail postage while Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan looks on.

title: Truman Signing Air Mail Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, center) signs the 5-cent Air Mail Bill in the Oval Office. Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan is seated at right. Also pictured (l-r): Congressman George D. O'Brien; John Hart of United Airlines; Senator Dennis Chavez; Senator Carl Hayden; Congressman Charles E. McKenzie; Congressman John C. Butler; Frank J. Delaney of the Post Office Department; C.E. Fleming of Transcontinental and Western Air; Emery F. Johnson of the Air Transport Association; and Charles M. Knoble of Pennsylvania-Central Airlines.

title: Truman Signing Air Mail Bill
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (seated, left) signs the 5-cent Air Mail Bill at his desk in the Oval Office. Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan is seated at right. Standing (l-r): Congressman George D. O'Brien; John Hart of United Airlines; Senator Dennis Chavez; Senator Carl Hayden; Congressman Charles E. McKenzie; Congressman John C. Butler; and Frank J. Delany of the Post Office Department.

title: Truman with Democrats
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses with a large group of Democrats outside the White House.  Front row (l-r): O.S. Warden, Democratic National Committee Member; Oscar R. Ewing, Democratic National Committee Vice Chairman; Leif Erickson, Nominee for Senator, Montana; Governor Herbert R. O'Conor, Nominee for Senator, Maryland; President Truman; Bernice (Mrs. Wallace) Kingsbury; Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan; H.J. McMurray, Nominee for Senator, Wisconsin; John Redstrom, Nominee for Representative, Wisconsin; M.G. Burnside, Nominee for Representative, West Virginia; J.Y. Brown, Nominee for Senator, Kentucky.  Second row (l-r): Senator James Murray; Myron Sulzburger, Nominee for 17th Congressional District, New York; W. Preston Lane, Jr., Nominee for Governor, Maryland; R.E. Tehan, Democratic National Committee Member; H.A. Meade, Nominee for 2nd Congressional District, Maryland; Lawton Barnes, Nominee for 36th Congressional District, New York; Charles Green, Democratic State Chairman of Wisconsin; and Herman Methfessell.  Third row (l-r):  R.R. Nacy, Democratic National Committee Vice Chairman; Pete Leguineche, Nominee for 2nd Congressional District, Idaho; F.A. Emma, Nominee for 35th Congressional District, New York; John Burry, Nominee for 16th Congressional District, New York; Abner Larson, Nominee for Senator, North Dakota; G.D. Johnson, Nominee for 4th Congressional District, Oklahoma; and Charles Murray.  Fourth row (l-r): George Killion, Democratic National Committee Treasurer; Elmer E. Fraley, Nominee 7th Congressional District, Wisconsin; J.B. Downey, Nominee 44th Congressional District, New York; E.V. Borrowicz, Nominee 4th Congressional District, Wisconsin; Representative Andrew Biemiller; Mrs. India Edwards; and Arch McDonald, Nominee for 6th Congressional District, Maryland.

title: Truman, Hannegan, and Nacy
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) with Postmaster General and Democratic National Committee Chairman Robert E. Hannegan (left) and Democratic National Committee Vice Chairman Richard R. Nacy in the White House. Photo is signed by Hannegan and also autographed: "Dick Nacy/White House 9/24/46."

title: Truman In St. Louis Before Election
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) shakes hands with both former Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan (left) and Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder in St. Louis, Missouri, just prior to the 1948 presidential election.

title: Truman In St. Louis Before Election
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) shakes hands with both former Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan (foreground, left) and Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder (right) in St. Louis, Missouri, just prior to the 1948 presidential election. All others are unidentified.

title: The "Sacred Cow"
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman walks off the presidential airplane, the "Sacred Cow", at La Guardia Airport in New York City.  He flew to New York to accept an honorary degree from Forham University. All others unidentified.

title: Hannegan in Postal Hat
Scopenote: Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan in a post officer's hat after being sworn in as Postmaster General.

title: Tunnel at the 38th Parallel
Scopenote: United States Ambassador Philip C. Jessup (middle) with his wife Lois Jessup (front) in a dugout tunnel at the 38th Parallel in South Korea.  All other individuals are unidentified

title: Hannegans at the Kentucky Derby
Scopenote: Robert E. Hannegan, Chairman of the Democratic City Committee of St. Louis (left), with mother-in-law Mrs. William Protzmann (center) and wife Irma Hannegan at the Kentucky Derby.

title: Hannegan and Family in Restaurant
Scopenote: Robert E. Hannegan, Chairman of the Democratic City Committee of St. Louis, Missouri (right), with his wife Irma P. Hannegan (center) and mother-in-law Mrs. William Proutzmann at a restaurant during Kentucky Derby festivities.  All others unidentified.

title: Mrs. Hannegan at Kentucky Derby
Scopenote: Mrs. Irma Hannegan (second from left) and her mother, Mrs. William Protzmann (left) with a group of unidentified men and women at the Kentucky Derby. Also present is Bernard Dickmann (second from right).

title: Hannegan and Others at the Kentucky Derby
Scopenote: Robert E. Hannegan, Chairman of the Democratic City Committee of St. Louis, Missouri (right), Mrs. Irma P. Hannegan (third from left), and Mrs. William Protzmann (second from left) with a group of unidentified men and women at the Kentucky Derby. Also present is Bernard F. Dickmann (second from right).

title: Dedication of Post Office
Scopenote: From left to right, William Hannegan, Robert E. Hannegan, Jr., Mrs. Irma P. Hannegan, and Sally Hannegan view a portrait of former Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan at the dedication of the Robert E. Hannegan Post Office in St. Louis, Missouri. The portrait was painted by Greta Kempton.

title: Hannegan Post Office Dedication
Scopenote: From left to right, William Hannegan, Mrs. Bernard Dickmann, Mrs. Irma P. Hannegan, Sally Hannegan, former St. Louis mayor Bernard F. Dickmann, and Robert E. Hannegan, Jr. stand underneath a portrait of Robert E. Hannegan at the dedication of the Robert E. Hannegan Post Office in St. Louis, Missouri. The portrait was painted by Greta Kempton.

title: Hannegan Post Office Dedication
Scopenote: A large group of people pose for a group picture at the dedication of the Robert E. Hannegan Post Office in St. Louis, Missouri.  Present are: former St. Louis mayor Bernard F. Dickmann (foreground, left, wearing pocket square), Mrs. Bernard F. Dickmann (second row, fifth from left, behind Bernard Dickmann), Mrs. Irma P. Hannegan (second row, third from right, holding fur coat), Sally Hannegan (second row, second from right), and William Hannegan (second row, fourth from right).  All others unidentified.

title: Hannegan Post Office Dedication
Scopenote: A group of people pose with bottles of Coca-Cola during the dedication of the Robert E. Hannegan Post Office in St. Louis, Missouri.  Present are: Mrs. Irma P. Hannegan (right), former St. Louis mayor Bernard F. Dickmann (second from right), Mrs. Bernard F. Dickmann (third from right), and Sally Hannegan (fourth from right).  All others unidentified.

title: Hannegan, Dickmann, and Unidentified Man
Scopenote: Robert E. Hannegan (right) outside an unidentified building with St. Lous, Missouri mayor Bernard F. Dickmann (center) and an unidentified man.

Scopenote: Bernard F. Dickmann (left) shakes hands with Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan after his swearing-in ceremony.

title: Presentation of Robert Hannegan Portrait

Seated on the right is former Post Office official Gael Sullivan (second from left). All others are unidentified.

title: Hannegan with His Portrait
Scopenote: Mrs. Irma P. Hannegan (from left to right), former Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan, and an unidentified man look at the portrait of Mr. Hannegan painted by Greta Kempton.

Scopenote: Former Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan (second from right) sits at a banquet table with three unidentified men during the presentation of his official portrait, painted by Greta Kempton.

Scopenote: Former Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan (left) and Greta Kempton (second from left) pose with three unidentified men next to Mr. Hannegan's portrait at its unveiling in New York. Ms. Kempton painted the official portrait.

title: The Hannegans and the Geists
Scopenote: Irving Geist (left to right), Mrs. Irma P. Hannegan, Robert E. Hannegan, and Mrs. Irving Geist pose for a picture in front of some shrubbery. The exact location is unknown.

Scopenote: Major Anthony Story (front) leading the wife of the United States Ambassador, Lois (Mrs. Philip C.) Jessup (back), through a dugout tunnel at the 38th Parallel in South Korea.

Scopenote: Postmaster General and Democratic National Committee Chairman Robert E. Hannegan (right) leaves the White House with former Office of Price Administration leader Chester Bowles after a conference with President Harry S. Truman.

Scopenote: Major Anthony F. Story ( right) and Lois (Mrs. Philip C.) Jessup (left) at the 38th Parallel in Korea.  This photo was taken while Vernice Anderson traveled with Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: Artist Presents Bust of Franklin Roosevelt
Scopenote: Sculptor Alvin T. Marriott (right) presents a bust of Franklin D. Roosevelt to Major General Edwin Watson, a military aide to President Roosevelt.

title: Hannegan at Banquet Table
Scopenote: Democratic National Committee Chairman Robert E. Hannegan (center) sits at a banquet table with two unidentified men.

title: Election Night 1944

title: The Hannegans and Stettinius
Scopenote: Democratic National Committee Chairman Robert E. Hannegan (center) walks with his wife, Mrs. Irma P. Hannegan (left) and Secretary of State Edward Stettinius during the funeral ceremony for President Franklin D. Roosevelt in Hyde Park, NY.

title: Presentation Ceremony for Mobile X-Ray Unit

Also pictured are (l-r): Dr. William D. Coolidge, x-ray consultant for the General Electric Co.; Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan; and Dr. C.L. Williams, Sr., Assistant Surgeon General, U.S. Public Health Service.

title: Labor Vote Debate Broadcast
Scopenote: Democratic National Committee Chairman Robert E. Hannegan (left) debates for labor vote with President of the American Federation of Labor William Green (center) and Chairman of the Republican National Committee B. Carroll Reece (right).

Scopenote: Former Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan and family at Castel Gandolfo after an audience with Pope Pius XII. Pictured (l-r): Robert E. Hannegan, Jr.; William Hannegan; Mrs. Irma P. Hannegan; Sally Hannegan; Robert E. Hannegan; and Patricia Hannegan.  All others unidentified.

Scopenote: Democratic National Committee Chairman Robert E. Hannegan (left) stands next to Archbishop of St. Louis, Missouri John J. Glennon.

Scopenote: Pope Pius XII (center) prays after presenting the first insignia of office to new Cardinals. All others unidentified.

Scopenote: Interior view of St. Peter's Cathedral with Pope Pius XII on the throne (left) during ceremonies for the creation of new Cardinals.

Scopenote: Pope Pius XII (seated) embracing James Cardinal McGuigan during the Biretta ceremony for new Cardinals at the Vatican.  All others unidentified.

Scopenote: Cardinal John J. Glennon (left) receives his hat from Papal Chamberlain Toraldo (right).  All others unidentified.

Scopenote: Samuel Cardinal Stritch (left) leads a procession at Holy Hour through Soldier's Field, Chicago.  Also pictured (l-r, immediately behind the Cardinal): Papal Chamberlain Dr. Louis Moorhead; and Papal Knight Charles Kerwin.  All others unidentified.

Scopenote: Catholic chalice in memory of former Postmaster General and Chairman of the Democratic National Committee Robert E. Hannegan.

Scopenote: Unidentified man holding a fish. Photo taken during a fishing trip with Robert Hannegan. Scanned from original negative.

title: Gael Sullivan Testimonial Dinner

Hardy, Deputy Second Assistant Postmaster General; Morris Klein, President of New York Railway Mail Association; Senator James M. Mead; Second Assistant Postmaster General Gael Sullivan; Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan; Albert Goldman, Postmaster New York, New York; and Chief Inspector James J. Doran. Second row: Peter J. Ramspeck, Air Transport Association; and James E. Rossell, Regional Director, Civil Service Commission.

title: Aloha Dinner Aboard the S.S. President Cleveland
Scopenote: Secretary to Ambassador Philip C. Jessup, Vernice Anderson, at the Aloha Dinner while aboard the S.S. President Cleveland cruise liner. The head waiter standing at the back is identified as Frank. All other individuals are unidentified.  Ms. Anderson traveled with Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: Hannegan at White House
Scopenote: Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan leaves the White House after speaking with President Harry S. Truman about resigning as Chairman of the Democratic National Committee.

title: Hannegan Leaving White House
Scopenote: Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan leaves the White House after speaking with President Harry S. Truman about resigning as Chairman of the Democratic National Committee.

title: Hannegan Leaving White House

Jessup on his mission to the Far East.

title: Hannegan and Blaine
Scopenote: Actress Vivian Blaine (left) and Democratic National Committee Chairman Robert E. Hannegan. Photo is autographed: "To Robert E. Hannegan Best wishes for much success and happiness Sincerely Vivian Blaine."

title: Hannegan on Movie Set
Scopenote: From left to right, movie producer William Perlberg, actress Dorothy McGuire, and Democratic National Committee Chairman Robert E. title: Hannegan with California Delegates
Scopenote: Democratic National Committee Chairman Robert E. Scopenote: From left to right around the table, James T. Blair, Attorney General Tom C. Hannegan, Lady Bird Johnson, and Representative Lyndon B. Johnson eat dinner at The Troika restaurant in Washington, D.C. Waiter is unidentified.

title: Outside of the President Truman's Office

Scopenote: Democratic National Committee Vice-Chairman India Edwards (right) with an unidentified woman at the Carlton Hotel in Washington, D.C.

Scopenote: A Democratic National Committee Luncheon for party leaders from Indiana and Michigan. Scopenote: A receiving line during a reception honoring Democratic National Committee Vice-Chairman India Edwards (center) in Indiana.  All other individuals are unidentified.

Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Women's Director, Democratic National Committee, (left) gives Congresswoman Helen Gahagan Douglas (right) a hug after the Congresswoman's speech before the Democratic National Convention.

title: Democratic National Committee Vice-Chairman India Edwards
Scopenote: Democratic National Committee Vice-Chairman India Edwards (center) with two unidentified women, possibly at an event in Texas.

Scopenote: The First Lady, Mrs. Bess W. Truman, with various women Democratic Party leaders. Scopenote: Mrs. Anna Rosenberg, Assistant Secretary of Defense, welcomes the members of the Defense Advisory Committee on Women in the Services.

Scopenote: The Defense Advisory Committee on Women in the Services luncheon held at the Mayflower Hotel in Washington, D.C.  The committee lunched with Department of Defense Officials and heads of the women's services.  All individuals are unidentified.

Shelly, Director of Women in the Air Force.  All other individuals are unidentified.

Scopenote: An unidentified speaker at a Democratic Party Conference in Des Moines, Iowa.  In attendance are Vice-President Alben Barkley (third from left) and Mrs. India Edwards, Executive Director, Women's Division, Democratic National Committee (fourth from left). All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Executive Director, Women's Division, Democratic National Committee (center); with Mrs. Blanche Fritz, Democratic Delegate to Democratic National Convention from Illinois (left), and an unidentified committee member.

Scopenote: United States Ambassador to Denmark Eugenie Anderson. Anderson was appointed by Harry S. Truman as the first female ambassador.

Scopenote: General of the Army Douglas MacArthur's personal plane, "Bataan," on which American Ambassador Philip C. Jessup and his party flew to Kyoto, Japan.  Scene is at Itami Airfield.

Scopenote: Ms. Betty Goodwin looking at records.   She is probably in one of the offices of the Democratic National Committee.

Scopenote: Mr. George Killion (left) with Nat Lichtblau (right), both of whom are involved in the Democratic Party.

Scopenote: Banquet for women of television and radio held at the residence of ambassador Perle Mesta. Standing from left to right: Priscilla (Mrs. John) Sullivan, wife of the Secretary of the Navy; unidentified woman; Margaret (Mrs. Kenneth) Royall; Mrs. Henrietta (Mrs. Clinton) Anderson; and Mary (Mrs. Tom) Clark.

Scopenote: Secretary of Defense, Robert A. Lovett (center, left), escorting Captain Joy Hancock, Director of the Women Accepted for Volunteer Emergency Service (WAVES)(center, right) as they arrive at the Pentagon. Scopenote: Units from the Women's Services salute the members of the Defense Advisory Committee on Women in the Services arriving at the Pentagon.  General George C. They were followed by other Department of Defense officials, the heads of the Women's Services, and Committee Members.  All other individuals are unidentified.

O'Conor, Nominee for Senator, Maryland; President Truman; Bernice (Mrs. Wallace) Kingsbury; Postmaster General Robert E. Hannegan; H.J. Second row (l-r): Senator James Murray; Myron Sulzburger, Nominee for 17th Congressional District, New York; W. Preston Lane, Jr., Nominee for Governor, Maryland; R.E. Tehan, Democratic National Committee Member; H.A. Meade, Nominee for 2nd Congressional District, Maryland; Lawton Barnes, Nominee for 36th Congressional District, New York; Charles Green, Democratic State Chairman of Wisconsin; and Herman Methfessell.  Third row (l-r):  R.R. Nacy, Democratic National Committee Vice Chairman; Pete Leguineche, Nominee for 2nd Congressional District, Idaho; F.A. Emma, Nominee for 35th Congressional District, New York; John Burry, Nominee for 16th Congressional District, New York; Abner Larson, Nominee for Senator, North Dakota; G.D. Scopenote: First Lady Mrs. Bess Truman at a party thrown for Mrs. India Edwards, Executive Director, Women's Division, Democratic National Committee, by Washington, D.C. newspaper women. From left to right: Margaret Truman, Esther Tufty, India Edwards Eda (Mrs. Charles) Brannan, and Mrs. Truman.

title: Democratic Women's Day Dinner
Scopenote: The Democratic Women's Day Dinner hosted by Little Rock Democratic Women's Division at the Hotel Marion.  Pictured (from left to right): Mrs. Jesse Kirten, Vice-Chairman of Pulaski County (Arkansas) Committee; Governor Sid McMath; Mrs. India Edwards, Executive Director, Women's Division, Democratic National Committee; Miss Pauline Hoeltzel, Little Rock Democratic Women's Division Chairman.

title: Women's Democratic Dinner in Illinois
Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Executive Director of the Women's Division of the Democratic National Committee, (back row, fifth from left); and Blanche Fritz (back row, sixth from left) at dinner in Springfield, Illinois.  All other individuals are unidentified.

title: Mrs. India Edwards Being Presented to Austrian Chancellor
Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Vice-Chairman, Democratic National Committee (left), being presented to Austrian Chancellor Leopold Figl (right) by United States High Commissioner Walter Donnelly (center).

title: Pennsylvania Women's Leaders in Washington D.C
Scopenote: Women Democratic Party leaders from Pennsylvania gather in Washington, D.C. Pictured: Emma Guffey Miller, member of the Democratic National Committee of Pennsylvania (seated center), Congresswoman Chase G. Woodhouse (seated, right), and Mrs. India Edwards, Vice-Chairman, Democratic National Committee (standing, far right).  All other individuals are unidentified.

title: Ambassador Jessup's Trip to Kyoto
Scopenote: American Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup (right) presents Major General John B. Coulter (center) to Lois (Mrs. Philip C.) Jessup after their arrival to the Itami Airfield in Kyoto, Japan. All other individuals are unidentified.

title: San Francisco Regional Conference
Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Executive Director, Women's Division, Democratic National Committee (left); and Mrs. Elinor Heller, National Committeewoman for California (right) at the San Francisco Regional Conference.

title: India Edwards in Vienna
Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Vice-Chairman, Democratic National Committee (left); with Mr. William Harlan Hale (center), and Mr. Charles Moffly (right) in Vienna, Austria.

title: World Health Organization Meeting in Geneva
Scopenote: United States delegates at the World Health Organization Meeting in Geneva, Switzerland. Left to Right: (front row) Dr. Leonard Scheele, Dr. H. Van Zile Hyde; (second row) Mrs. India Edwards, Dr. Elmer Henderson. All other individuals are unidentified.

title: American Forum of the Air
Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Vice-Chairman, Democratic National Committee (second from left), as a guest on the panel of "American Forum of the Air", a radio news program. All others are unidentified.

title: Democratic Party Women
Scopenote: Mrs. Perle Mesta, Minister to Luxembourg (left); Mrs. India Edwards, Executive Director, Women's Division, Democratic National Convention (center); and Mrs. Georgia Clark, Treasurer of the United States (right), strolling together on the lawn of the Shoreham Hotel in Washington, D.C.

title: Girls Clubs of America's 15th Annual Conference
Scopenote: Senator Thomas Hennings, Jr. (left) addressing the plenary session at the Girls Clubs of America's  15th annual conference at the Sheraton Park Hotel in Washington, D.C.  Mrs. India Edwards, National President of the Girls Clubs of America (right), who introduced the Senator, looks on.

title: India Edwards During the 1948 Presidential Campaign
Scopenote: Mrs. Louis McHenry Howe (left) and Mrs. India Edwards, Executive Director of the Women's Division, Democratic National Committee (right), during the 1948 Presidential campaign.

title: Women of the Democratic Party
Scopenote: Women of the Democratic Party during an unidentified event. Left to Right: (seated) Alice (Mrs. William H.) Good, National Committeewoman for New York; Elizabeth Conkey, National Committeewoman for Illinois; Mary T. Norton, Congresswoman for New Jersey; Mrs. India Edwards, Democratic National Committee member; and Mrs. Gladys Tillett, Democratic National Committee member; (standing) unidentified woman; Mrs. Dorothy Vrendenburgh, Secretary of the Democratic National Committee; Mrs. Emma Guffey Miller, Democratic National Committee Official for Pennsylvania; Mrs. Florence Jaffray Harriman, Former United States Ambassador to Norway.

title: Former President Truman with Democratic Leaders
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (third from right) out and about in Washington D.C. Left to Right: Mr. William Boyle; Mr. Frank McKinney; Mrs. India Edwards, Vice-Chairman, Democratic National Committee; Truman; Mr. Paul Butler, Chairman, Democratic National Committee; and Mrs. Katie Louchheim, Vice Chairman, Democratic National Committee.

title: People-to-People Board Meeting
Scopenote: Mr. Melville Grosvenor, Chief Executive, National Geographic Society (left); with Mrs. India Edwards at the People-to-People Board Meeting.

title: Ambassador Jessup's Trip to Kyoto
Scopenote: American Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup (right) and Lois (Mrs. Philip C.) Jessup (left) at Sanjusangendo Temple in Kyoto, Japan.

title: Chairman and Vice-Chairman of the Democratic National Committee
Scopenote: Mr. William M. Boyle, Chairman, Democratic National Committee (left), with Mrs. India Edwards, Vice-Chairman, Democratic National Committee (right).

title: Des Moines Regional Conference
Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Vice-Chairman, Democratic National Committee (left) giving a visual presentation on Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan's agricultural plans at the Des Moines Regional Conference.  Also pictured: Vice-President of the United States, Alben Barkley (right).

title: India Edwards with Unidentified Guests
Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Vice-Chairman, Democratic National Committee (second from right), and unidentified guests.

title: Reception in Honor of India Edwards
Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Executive Director, Women's Division, Democratic National Committee (left); alongside Eda (Mrs. Charles) Brannan (center), and Mrs. Florence Harriman (right) at a reception honoring Edwards in Washington, D.C.

title: First Daughter Margaret Truman at Unidentified Event
Scopenote: First Daughter Margaret Truman during her trip to Brussels, Belgium. From left to right: Mrs. Perle Mesta (left), Minister to Luxembourg; Margaret Truman; Mrs. India Edwards, vice Chairman, Democratic National Committee (second from right); and Mrs. Georgia Clark, Treasurer of the United States (right).

title: President Truman and India Edwards Aboard the Whistlestop Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with Mrs. India Edwards, Executive Director, Women's Division, Democratic National Committee, during a radio interview. The President gave the interview as he traveled by train during his 1948 whistlestop Campaign.

title: India Edwards at Unidentified Event
Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Vice Chairman, Democratic National Committee (third from right), during an unidentified event.  All other individuals are unidentified.

title: India Edwards Signing Plaque
Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Democratic National Committee official (seated, second left), autographing a celebrity plaque at the Milwaukee Press Club.  All other individuals are unidentified.

title: India Edwards and Mr. Harding
Scopenote: Mrs. India Edwards, Vice Chairman, Democratic National Committee (left) with "Cap" Harding (right) at an unidentified event.

title: President Truman Shaking Hands with India Edwards
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shaking hands with India Edwards, Democratic National Committee official (second right), during a party held in Edwards' honor in Washington, D.C.  Also pictured: journalist Esther Van Wagoner Tufty (second left) and Eda (Mrs. Charles) Brannan (right). Original photo has crop marks on it.
